Thus, it is without shape or name, without sound or scent, vast enough to embrace heaven and earth, capacious enough to encompass the cosmos. That which has no ancestor above it is the Dao. The Confucians call it the Supreme Ultimate; the Buddhists call it True Emptiness; the Daoists call it the Great Void—yet their principle is one.

In human cultivation, one gathers ancestral qi from the primordial beginning, coalescing it into the Golden Mother. Circulating through the Six Voids, it is the intermingling of the Two Qi, opening and closing without cease. Over time, one pursues the Two Qi along the Yellow Path, uniting the Three Natures in the Original Palace. Then the essence of the Two and Five exquisitely conjoins and congeals, generating endlessly to form the Dharmakāya—this is the primordial Heavenly Root.

The Five Scriptures unfold and expand, universally planting spiritual numina. Without scripture, there is no illumination; without scripture, there is no clarity; without scripture, there is no establishment; without scripture, there is no completion; without scripture, there is no deliverance; without scripture, there is no generation. This is the Heaven within the Great Brahmā Heaven. The Five Scriptures are the Five Chapters of True Writ, the very texts of the Five Chapters’ dissemination. From them, heaven is generated and earth is established; flying and hidden, moving and still, all creatures possessing consciousness—every being with form and qi—are transformed and born. Thus, since the division of yin and yang, their scriptures have unfolded and expanded, universally planting the ten thousand kinds.

The Five Scriptures in heaven become the Five Stars; on earth, the Five Peaks; in humanity, the Five Phases; in things, the Five Qi. No entity, from the vastest to the most minute, is not encompassed within them. Without these scriptures, there is no illumination or clarity, no establishment or completion, no deliverance or generation—then heaven and earth and the myriad things would have no mechanism for the workings of creation.

The human body is a small heaven and earth, yet more numinous than the myriad things. The primordial One Qi is the foundation of the elixir; the Five Phases are arrayed within the crucible. Metal and Wood intermingle; Water and Fire unite in harmony; the Two Earths serve as the regulator. Within this, yin and yang are inverted, and the Hexagram of Already Crossing is achieved. When emotion returns to nature, mercury is cast into lead; when the medicine meets fire, cinnabar is produced from silver—all with the Golden Mother as their root. Flowing from wù to jǐ, upon encountering Earth, the elixir is formed.

Once the elixir is complete, its spirit and numinous transformations are unfathomable—all is the full embodiment of the Five Phases. Its radiance is like the brilliance of the sun and moon; its establishment is like the founding of heaven and earth. That which can deliver and generate is the Primordial Beginning—this is the Heaven within the Great Brahmā Heaven, encapsulating the purport of the preceding scriptural passages, hence it is said to be so. The Great Brahmā is the Great Flowing Brahmā Qi. The Heaven within Heaven is the Heaven among the Thirty-Two Heavens—none is not pervaded by the flowing Brahmā Qi, circulating without cease, just as the One Qi within the body cycles endlessly. All is the flowing of the Mandate of Heaven, the hundred vessels and nine orifices—nowhere does it not return. This is the universal distribution of Brahmā Qi.

Yuluo Xiao Terrace, Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital—above, it reaches the utmost, the Great Luo of Jade Purity, vast and boundless through kalpas, now present, now absent. Above the Great Luo Heaven lies Jade Capital Mountain, a capital made of jade, hence called Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital. The Yuluo Terrace stands above the Jade Capital, reaching the highest and most distant—above even the utmost. This is the Heaven of the Great Luo. Within it dwells the Jade Purity Golden Gate, its vastness without limit, embracing the ten thousand realms. Thus, it is boundless through kalpas, impossible to exhaust. Yet the Brahmā Qi congeals in emptiness, not to be sought through form or image—this is called "now present, now absent." For every formation and dissolution of heaven and earth is one kalpa. The realm of the Great Luo was inaugurated before the empty kalpas and remains unbroken through kalpas. *Rèn* cannot be measured or limited. Its vastness and indistinctness are one with the Great Void—without shape or name, not to be sought through traces.

Within the body, Yuluo Xiao Terrace is the region of the brain. Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital is the Mud Pill Palace. The Mud Pill is the Gate of Heaven, the mansion of the ten thousand spirits—this is the scene of the Great Luo, with Jade Purity dwelling within, vast and boundless through kalpas, now present, now absent. One’s true nature is vast and without sign, a thing within the indistinct—enduring through vast kalpas, the so-called indestructible primordial spirit. Thus, it resides above the Three Realms.

The Three Flowers depart and separate, the Great Possession’s Wondrous Court—Golden Gates and Jade Chambers, a forest of purity and limpid pools. The Great Flowing Brahmā Qi circulates through the ten directions. Master Youqi says: The Three Flowers are the Three Primordial Palaces of Jade Purity. The Upper Primordial Jade Flower, the Middle Primordial Golden Flower, the Lower Primordial Nine Flowers—here dwell the Three Primordial August Lords of the Dao, the detached palaces of Jade Purity. The Great Possession is the Highest Great Possession Jade Purity Palace, where the Heavenly Worthy presides, hence called the Wondrous Court. Three is the number of the south, the fire phase, belonging to *lí*—this is the Mud Pill region of the brain. The Golden Gates and Jade Chambers are the Crimson Palace of the Yellow Court. The forest of stars is the constellations of the celestial circuit. The limpid pools are the two ponds’ crystalline clarity—within the body, these are *kǎn* and *lí*. The Great Flowing Brahmā Qi circulating through the ten directions is the scene of the Great Luo and Jade Purity, the Brahmā Qi flowing universally through the boundless realms of the Ultimate Non-Existence. The ten thousand things all receive its moisture; the One Qi of the Primordial Beginning transforms and generates endlessly.

The Elixir Scriptures say: The Three Palaces merge and unite, gathering the Three Natures in the Original Palace. The body’s spirit, qi, and essence are the Three Flowers. The primordial spirit resides within the Numinous Terrace—this is the Wondrous Court of the Great Possession. My golden tower and jade chamber are the Golden Gates and Jade Chambers of heaven. The Five Stars and constellations, the forest of radiance within the limpid pool waters—this is the celestial fire time, the constellations and stars encircling the ascent and descent of *kǎn* and *lí*, water and fire. Within the Qian-Kun crucible, between the state of Already Crossing, the Way of the Ninefold Return of Golden Liquid is accomplished.

The Primordial True One Qi circulates day and night, cycling endlessly, all receiving the lunar essence of *kǎn*-*wù* and the solar radiance of *lí*-*jǐ*. In accordance with the advancing and retreating fire phases, through union and gentle nurturing, the Golden Embryo is formed. As it traverses the sixty-four hexagrams in full cycle, the hundred meridians return to the Origin, the nine orifices become luminously clear—is this not the pervasive circulation of the Brahman Qi, suffusing all ten directions, all becoming the scene of the limpid pool?

Within it abides the spirit that delivers people from death; within it dwells the Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen; within it resides the Great Divine Marshal who delivers the world; within it abides the Life-Nurturing Elder Han Jun; within it are the Lords of Destiny and Record of the Southern Upper Realm, who extend life and augment destiny, the Venerable Spirits who deliver from calamity—reanimating the bones and reviving the dead, delivering boundless multitudes.

Today is the day of celestial reckoning, as the hosts of heaven descend in state.

Mò’ān says: This speaks of the assembled hosts of heaven, examining the merits and transgressions of scholars. The Master of Immortals says: The Brahman Qi circulates throughout the ten directions’ domains, and within these ten directions are deities who preside over the deliverance of the world from death—this does not mean the deities themselves are immortal.

The Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen is the Great Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen, who governs the Register of Life. It is also said: He is the Great Emperor of the Vermilion Mound. The Great Divine Marshal who delivers the world is the Great Divine Marshal of the Southern Palace, who presides over world-deliverance. The Life-Nurturing Elder Han Jun governs the Upper Palace of Southern Prosperity, overseeing the Register of Longevity. The Lords of Destiny and Record of the Southern Upper Realm, who extend life and augment destiny, and the Venerable Spirits who deliver from calamity—"Southern Upper" is another name for the Grotto-Yang Palace, also called the Upper Palace of Southern Prosperity or the Venerable Spirits of the Vermilion Mound Fire Mansion, namely the Six True Lords of the Southern Dipper. From "within it abides the spirit that delivers people" to the Southern Culmen’s various perfected ones, though each is assigned to a specific office, all possess the power to reanimate the bones and revive the dead, delivering people across kalpas without limit. Thus, world-deliverance is boundless.

The spirits within the body each reside within the Crimson Palace, the Mysterious Pass, and the Mud Pill Palace—hence it is said "within it." The so-called Southern Culmen and Southern Prosperity are the heart. The scripture says: The boundless great spirits all arise from my own body. The adept who refines the Golden Liquid and tempers the form will thereafter attain the wondrous union of form and spirit, and may circulate through the ten directions, delivering the world, averting calamity, reanimating the bones, and reviving the dead.

"Today is the day of celestial reckoning"—"today" refers to the first kalpa of the Red Clarity, the day of unfolding the register and reckoning in the Great Floating Li Land. It is the day of weighing transgressions and blessings, recording merits and faults, when the divine kings and great sages of the ten directions descend in state to assemble, heeding the Heavenly Worthy’s proclamation of deliverance.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Eastern Direction;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Southern Direction, Flying;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Western Direction, Cloud;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Northern Direction, Mirrorless;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Northeastern Direction, Brahman;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Southeastern Direction, Nāyu;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Southwestern Direction, Delivering Immortals;
The Primordial Ultimate Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Primordial Boundless Deliverer of the Northwestern Direction, Juéwú;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Upper Direction, Ying;
The Boundless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Great Sage of Longevity, and Boundless Deliverer of the Lower Direction, Luo.

The Flying Heavenly Great Sages of the ten directions are all emanations of the Primordial Beginning’s Dao-realm, transformed through qi.

Bīnghú Xū Xiùzhāo says: The Great Sages of Longevity of the ten directions are the Heavenly Worthies of Salvation from Suffering of the ten directions. From the day of unfolding the register, they receive the Primordial Beginning’s mandate to oversee the reckoning of merits in the ten directions and three realms, delivering boundless multitudes, encompassing life and death, and refining adepts.

The *Daoist Canon* states: In the eight directions, all heavens contain boundless great-thousand worlds. The Boundless Heavens of the Eastern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Āndà Tángxiāng, the Realm of Gathering Goodness; the Boundless Heavens of the Southern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Wǎnlí Chéngjìng, the Realm of Abandoning the Worthy; the Boundless Heavens of the Western Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Fútáng Zhōu, the Realm of Universal Conduct; the Boundless Heavens of the Northern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Yùdān Yě, the Realm of Purity; the Boundless Heavens of the Northeastern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Fújídū, the Realm of Eternal Peace; the Boundless Heavens of the Southeastern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Yuánfútián, the Realm of Primordial Goodness; the Boundless Heavens of the Southwestern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Yánfú Xiāng, the Realm of the Seven Tranquilities; the Boundless Heavens of the Northwestern Direction contain the Great Thousand World of Fúdé Yě, the Realm of Extending the Worthy; the Upper Direction contains the Thirty-Six Heavens of the Upper Clarity Jade Perfection and the Boundless World of Xuándū; the Lower Direction contains the Thirty-Two Heavens of Huángzēng and the Eight Round Boundless Worlds.

It is also said: The hosts of the Five Marchmounts, the Five Emperors, the Grotto-Yin, the Pure Numinous, the Northern Capital, and the Luòfēng’s various offices—these Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the ten directions all hold the office of bestowing longevity and delivering the world. Thus, they are called the Great Sages of Longevity. From kalpa to kalpa, they deliver people to attain the Dao and achieve perfection without limit—this is called the Boundless Deliverer of People.

The perfected Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the ten directions, the boundless great spirits of longevity and world-deliverance, all ride upon flying clouds. Their cinnabar chariots and green canopies, jade wheels and feathered parasols, are drawn by vermilion phoenixes and five-colored dark dragons. They bear nine-colored standards and ten spirit-streamers of absolute purity. Ahead, nine phoenixes cry in unison; behind, eight simurghs sing in harmony. Lions and white cranes roar and chant in melodious chorus.

All these are the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings of the ten directions and the boundless great spirits—all are the perfected of heaven.

Qīngyuán says: Chariots, canopies, wheels, and parasols are all formed from the qi of yang essence; phoenixes, dragons, lions, and cranes are all transformations of the qi of yin essence. The supreme sages, possessing the Dao of true constancy, inhale and exhale, gather and disperse, manifesting at will. When the qi of yin and yang harmonize, songs and melodies arise—all are the work of qi, not external things.

When the practice of returning the elixir reaches completion, the yin demons are also transformed. With a single breath of the yang spirit’s primordial qi, the ten thousand spirits all heed its call. The divine spirits of the five viscera each manifest in their directional colors. Chariots, brushes, and ceremonial escorts come to welcome the hundred bones, with the host of spirits leading and following, ascending to pay homage at the Origin—no different from the assembly of the Heavenly Perfected and Great Sages. The Five Elders clear the path, while the multitude of immortals flank the carriage, myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arriving upon the floating void.

As the radiant light pours forth and the celestial chariot turns back, they oversee the Perfected and deliver the living. The Great Sages of the ten directions, exalted in their Dao ranks, are thus moved to have the Five Emperors lead the way, with the throng of immortals as their attendants—hence the myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arrive upon the floating void, riding the luminous scenery.

The Five Elders are:
- The Eastern Azure Spirit, First Elder, surnamed Guan, named Kai, styled Lingwei Yang;
- The Southern Cinnabar Spirit, True Elder, surnamed Dongfu, named Jiyan, styled Chibiao Nu;
- The Central Primordial Spirit, Primordial Elder, surnamed Tongban, named Yuanshi, styled Han Shuniu;
- The Western Radiant Spirit, August Elder, surnamed Shangjin, named Changkai, styled Yaopo Bao;
- The Northern Dark Spirit, Mysterious Elder, surnamed Heijie, named Linghui, styled Yin Houju.

The Five Emperors are all naturally divine Heavenly Perfected, transformed from the wondrous workings of the ancestral qi into the five phases—these are the five qi. Thus they are called the Primordial Five Elders, not those who attain Perfection through accumulated study. From the moment they receive their mandate and descend with their talismans, each presides over a direction. Only when the great kalpas cycle anew do their positions change.

Therefore:
- The East pertains to Wood, governing spring, commanding the birth of the myriad things;
- The South pertains to Fire, governing summer, commanding the growth of the myriad things;
- The Center pertains to Earth, flourishing in all four seasons, harmonizing the myriad things;
- The West pertains to Metal, governing autumn, commanding the fruition of the myriad things;
- The North pertains to Water, governing winter, commanding the storage of the myriad things.

This is what is meant by the orderly distribution of the five qi. The five phases are the upright qi of the Dharmakāya. The Fire Dragon and Water Tiger, in inverted flow, circulate within the crucible. When the ten thousand spirits gather in the Nine Palaces, the five qi pay homage at the Origin, and the hundred numina guard the body—just as the thousand chariots and ten thousand riders arrive upon the floating void.

The "pouring light" refers to the flowing essence of jade radiance. The "turning chariot" refers to the flying clouds of the cinnabar firmament. When the Great Sages of the ten directions assemble at the Emperor’s abode, their wheel hubs revolve, and the Heavenly Honored One’s dharma throne oversees the host of Perfected, examining and measuring the ranks of all beings.

Within, one turns the true light inward to illumine the numinous palace. When Kan and Li are conjoined, lead and mercury merge, the spirit does not stray outward, and the six reins are all stilled. Only then does the yang light pour downward, the yin dregs refine upward, and the true spirit transform and generate, naturally overseeing the Perfected and delivering the living, circulating through the ten directions.

The Chancellors of the Various Heavens, the Southern Palace of Supreme Prosperity, the Han Director of Records, and the Great Spirit Who Oversees Birth—all holding registers and ledgers—gather before the Emperor. According to those who ought to be delivered, they strictly examine the heavens. Mo’an says: This describes the assembly of the various heavens to review the merits and transgressions of scholars and the karmic fortunes of worldly people.

The Chancellors of the Various Heavens are the Divine Lords of the Great Ultimate of the Boundless. The Southern Palace of Supreme Prosperity is the Vermilion Numinous Fire Mansion, located in the Heaven of Radiant Harmony and Yang Brilliance. The Han Director is the Venerable Han Elder, who oversees the refinement and registration of records. The Great Spirit Who Oversees Birth holds the office of delivering souls and bestowing rebirth. The registers and ledgers record the merits, transgressions, sins, and blessings of scholars and worldly people. The various subordinate spirits, bearing the registers and ledgers, assemble before the Heavenly Honored One to measure merits and bestow blessings, universally delivering humans and devas.

They examine those who ought to be delivered:
- Some, whose names are inscribed in the Mysterious Chart from past lives, possess bone configurations suited for immortality;
- Some, through fasting and upholding precepts, have accumulated merits and evoked resonance;
- Some, through revering the Three Treasures, have amassed virtuous deeds that reach the heavens;
- Some, through offering to the Teacher and the Treasure, have been commended by the Three Officials.

Those whose names are recorded in the various heavens undergo strict examination of their ledgers. Based on their merits, their ranks are measured, and according to their superiority or inferiority, they receive promotion and deliverance.

Guanfu says: The above is the main text, narrated by the Jade Dawn Dao Lord. It universally creates the Three Realms, the Boundless Divine Homeland, the Yellow Springs’ Curved Mansion, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, and the Twelve River Sources.

The Three Realms are the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm. The Boundless Divine Homeland refers to the boundless worlds of the ten directions. The Yellow Springs’ Curved Mansion is the long-night mansion of the Nine Dark Regions. The Northern Capital of Fengdu is a great sea in the lower realm’s true north, filled with foul and putrid vapors, its boundaries unfathomable. Within it stands a mountain, its summit piercing the azure heavens and its base descending into the wind springs, formed from the coiled black vapors—this is called the Northern Capital of Fengdu Mountain. There is a great cavern called the Palace of Yin Radiance. Within it lie thirty-six hells, governed by the Heavenly Lord of Grand Yin. Inside are six caverns, each presided over by a Great Demon King of the Six Heavens:

1. The Palace of Zhōu’s Absolute Yin,
2. The Palace of Tài’s Lethal Judgment,
3. The Palace of Míng’s Enduring Offenses,
4. The Palace of Tián’s Illuminating Sin,
5. The Palace of Zōng’s Seven Transgressions,
6. The Palace of Gǎn’s Daring Connections.

If one can uphold the names of these six caverns with constant reverence and awe, the demon kings will protect and recommend them, erasing their sinful names. In life and death, they will receive blessings without end.

The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus refer to the Offices of Heaven, Earth, and Water, which govern the Three Primes and examine the records. The Upper Prime’s Heavenly Official is subordinate to the Jade Clarity Realm, establishing three palaces, nine bureaus, and thirty-six departments. The Middle Prime’s Earthly Official is subordinate to the Highest Clarity Realm, establishing three palaces, nine bureaus, and forty-two departments. The Lower Prime’s Water Official is subordinate to the Grand Clarity Realm, establishing three palaces, nine bureaus, and forty-two departments. The officials and subordinates of the Middle and Lower Primes are all souls of the deceased who have accumulated merits, received deliverance, and obtained positions. They serve according to their term limits, and upon fulfilling their merits, ascend to the heavenly bureaus. Those whose merits are incomplete return to be reborn among humans.

The Nine Bureaus are also called the Nine Mounds of the Earthly Sovereign’s Nine Commands. The Twelve River Sources refer to the moon as the essence of the Great Yin and the mother of all waters; the Eastern Well is the source of the Celestial River, where all waters converge. The Great Yin completes one revolution of the heavens each month, thus passing the Eastern Well in all twelve months, where it showers the sweet dew of the Yellow Blossom to cleanse and refine the souls of the dead. These souls also rely on this process to purify their forms before ascending to the Southern Palace for deliverance.

The human heart is the Southern Prosperity, which is the Vermilion Mound Palace. As the scripture states: *"The boundless light of the Numinous Treasure illumines the scorching pools of affliction."* When the heart is empty, the divine light shines through. Below the kidney region lies the dark and winding Palace of the Hidden Yin Springs, which is the Northern Capital of Fengdu.

By employing my true light to illuminate the darkness and circulating the true water of the Great Yin from the Eastern Well to cleanse the hidden souls, they are then tempered with the true fire of the Southern Li of the Great Yang. Thus, even the ethereal souls of the Realm of the Utmost Divinity are universally delivered.

This practice absolves the sins of ancestors and parents across countless kalpas, swiftly erasing their names from the ledgers of transgressions and extinguishing the roots of evil, preventing them from being confined or forced into the ranks of ghosts. The ancestors of humanity—if their descendants fail to cultivate goodness and accumulate virtue—will inevitably suffer calamities, sinking into the depths with no hope of escape. However, those who know to uphold the teachings of the scriptures, turn toward goodness, and spread blessings will absolve the sins of their ancestors and distant kin, enabling all to attain deliverance.

The *Guān Fù* states: *"Whenever the Three Officials conduct their records, if descendants perform great deeds, the Jade Emperor issues a decree to immediately deliver the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages of forebears."* When one person receives deliverance, nine generations of ancestors receive grace. Thus, their names are swiftly erased from the ledgers of transgressions, and the roots of evil are extinguished.

The *roots of evil* refer to the inherent nature of wicked thoughts, while the *ledgers of transgressions* are the records of sins—both minor and grave—kept by the underworld authorities. Through the mercy of deliverance, their karmic burdens are greatly pardoned, the roots of evil are eradicated, and their names are stricken from the records. Even the underworld authorities cannot detain them or force them into the ranks of ghosts. All kin across countless kalpas ascend through universal deliverance.

Those who know the path of cultivation are not swayed by worldly vanities or clouded by desires; their essence remains serene, their nature perfectly attuned and luminously wondrous. Thus, the Three Corpses and Six Bandits cannot disturb them with defilement. With prolonged cultivation, the myriad qi gather at the Gate of Life, and the hundred spirits guard the Gate of Death, preventing them from sinking into the bitter realms. Countless generations of ancestors and forebears all ascend in turn.

The Mandate of the Primordial Beginning ensures timely ascension. The Cold Pool of the Northern Capital oversees the protection of form and soul, restrains demons, and recommends deliverance to the Southern Palace. Refined souls of the dead are transformed into immortals, while the living who receive deliverance endure across kalpas. As the kalpas turn, they share the same lifespan as Heaven, forever escaping the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties. They transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Highest Clarity.

*Mò Ān* says: *"This speaks of the refinement of the scholar’s ancestors and the deliverance of the scholar themselves."* The Mandate of the Primordial Beginning, such as the Heaven-Granting Precious Register of the Numinous Treasure tradition, the Nine Dragon Talismans for Salvation from Suffering, and the various true talismans and writs, are all decrees issued by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy to the Nine Heavens and Nine Offices, commanding their enforcement across the Three Realms and the Ten Directions. Thus, ascension occurs at every moment.

The Cold Pool of the Northern Capital is the winding Hidden Springs of Fengdu. *Overseeing the protection of form and soul* means that when a person dies, their form perishes and their soul scatters; the Northern Emperor, by decree, oversees and protects the departed souls to prevent their dispersal. By restraining and instructing the Demon Kings to recommend them, they are delivered to the Vermilion Mound of the Southern Palace. The refined souls of the dead, dwelling in the darkest and most yin of palaces, receive the compassionate light of the Heavenly Worthy. When a single spark of true yang is kindled within, the darkness is illuminated, yin is purified, and yang is made whole. Thus, they are transformed into immortals.

Those who cultivate the scriptural teachings and refine their form and spirit receive deliverance in life, preserving their human form across kalpas and ensuring the eternal existence of their true nature. *As the kalpas turn, they share the same lifespan as Heaven* means that while the kalpas inevitably decay and those bound by form and qi are subject to the cycle of rebirth, the enlightened ones—whose wondrous essence is beyond form—remain unbroken across endless kalpas, sharing the same longevity as Heaven and Earth.

*Forever escaping the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties*: The Three Paths are the first, the Gate of Sensual Desire, the celestial path of the Upper Corpse; the second, the Gate of Attachment, the human path of the Middle Corpse; and the third, the Gate of Greed, the earthly path of the Lower Corpse. These are also called the Three Evils, which obstruct the path to immortality. The Five Sufferings are: sensuality burdens the heart, attachment burdens the spirit, greed burdens the form, vanity burdens the essence, and the body burdens the soul. Together with the Three Paths, these constitute the Eight Difficulties.

Those who know the Way of returning to the root and restoring life, who gather their emotions and return to their nature, abandoning delusion to return to truth, purify their Three Actions and Six Roots, revealing the singular truth while all illusions dissolve. By circulating the primordial qi of the Primordial Beginning within the union of Kan and Li, they refine the soul and forge the spirit, severing the earthly root to realize the heavenly root. Thus, the souls of the dead receive refinement, the living receive deliverance, and the Three Realms cannot bind them. They instantly transcend the leakless and roam freely in the realm of the Highest Clarity.

The Heaven of Highest Clarity is ruled by the Jade Perfected Heavenly Emperor, a realm of formless purity and ascetic practice. *Yōu Qī* says: *"Among the heavens of Highest Clarity, the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors are the most exalted."* Their Dao is equal to that of the Primordial Beginning, and their rank is among the Jade Clarity. Thus, they are called the Jade Perfected. This refers to the thirty-six heavens below Highest Clarity, distinct from the thirty-two heavens. They possess radiance but no form, hence they are called *ascetic practice*.

*Ascetic practice* is the Dao within the Dao, the Heaven within Heaven, transcending all barriers, the unobstructed true emptiness. The *Dragon’s Hoof Scripture* also states: *"The twelve heavens of Highest Clarity are the abodes of the Nine Perfected, where the Jade Perfected Heavenly Emperor reigns as the sovereign of the heavens."* His body is crystalline and luminous, his qi governs the utmost truth. Through pure cultivation, he is called the Jade Perfected.

The preceding text speaks of roaming freely in Highest Clarity, while this section specifically explains that the Heavenly Emperor of Highest Clarity resides above the formless realm, refining his ascetic practice to realize the Dao and attain perfection.

**The Eight Heavens of the East:**
Default Annotation states: This sequence of thirty-two heavens follows a common version, but here the *Primordial Numinous Writ, Upper Scroll* is appended, wherein the Dao Lord composed nine characters—this should not be followed. From Yellow Pervasive Heaven to the Seven Luminaries Heaven, the Primordial Beginning accumulated nine yang breaths of pure qi to form six heavens: two heavens of the Desire Realm and four heavens of the Form Realm. The Desire Realm comprises six heavens, which are the lower realm. The people of these heavens possess form and desire, becoming attached through contact with things; when the six roots of desire are purified, they ascend to the Form Realm.

- **Grand August Yellow Pervasive Heaven:** Emperor Yulan Yuming. The correct pronunciation is *Opening Mystery, Gathering Light*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner name is Yulan, and the demonic hidden sound is Yuming.
- **Grand Brightness Jade Perfection Heaven:** Emperor Xu’anatian. The correct pronunciation is *Preserving Mystery, Dao Spirit*; the Heavenly King’s inner text is Xu’a, and the hidden sound is Natian.
- **Luminous Harmonious Youth Heaven:** Emperor Yuanyu Qijing. The correct pronunciation is *Bright Life, Nine Perfected*; the Heavenly King’s hidden name is Yuanyu the Perfected, and the inner text is Qijing.
- **Mysterious Womb Level Nurturing Heaven:** Emperor Duineixian. The correct pronunciation is *Floating Brush, Silent*; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Liu Duineixian.
- **Primordial Brightness Literary Elevation Heaven:** Emperor Chou Falun. The correct pronunciation is *Opening Life, Spreading*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Chou, and his alternate title is Falun.
- **Upper Brightness Seven Luminaries Majestic Heaven:** Emperor Tianhuaiyan. The correct pronunciation is *Extending Void Brightness*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner sound is Tianhuai, and his hidden title is Yan.
- **Void Transcending Balance Heaven:** Emperor Zhengdingguang. The correct pronunciation is *Mirror Without Tilt*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Zhengdingguang.
- **Grand Ultimate Veiled Heaven:** Emperor Quyu Jiuchang. The correct pronunciation is *Ananda Pure Brightness*; the Heavenly King’s hidden title is Quyu, and the general text is Jiuchang.

**The Eight Heavens of the South:**
The Primordial Beginning accumulated three yang breaths of pure qi to form eight heavens: four heavens of the Form Realm, four heavens of the Foothill Dust, and the Fine Dust.

- **Vermilion Brightness Harmonious Yang Heaven:** Emperor Lijin Shangzhen. The correct pronunciation is *Governing Peace, Preserving Immortality*; the Heavenly King’s hidden title is Lijin Shangzhen.
- **Mysterious Brightness Reverent Splendor Heaven:** Emperor Kongyao Chouyin. The correct pronunciation is *Flying Sound, Cavern Spirit*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Kongyao Chouyin.
- **Radiant Brightness Ancestral Drifting Heaven:** Emperor Chongguangming. The correct pronunciation is *Tilted Perfected Hero*; the Heavenly Emperor’s general title is Chongguangming.
- **Bamboo Grove August Reed Heaven:** Emperor Moyi Miaobian. The correct pronunciation is *Difficult Mystery Brightness*; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden name is Moyi, and his inner sound is Miaobian.
- **Void Brightness Hall Radiance Heaven:** Emperor A’lou Sheng. The correct pronunciation is *Enveloping Mystery Brightness*; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden sound is A’fanyin, and his title is Sheng.
- **Observing Brightness Upright Tranquility Heaven:** Emperor Yumiluoqian. The correct pronunciation is *Clear Observation, Shining Brightness*; the Heavenly Emperor’s hidden text is Yumi, and his inner title is Luoqian.
- **Mysterious Brightness Reverent Celebration Heaven:** Emperor Longluo Puti. The correct pronunciation is *Majestic Clarity, Dao Mystery*; the Flying Heaven’s inner sound is Longluo, and the Heavenly Lord’s hidden title is Puti.
- **Grand Resplendent Ultimate Jade Heaven:** Emperor Wanli Wuyan. The correct pronunciation is *Cavern Perfected, Eternal Observation*; the Heavenly King’s inner text is Wanli Wuyan.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
From Transcending Balance Heaven to Vow Heaven, the Primordial Beginning accumulated seven yang breaths of pure qi to form two heavens of the Form Realm: six Fine Dusts and six Light Dusts. The Form Realm comprises eighteen heavens, which are the middle realm. The people of these heavens possess form but no desire, yet they have six colors and eighteen dusts; when the six dusts are all purified, they ascend to the Formless Realm.

- **Primordial Support Celestial Ascent Heaven:** Emperor Kaizhendingguang. The correct pronunciation is *Opening Light, Perfecting Perfection*; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Kaiyin, and his hidden name is Zhendingguang.
- **Grand Peace August Cliff Heaven:** Emperor Polou Hetan. The correct pronunciation is *Radiance, None, A Soul*; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Polou, and the demonic inner name is Atan.

- **Grand August Multitude Floating Countenance Heaven:** Emperor Minbakuang. The correct pronunciation is *Kindness, Majesty, Light*; the Heavenly Lord’s inner text is Minbakuang.

These four heavens are the realm of the Seed People, the upper realm. Here, the utterly perfected are without emotion, and the people are transformed through birth; both form and desire are empty, and cultivation reaches this heaven.

- **Luminous Courtyard Rosy Span Heaven:** Emperor Huijuehun. The correct pronunciation is *Primordial Clarity Brightness*; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Huijuehun.
- **Abyssal Penetration Primordial Cavern Heaven:** Emperor Fanxing Guansheng. The correct pronunciation is *Dharma Power, Dao Light*; the Heavenly Lord’s inner sound is Fanxing, and his hidden name is Guansheng.

- **Grand Simplicity Elegant Joy Forbidden Upper Heaven:** Emperor Longluo Juechang. The correct pronunciation is *Yang Majesty, Shining Clarity*; the Heavenly Emperor’s inner text is Longluo Juechang.

The above correct texts were all spoken by the Most High Lord of the Dao, Yuanshi Tianzun.

**Observing Return** states: These jade taboos and jade sounds of the various heavens are all inscribed in vermilion characters upon azure crystal, concealed within the Highest Clarity Heaven. From **August Sovereign Heaven** to **Forbidden Upper Heaven**, these constitute the Three Realms—namely, the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm.

The Realm of Desire comprises six heavens, from **August Sovereign Heaven** to **Seven Luminaries Heaven**. The beings of these heavens possess form and desire, clinging to sensory objects. In the first two heavens, desire is fulfilled through bodily union; in the next two, through hand-touching; in the fifth, through spoken words; and in the sixth, through gazing. As they engage in carnal desire and the union of yin and yang, this is called the Realm of Desire. Due to their indulgence in pleasure, they swiftly decline and decay; when their lifespans end, they sink once more into the various destinies. Those who cultivate and purify the six sense roots may ascend to the Realm of Form, which is the Middle Realm.

The Realm of Form consists of eighteen heavens, from **Transcendent Balance Heaven** to **Vow-Pledge Heaven**. The beings of these heavens possess six colors and eighteen dusts—six coarse dusts, six fine dusts, and six subtle dusts. When one dust is purified, they ascend one heaven; when all eighteen dusts are purified, they ascend to the Formless Realm, which is the Upper Realm.

The **Perfect Unity True Regulations** states: In the Formless Realm, the perfected are without emotion, do not engage in yin-yang union, and are born through transformation. They subsist solely on true qi, no longer possessing physical form. Upon attaining the first heaven, they preserve only mind and consciousness to enter qi-contemplation; if mind and consciousness are dissolved, they ascend in succession. If all habitual tendencies are forgotten and they are unattached to existence or nonexistence, they penetrate into spontaneity and ascend to the **Seed-People Heaven**. When the great kalpa turns, water and fire do not reach them, only the vast wind. From **Filial Might Heaven** to **Cloud-Passage Heaven**, the six heavens are destroyed by wind. From **Primal Cavern Heaven** to **Elegant Joy Heaven**, the primal qi disperses and recombines, beyond all kalpas.

From **Constant Fusion Heaven** to **Pacified Nurturance Heaven** are the Four Seed-People Heavens, where one penetrates the true Dao. Thus, the **Scripture of the Origin** states: "When habitual tendencies are exhausted, one transcends the rank of the Seed-People Heaven." The **Perfect Unity True Regulations** says: Ascending the four heavens, one penetrates the realm of the Dao, rising and falling with the qi, untouched by calamity.

**Xue Youqi** says: The thirty-two heavens of the four directions are the Four Brahma Heavens. The Heavenly Emperors and Perfected Ones possess distinct forms, yet though their true appearances exist, they move in and out of emptiness without obstruction. For the four directions each contain eight heavens, all formed from accumulated Brahma-qi. The inner names and hidden taboos of each Heavenly Emperor are likewise manifestations of Brahma-qi congealing in emptiness. The Heavenly Worthy expounds these to deliver the world—hence the inexhaustible establishment of scriptural teachings, upon which the cycles of birth and death depend.

The thirty-two heavens, thirty-two emperors, hidden taboos of the heavens, hidden names, hidden rhymes—all are the naturally resonant numinous chapters of the heavens’ emptiness, the sounds within the heavens, the venerables within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens, the great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens. Nine harmonizes with ten, transforming to ascend to Highest Clarity, an unfathomable profundity beyond full comprehension. The divine perfected are dispersed to universally deliver heavenly and mortal beings.

**Mo’an** says: These names and taboos of the Heavenly Emperors are the wondrous manifestations of the heavens’ empty void, naturally formed from qi. Within the thirty-two heavens are thirty-two emperors, and the hidden taboos, hidden names, and hidden rhymes of the heavens are all formed from Brahma-qi congealing in emptiness—this is the "intermingled void-qi" spoken of in the *Chapter on Generating the Spirit*, hence called the *Naturally Numinous Chapters*. The sounds within the heavens are the lingering echoes of the hidden rhymes. The venerables within the heavens are the thirty-two emperors. The spirits and numina within the heavens are all the wondrous functions of Brahma-qi, ineffably divine. The great demons are the Five Heavenly Demon Kings.

"Nine harmonizes with ten": Nine is the completion of yang numbers; ten is the culmination of yin numbers. This is the function of yin and yang. By fully realizing the wondrous workings of yin and yang, one achieves boundless transformation and directly attains the realm of Highest Clarity. Highest Clarity is the ethereal, pure qi, belonging to the celestial image; *Qian* is the utmost of the six yang, the harmony of nine; *Kun* is the utmost of the six yin, the union of ten. The marvels of the Great Elixir’s fire talisman are fully contained herein. The unfathomable profundities cannot be exhaustively described—these are the hidden taboos and hidden rhymes that cannot be fully recounted.

"Dispersing the divine perfected" refers to the meaning of "dispersal" in the five sections below. The "divine perfected" are the spirits within the heavens. The wondrous patterns and profound models are expounded and unfolded within the empty void, thus universally delivering heavenly and mortal beings, who receive the blessings of life and death.

Some take this as the preface of the **Jade Dawn Dao Lord**, recounting what Yuanshi Tianzun has spoken—these are all essential passages of the true scriptures, not to be interrupted and then resumed.

Today is a joyous occasion of receiving deliverance, passing through the various heavens, beseeching the extinction of the Three Evils, severing the earthly root, flying through the Five Gates, having one’s name recorded in the Great Mystery, with the Demon Kings overseeing and lifting restrictions at the Heavenly Gates.

"Today" refers to the day when Yuanshi Tianzun transmitted the scripture to the Dao Lord. The Dao Lord joyously received deliverance, passing through the various heavens. On the day the Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture, all the heavens assembled—this was the occasion to proclaim to the heavens, commanding them to compassionately deliver beings, extinguish the Three Evils, sever the earthly root, pass through the Five Gates, and thereafter have their names recorded in the Great Mystery.

The Three Evils are the Three Wretched Paths.

The *earthly root* refers to the fundamental nature within the hells. The *Five Gates* are the Five Sufferings. Once humans and heavenly beings receive deliverance through the scriptural teachings, the Three Evils and Five Gates are all eradicated, and the root-nature of the hells is likewise severed. Thus, their names are recorded above in the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Metropolis, and the Demon Kings of the Three Realms all act as guarantors, ascending through the Heavenly Gates without further restraint.

Those who cultivate the scriptural teachings and inwardly illumine the Dao of the Ten Revolutions of the Great Elixir—with the Three Actions and Six Roots wholly purified—find the wheel of suffering and the bonds of sin entirely dissolved into emptiness. Once the Golden Mother germinates and the sacred embryo is perfected, true *qi* flows through all the heavens. The yang spirit departs the body, the Three Realms merge as one, and even the mighty Demon Kings raise their hands in praise and submission, ascending through the Heavenly Gates without hindrance. How then could the earthly root remain unsevered? Yet this cannot be attained without the utmost accumulation of merit and practice. If one’s movements are obstructed by external demons, the earthly root cannot be cut—how much less could one transcend and enter the Heavenly Gates? Let the scholar take heed.

The Eastern Dipper governs fate, the Western Dipper records names, the Northern Dipper decrees death, the Southern Dipper grants life, and the Central Dipper, the Great Chief, oversees all spirits. The Eastern Dipper has five stars, the Western Dipper four, the Northern Dipper seven, the Southern Dipper six, and the Central Dipper three. Some take the seven lunar lodges of the east, south, west, and north as the Four Directional Dippers, with the Northern Dipper as the Central Dipper. As the *Treatise on the Celestial Offices* states: "The Dipper is the Emperor’s chariot, revolving at the center, governing the four directions, and observing omens." The *True Unity Formula* also says: "Within the Dipper itself are five dippers: Yang Brightness is the Eastern Dipper, Yin Essence the Western Dipper, Cinnabar Prime the Southern Dipper, the Northern Culmen the Northern Dipper, and the Celestial Pass the Central Dipper." The teachings hold that Heaven takes the Dipper as its heart, hence it is said: "The Heavenly Curses point where it turns, day and night without cease." The Central Dipper’s Great Chief is the Chief Star, and thus the Northern Dipper is called the Celestial Pivot, rightfully occupying the center as the sovereign of all spirits. Hence it oversees all spirits.

Humans take the heart as their Dipper; the heart’s seven orifices mirror the Dipper’s number. The heart resides at the center of the body, governing the five organs and serving as the abode of spirit and luminosity. Once the scholar of Heaven and humanity receives deliverance, the Four Dippers inscribe their fate, record their names, decree death, and grant life, while the Central Dipper presides over all, with myriad spirits guarding the body. For those who refine the elixir, the fire tally of the celestial cycle is inwardly activated by the Celestial Stem, circulating through the twenty-eight lunar lodges and seventy-two seasonal nodes. With yang fire and yin tally in harmonious balance, the elixir is perfected and the Dao fulfilled.

The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul, the White Emperor attends the po-soul, the Vermilion Emperor nurtures *qi*, the Black Emperor circulates blood, and the Yellow Emperor presides at the center, with all spirits subject to none other. Mo’an says: "This speaks of the correlative body, corresponding to the *River Chart*. The wondrous interplay of the Three and Five is the body of generation and completion." The Five Emperors in Heaven are the Five Phases; on Earth, the Five Peaks; and in humans, the spirits of the five viscera. The Azure Emperor’s surname is Chang, his given name Jingming, and he guards the hun-soul, governing the liver. The White Emperor’s surname is Hun, his given name Zangshou, and he attends the po-soul, governing the lungs. The Vermilion Emperor’s surname is Yan, his given name Dongdan, and he nurtures *qi*, governing the heart. The Black Emperor’s surname is Xuan, his given name Mingmeng, and he circulates blood, governing the kidneys. The Yellow Emperor’s surname is Ma, his given name Zhongshen, and he presides at the Yellow Court, commanding all spirits.

The *Record of the Five Emperors of the Great Cavern* states: "The Five Emperors exist coeval with Heaven and Earth. When yin and yang first divided, they transformed and gave birth to the Five Phases." In the numinous treasure teachings, they are the Five Emperors of red apricots, needle-grinding, sock-wax, and ink-blackness. The liver guards the hun-soul, restraining the three hun; the lungs attend the po-soul, controlling the seven po. The heart governs the nurturing of *qi*, the kidneys store essence, and when water and fire mutually support each other, the two *qi* unite. Those who receive deliverance undergo refinement and rebirth, as the Five Emperors descend their *qi*, transforming and generating the five viscera to complete the Five Phases. Thereafter, they ascend to the Southern Palace in graded ranks—this is the embryo of the five viscera coalescing into an infant. For those who refine the elixir, mastering the art of gathering and inverting the Five Phases, a single *qi* circulates through the Central Yellow Palace, and all spirits merge within the nine orifices. The Five Emperors descend their spirits to refine the golden liquor and descend their *qi* to coalesce the embryo. Over time, the Five *Qi* return to the origin, lead and mercury are captured and controlled, and they return to true earth—thus the elixir is perfected. The Immortal Master says: "Essence, spirit, hun, po, and intent transform into purple gold frost."

The Azure Heaven Demon King is Bayuan Choubo; the Vermilion Heaven Demon King, Futian Danshi; the White Heaven Demon King, Fanshan Liumu; the Black Heaven Demon King, Jianchou Langfu; and the Yellow Heaven Demon King, Hengtian Danli. The Five Great Demon Emperors are the lords of all spirits. They fly and drum in procession, commanding ghostly legions, brandishing banners and beating drums as they roam the vast heavens. Proclaiming their own glory, all heavens acknowledge their merit. Ascending to deliver beings, they sternly govern the Northern Feng. The Divine Lords receive their mandate to universally sweep away inauspiciousness. The Eight Mighties spew poison, fierce horses spread in four directions. Heavenly Soldiers lead the vanguard, great marshals wield banners. Fire is hurled for ten thousand leagues, flowing bells resound in eight directions. Should any dare to challenge or obstruct the Perfected Ones, the Golden Axe executes them, the Giant Heavenly Queen metes out punishment. Ghostly wraiths are butchered, wind and fire never cease. Thousands upon thousands are beheaded, myriads upon myriads have their forms obliterated. Demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not manifest as specters. The Three Officials of the Northern Feng clearly inspect the ghostly camps, permitting no concealment, as the Golden Horse relays the message. Universally proclaimed without end, all spirits heed the command. The Five Emperors of the Three Realms declare it to the Supreme Clarity.

Mo’an says: "This speaks of the flowing function, corresponding to the *Luo Writing*’s nine-and-one numerology." The Five Heavenly Demon Kings’ four-character titles denote their positions, the middle two their given names, and the final two their courtesy names. The Azure Heaven Demon King’s surname is Fu, his given name Chicheng.

The Red Heaven Demon King’s surname is Fo, his given name Yousu. The White Heaven Demon King’s surname is Chi, his given name Zhangshi. The Black Heaven Demon King’s surname is Xu, his given name Zhishi. The Yellow Heaven Demon King’s surname is Tianmen, his given name Bokuang. All preside over greed and desire, depleting and agitating the spirit’s qi, obstructing and corrupting the conditions of the Dao—hence they are called Demon Kings. The Five Great Demon Emperors are the Demon Kings beneath the Five Heavens. Dwelling at the head of the myriad spirits, they are called the Ancestors. They correspond to the five sense organs of the human body.

The *Hidden Writ of Jade Clarity* states: "The Five Demon Emperors command their officials and subordinates, born together with Heaven, and constantly harass those who study the Dao, unwilling to see them succeed. They further boast before the Celestial Emperors of the various heavens, equating their sagely achievements. Later, during the Dragon Han era when the charts were revealed, they submitted to the transformation of the Primordial Beginning. Thus the *Hymn of Pacing the Void* says: 'The Demon Kings respectfully receive their duties, and thus are able to attend upon the various heavens.' This speaks of the Demon Kings composing songs to disrupt and confuse scholars. After submitting to the transformation of the Primordial Beginning, they thereafter specialized solely in testing through demonic trials. Flying and drumming, they lead their ghostly troops—this speaks of their flight through the Three Realms, drumming and commanding their ghostly soldiers as attendants. Waving banners and beating drums, they style themselves as resplendent. This speaks of their brandishing of flags and banners, dancing with standards and drums, roaming and observing above the Great Void, proclaiming their resplendent merit equal to that of the various heavens."

When the heavens deliver humankind, they strictly command the Northern Feng—namely, the Northern Capital of Luo Feng. When the heavens open to deliver humankind, they first sternly admonish the ghostly officials of the Northern Feng, forbidding them to cut short lifespans or sever destinies. Following the transformative edicts of the Heavenly Worthy, they issue commands to the Ghostly Emperors, universally proclaiming to the gates of darkness, announcing restrictions and prohibitions, so that no harm may be wantonly inflicted upon beginning scholars. The Divine Lords receive their mandate and universally sweep away inauspiciousness.

Youxi says: "The Divine Lords are the Great Simplicity’s Boundless Divine Lords." When the Divine Lords receive their edict, the Five Great Demon Emperors sweep away inauspiciousness to protect and guard scholars. The Great Demons, bearing their mandate, employ the eight mighty divine dragons to spew poison and subdue evil, while fierce horses draw their chariots to spread in all four directions. Heavenly soldiers wield their orders at the vanguard, great marshals brandish banners in the rear, and the fire-ringing generals hurl fire for ten thousand miles, flames surging in eight directions. Should any dare to test or resist the perfected of the Supreme, should any dare to oppose the edicts of the Celestial Emperors, the golden axes will execute them at the front, while the colossal axes of the Vast Heaven mete out punishment at the rear. The slaughter of ghostly essences and the destruction of demonic specters who dare to test or resist proceed like wind and fire, never ceasing for even a moment. Wherever the divine might reaches, thousands upon thousands are beheaded, myriads upon myriads have their forms obliterated, leaving no trace behind. Thus, demonic trials dare not trespass, and ghostly spirits are stripped of their spectral manifestations. Scholars who reach this point achieve perfection of merit and completion of the Dao, with inner and outer in perfect unity.

The Three Officials of the Northern Feng clearly inspect the ghostly camps, permitting no concealment. The Golden Horse relays the message through the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus. The Northern Capital of Luo Feng, which examines the hidden and manifest transgressions, blessings, and misfortunes of the world’s people, clearly inspects the ghostly camps’ records of sins and the black registers of those who are due. If a scholar’s accumulated karmic burden is heavy, and the calamities of their deceased ancestors have not yet been absolved, they shall not be allowed to remain concealed or stagnant, but shall all be purged and removed. The post-horses present their cases, and they ascend to roam in the Supreme Clarity. Universally proclaimed without end, all spirits heed the command, and the message is spread throughout the ten directions and the Three Realms, so that all may know and obey the Heavenly Worthy’s decrees. The Five Emperors of the Three Realms and the Great Demon Kings of the various heavens report and recommend, hastening to memorialize the Supreme Clarity.

Mo’an says: "This speaks of those who receive deliverance—Heaven’s gates may not detain or obstruct them, and demonic ghosts may not test or interfere with them." *The Supreme Primordial’s Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters on Delivering Humankind, with Unlimited Meanings*, Scroll the Second, concludes. *The Supreme Primordial’s Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters on Delivering Humankind, with Unlimited Meanings*, Scroll the Third.

The Orthodox Unity Lineage, Transmitting the Dao and Harmonizing Non-Action, Illuminating Ancestral Models and Exemplary Perfected, the Forty-Third Celestial Master Zhang Yuchu, Annotator of the *Original Cavern’s Jade Chronicle*:

In the *Jade Chronicle of the Original Cavern*, the Dragon Han and Yan Kang eras stretch across boundless kalpas, within the primordial chaos.

Shaowei says: "This discusses the kalpic cycles of formation and dissolution, hence the principles of the Dragon Han and Yan Kang eras." The *Mysterious Record of Mount Gui* states: "The *Original Cavern* is the qi of the Supreme Sovereign. The Heavenly Worthy condensed the qi of the *Original Cavern* to compose the *Jade Chronicle*, taking the Dragon Han kalpa as the first kalpa, its inception named *Red Clarity*, and its conclusion *Yan Kang*. The kalpic cycles are endless, ending only to begin anew. After a kalpa’s end, the Three Realms dissolve and all things’ essences and spirits abide in the Great Void—hence *Yan Kang*, the designation for the kalpa of dissolution. *Red Clarity* marks the beginning of the cosmic chart."

The *Scripture of the Nine Grades* says: "Of old, in the primordial darkness, when the myriad heavens were undivided, the Primordial Beginning first took form, and the five kalpas commenced transformation. Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy commanded the Venerable Lord of the Dawn Dao to initiate the celestial records, governing the five kalpas. Thus, the *Original Cavern* embodies the qi of formation, while the *Jade Chronicle* records the celestial origins. From the singular qi’s division, the Three Causes coalesced into the Nine, coiling like dragons or serpents through the nine paths, boundless and infinite—all comprising the primordial qi of the Nine Yangs. The Supreme One then harmonized the Brahma qi to inaugurate the ancestral qi of the Azure Heaven. Hence, the East received nine qi to divide the celestial realm, its kalpa named *Dragon Han*; the South received three qi to divide the celestial realm, its kalpa named *Red Clarity*; the Center received twelve qi to divide the celestial realm, its kalpa named *Supreme Sovereign*; the West received seven qi to divide the celestial realm, its kalpa named *Yan Kang*; the North received five qi to divide the celestial realm, its kalpa named *Kai Huang*. Once the five kalpas had run their course, the August Heaven took form. The singular qi merged with the Dao, the Eight Radiant Sceneries streamed with light, the Eight Emperors manifested, and the Nine Empyreans branched forth. The qi of the Five Yangs of the *Original Cavern* congealed into the *Jade Chronicle*, whereupon the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign was commanded to record the *Original Cavern*’s inception, the kalpic cycles’ revolving origins, and the merits of the Heavenly Perfected and Heavenly People in their cultivation of immortality, along with the paths of ascent and retreat."

Now, the *Original Cavern* is the ancestral qi of the Great Cavern of the Primordial Beginning. From this ancestral qi, the *Jade Chronicle* was formed. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign wielded the brush to record the kalpic reckonings, beginning with *Dragon Han* and ending with *Yan Kang*. Through kalpas of immeasurable duration, formation and dissolution alternate—once dispersed, they reunite, returning to the primordial chaos. Countless hundreds of millions of kalpas pass, boundless and unfathomable. Above, no further colors remain; below, no further abysses endure. Wind and marsh pervade the void; adamantine qi rides the heavens. Between heaven above and heaven below, no darkness or obscurity, no form or shadow, no limits or bounds—only the vast Brahma, the expansive and lightless.

Mo’an says: "This cites the affairs of the ancestral *Dragon Han* kalpa to introduce the principle of *Red Clarity*, the second kalpa’s cosmic inception." In the *Dragon Han* kalpa, once heaven and earth were dissolved, above and below could no longer be perceived through form or image.

Yan Dong says: "At each kalpa’s end, the Three Luminaries darken, heaven and earth merge into chaos—what colors remain above, what abysses below?"

Xue Youqi says: "Wind and marsh are the qi of the Dao. Adamantine is the qi of essence. When the Dao’s qi is utterly yielding, it pervades the void; when the essence’s qi is utterly firm, it governs the heavens." Xiao Guanfu says: "Wind is qi without form; marsh is form without substance—this is the principle of spontaneous non-being, the so-called qi of the Dao. *Gold* endures unchanged through past and present; *adamantine* remains unyielding and indestructible—this is the purest, most wondrous essence, the so-called qi of essence. *Obscurity* is the yin realm; *utmost extremity* is the boundary. *Primordial darkness* is the state before heaven and earth divided. Once a kalpa ends, though heaven and earth are vast, all forms and qi are subject to transformation. Thus, above and below can no longer be sought through color or abyss. Only the qi of wind and marsh, empty and void, and the indestructible adamantine qi, which the heavens’ qi rides in its revolutions, endure like the heavens’ ceaseless motion. As the firmness of Qian inwardly revolves, the yin shadows gradually dissipate. Thus, between heaven above and heaven below, the primordial qi merges into oneness—no obscurity, no form or shadow, ceaseless in its revolutions, without end or limit. Vast and boundless, as before heaven and earth divided; swelling and surging, all pervaded by the Brahma qi. *Expansive* lies beyond the Eight Extremities, indescribable—hence, it is said to be without light, its luminosity inwardly concealed yet unmanifest."

Cultivators regard the body as transient as bubbles, destined for arising and ceasing. They gather the primordial True One’s qi from before their parents’ birth, as when heaven and earth first divided from the primordial darkness, and further receive the Qian metal’s utterly firm qi to form the golden embryo. This is the wondrous existence of the singular spirit, enduring through kalpas. Though kalpas shift and the Three Realms dissolve, all things empty, this nature abides in the wondrous void, independent and unchanging, revolving without cease. Thus, its ceaseless self-strengthening knows no bounds. The Brahma qi inwardly congeals to form the foundation of the elixir, vast and boundless, containing light yet unradiant—this is the initial division of yin and yang, where yin exhausts itself and yang becomes pure.

*Red Clarity* unfolds the cosmic chart, and salvation proceeds spontaneously. The Primordial Beginning presides in tranquility, unfolding the Five Chapters. The *Red Script* in jade characters, the Eight Might’s dragon script, safeguard and regulate the kalpic cycles, ensuring heaven’s enduring existence.

Mo’an says: "The outer four chapters correspond to the former four heavens; the central chapter corresponds to the latter four heavens." *Red Clarity* is the name of a kalpa. Qingyuan says: "At the inception of *Red Clarity*, the great kalpic cycle unfolds the cosmic chart, the *Jade Chronicle* establishes its records, and heaven and earth reopen. Thereupon, heaven and earth, sun and moon, stars and constellations, mountains and rivers, and all phenomena divide at once. Day and night, cold and heat, the four seasons proceed in succession, without error or deviation."

Thus it is said: "The kalpic measures unfold naturally." *Primordial Beginning presides in tranquility*—the ancestral qi resumes its brush, stabilizing heaven and anchoring earth. The Five Chapters: from the Primordial Beginning emerges the Brahman qi, shaping form into cloud-seal celestial script, bearing the five wondrous truths of the primordial spirit and the true Dao—hence the Five Chapters.

The *Red Script* in jade characters: Mo’an says, "The outer chapters stabilize the outer realms; the *Red Script*, yang’s vermilion manifestation, images the sun. The central chapter stabilizes the center; the *jade characters*, yin’s pale manifestation, images the moon." It is also the *Hundun Red Script*—after the cosmic chart’s unfolding, the Red Script is once more proclaimed, carved into jade as script to stabilize and anchor. The Eight Might’s dragon script: Mo’an says, "The former four heavens and the latter four heavens, together comprising the eight directions, are all dragon script." It is also the register of the eight dragons, capable of subduing demons and spirits, commanding ghosts and gods. By its efficacy, it safeguards and regulates the kalpic cycles’ transformations, enduring coeternal with heaven.

The human body possesses the singular Dao of nature and life. Yet life has its end, while nature knows no decay or ruin. Thus, those who cultivate concentration and wisdom delve deeply into the doctrines of life and death, the principles of the hidden and manifest, until they can fully realize their nature and fulfill their destiny—thereupon, the root of nature remains undying, its stem ever-abiding, directly attaining the wondrous subtleties of the seven returns and nine restorations. Though passing through kalpas uncounted, the wheel of suffering is extinguished—this is long life and enduring vision, transcending the posterior heaven.

The Brahman darkness of *Mīra* unfolds myriad patterns. The primordial net flows and evolves, spanning the thirty-two heavens. Revolving through the formless, it cycles through the ten directions. The Dipper whirls past the Winnowing Basket, traversing the five constants. Mo’an says: "This speaks of the second kalpa, when the Red Script is reestablished—the functioning of heaven and earth. With the Red Script’s reestablishment, heaven and earth resume their positions, all things are reborn, and the Brahman qi of the Primordial Beginning’s ancestral kalpa fills and envelops all heavens above. The host of living beings, the ten thousand categories, are thus transformed by a single qi, unfolding and manifesting—thereafter, the myriad things are complete. The Brahman qi flows and spreads, issuing forth as script—this becomes the canonical models, the teachings and admonitions, the scriptural treasuries and written records, serving as patterns without end. Though vast as a hundred thousand myriad threads, all arise from the Brahman qi’s generation."

From the unfolding of myriad patterns, the net’s principles are established. The *primordial net*—like a net’s master cord. Once the patterns are spread, the net’s principles flow and evolve without cease, thus pervading the thirty-two heavens, revolving even unto the formless realms, cycling through one circuit to reach all ten directions. Beginning and ending in turn, not a single breath of the primordial unity is interrupted—none is left unpervaded.

The Dipper whirls past the Winnowing Basket: the Dipper is the central Dipper, that is, the heart. The Winnowing Basket pertains to the *gen-yin* position of the east; at each year’s Beginning of Spring, the Dipper’s handle aligns at dusk with the start of *yin*, rotating leftward with heaven, beginning its traverse at the Winnowing Basket, dwelling at the center while sequentially establishing the twelve earthly branches. The five constants are the five planets—not called the five phases and five planets, but the five constants. The Dipper moves at the center, the five phases each fulfilling their functions—this is the constant Dao of heaven and earth. A year’s twelve earthly branches cycle and recommence; the Dipper traverses the Winnowing Basket’s beginning, the sun, moon, and five planets move in retrograde through three hundred sixty-five degrees. When the Dipper’s handle points to earth, the true qi of the prior heaven also follows the Dipper’s inner movement, arising from the ninefold earth to generate the myriad things.

Within a single day in the human body, there are the seasonal nodes of a year, cycling through the twenty-eight constellations, the twenty-four qi, the seventy-two pentads, and the sixty-four hexagrams to complete the celestial fire’s measures. Measuring by the human body, heaven’s yang arises at *zi*, reaching *yin* as the three yangs, imaging *Tai*, ascending from the lower field. Gradually traversing the Dipper and Winnowing Basket, it circulates through the six voids—all is one’s true unity qi, cycling through the ten directions, following the constant Dao of the five phases. With the heart’s emptiness revolving unceasingly, none fails to be reached by its turning. This is what is meant by "movement and stillness without origin, yin and yang without beginning."

Thirty-five divisions, the upper origin’s total qi. The eight luminous scenes merge in darkness, qi enters the profound profundity. Within the profound, the Grand August, the Highest Perfected. Floating upon the luminous rosy clouds, whistling and chanting the cavernous chapters. Mo’an says: "The *origin* is above the head. The eight scenes are the eight solar terms. The four seasons and four directions each have eight scenes, combining to form the sixty-four hexagrams." *Guan Fu* says: "The thirty-five divisions are the yin-yang, five phases, and twenty-eight constellations." Examining the *Du Fen Chi Bu*, it is also called measuring the movements of the sun, moon, and five planets, dividing the degrees of the twenty-eight constellations—hence the thirty-five divisions. When the sun and moon unite as a jade bi and the five planets align as strung pearls, clustering with the twenty-eight constellations, this is called the total qi’s division into thirty-five; in summation, it is one qi.

The *upper origin* refers to the ancient calendar’s eleventh-month new moon, the winter solstice at midnight, when the sun, moon, and five planets converge at *zi*—this is the upper origin. The eight scenes are the eight luminous scenes within the three sections of the *Scripture of Generating the Spirit*. The *Grand August within the profound* is the Three Treasure Lords within the three qi of the Primordial Profundity—these are the Highest Perfected of the luminous rosy clouds, above the three qi of the Brahman clarity’s scene. The *cavernous chapters* are the golden truths’ radiant luxuriance, whistling and chanting the songs below. Cultivating within, the sun and moon unite as a jade bi—then water and fire achieve harmony.

When the five qi pay homage to the origin, lead and mercury are captured and refined—thus seizing Heaven and Earth’s creative transformation, gathering within the crucible and furnace, traversing the twenty-eight lunar lodges, circulating the fire-timing of the celestial revolution. The medicine is gathered at the onset of the winter solstice, seizing the nodal qi of an entire year, at the very moment when the first yang stirs—this is the summation of qi’s upper origin. Thus it is said: the origin is the supreme of beginnings.

As one qi ascends to the mud-pill palace, the qi-timings of the eight nodes all merge in profound harmony. Thereby one enters directly into the midst of the mysterious mystery, where the indistinct and obscure contain essence. And when my primordial spirit and ancestral qi converge at the summit of the Great Abyss, this is the Highest Perfected’s rosy radiance above the three qi.

When the great rosy clouds stream forth their hues and the empty void forms sound, whistling and chanting arise in joyous resonance—this is the spontaneous response. The golden truths shine resplendent, their echoes flowing through the cloudy encampments. Jade tones gather qi, numinous winds amass mist. The Purple Void flourishes in elegance, aiding and sheltering the ten thousand immortals. A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally they form the real.

Mo’an says: From this passage onward to "each has its gate of generation" constitutes the cavernous chapters of the Highest Perfected. The *golden truths* are the golden essence, the numinous root of Heaven and Earth, the ancestral qi of yin and yang, the primordial true unity’s essence, the utmost yang’s qi. The *jade tones* are the sounds of dragon’s chant and tiger’s roar. The *Purple Void* is the Central Yellow Palace.

Once the Golden Mother returns to the spirit-chamber and the cinnabar foundation is established, the golden embryo begins to sprout. The true spirit shines brilliantly, gleaming like the radiant clarity of golden essence. When the qi of the dragon and tiger’s two strings emerge—fire generating water—the jade tones flow in resonance, the numinous winds stir within, and qi returns to the spirit-chamber to nurture and form the *yin-e*. Within the Central Yellow earthen cauldron, purple light and crimson hues gather qi and amass mist, then flourish to congeal the real. Vigorous within and without, the ten thousand qi return to the real, like waters flowing to their source, like wheel-spokes converging at the hub—spirit flows freely, qi harmonizes.

A thousand spirits harmonize into one spirit, ten thousand qi merge into one qi—all is the principle of spontaneity. Internally conjoined to form the real, these are the most wondrous and divine mechanisms of the returned elixir, not achieved through artificial effort. As the scripture says: "When the revolving wind blends, the work is completed in a hundred days." The *Canticle* states: "Tending and nurturing the *yin-e*, congealing the spirit to form the body."

Within the real there is spirit—the Great Lord of Longevity, the Peerless Duke, the Venerable White Prime, the Great Unity Controller of Destiny, Peach-Kang and Union-Longevity—grasping talismans and holding registers, preserving life and engendering roots. That within the real there is spirit refers to the primordial spirit as the essence of nature, for it is indestructible from kalpas past—this is the Great Lord of Longevity. The "something within the indistinct" and the "essence within the obscure"—its essence is most real, and within it there is certainty.

The Peerless is the spirit of the liver; the White Prime, the spirit of the lungs; the Great Unity is the lord of the hundred spirits, the Controller of Destiny, the spirit of the heart; Peach-Kang and Union-Longevity are the spirits of the two kidneys. The Ancient Fool says: Speaking generally of the four spirits means that metal and wood do not obstruct each other, and water and fire do not overcome one another. The five spirits do not mention the spirit of the spleen, for without the central intent, the four images cannot harmonize—thus the spirit resides within it.

Therefore, the Great Unity dwells at the center, emblematizing the five phases. In the elixir way, Kan receives the earth of Wu, and Li receives the earth of Ji—this is called Kan’s Wu as the moon’s essence, Li’s Ji as the sun’s light. The union of water and fire, the fusion of lead and mercury, the merging of metal and wood—all are mediated by the central intent. The work of refinement, the most wondrous and divine mechanisms, do not exceed the principles of the five phases’ sequence and inversion.

If one can harmonize the sequential circumstances of daily life to investigate the marvels of inversion, the four images conjoin, the five phases gather—then the stem of life grows ever more secure, and the root of nature attains longevity. This is the utmost spirit within the utmost real. Guanfu says: The true spirit preserves its nature and life, the numinous qi guards its root of generation.

Talismans and registers—expressed in terms of form—are the primordial talismanic mandates. Sought within the formless, they are one’s own true qi. If one can grasp and uphold them without negligence, one may secure and strengthen the primordial life, so that the dead soul receives deliverance and revives its root.

Ascending to the Upper Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers, within the eight obscurities and the subtlest realms. Below, it stabilizes the human body—mud-pill palace and crimson palace—governing the five qi within, blending the hundred spirits. Ten revolutions return the numinous, ten thousand qi unite as immortals.

Mo’an says: This describes how scholars refine and attain the real. The *Upper Clarity* is the mud-pill palace. The *Flowery Chambers* are the three realms’ flowery chambers. The *eight obscurities* are the eight poles. The *mud-pill* is the brain’s summit. The *crimson palace* is the heart. The *five qi* are the five phases. The *hundred spirits* are the spirits within the body. This is the verification of refining and attaining the real.

Within the real, the spirit’s numinous wonders are already complete—thus it ascends and descends, circulating without cease. Above, it courses through the Heavenly Gate and the Upper Clarity’s Flowery Chambers, circling within the eight poles—even in the subtlest and most minute, there is nowhere it does not reach. Below, it stabilizes the human body, returning to the body’s center from the mud-pill palace down to the crimson palace, and back to the mysterious pass of the central palace.

The *center*—the body’s center—is called grasping the center, guarding the center, compassing the center, encircling the center, the one center, the yellow center—all are one principle. If the true breath settles within and the center is empty while the exterior is bright, then qi naturally regulates itself. The *five qi* are essence, spirit, soul, spirit-soul, and intent. When breath is regulated to the point of no-breath, the heart is pure and the spirit congeals—the five qi govern within, the hundred spirits merge within, circulating and returning without cease.
