*E Yi* is without rank; cavernous subtlety is self-authentic. The Eight Characters are the inner sounds of *Fan Du Heaven*. *E Yi* is the inner name of the Heavenly King. During the *Dragon Han* kalpa, when all karmic conditions are exhausted, one transcends the Three Realms, ascends to the *Palace of Great Emptiness*, receives the register of the Nine Immortals, and attains the title of Great Sage. By the *Red Clarity* kalpa’s inception, the Primordial Beginning bestows the title of *Fan Du Heavenly King*. *Wu* is the *Great Void Perfected*; receiving the Heavenly King’s talisman, they deliver the souls of the long night. *Pin* refers to assessing the sins and blessings of the dark souls. *Dong* is the *Cavernous Clarity of Past Connections*. *Miao* is the *Hall of Wondrous Transformation*; when evil karma is exhausted and past connections are resolved, one ascends into the *Hall of Wondrous Transformation*. *Zi* means "with." *Zhen* is *Heavenly Perfection*; thus, one unites with all heavens in perfection.

*Yuan Fan* is vast and boundless, silently delivering beings in the dark and still. The Eight Characters are the inner sounds of *Jia Yi Heaven*. *Yuan Fan* is the *qi* of the Primordial Beginning’s Great Brahma—lofty and cavernously floating, suspended yet unfallen. *Hui Mo* is vast and limitless, distant yet unobstructed, existent yet as if nonexistent. *You* is the dark and desolate. *Ji* is the empty and silent—profound, indistinct, and imperceptible. Within it lies the Real; within the Real lies the Essence—thus universally delivering celestial and human beings.

*Mo An* says: The meaning of the *Divine Book* is profoundly abstruse and difficult to fathom. Yet each direction comprises sixty-four characters, totaling sixty-four phrases, whose natural numerology precisely aligns with the sixty-four hexagrams of the *Great Change*. *Qian* and *Kun* are the progenitors of the *Change*; thus, only *Qian* and *Kun* are singled out, revealing that the myriad transformations of heaven, earth, the myriad things, and the myriad affairs cannot escape the *Change*. The traces of heaven, earth, ghosts, spirits, and creation likewise do not transcend the *Divine Book*—hence, one may infer by analogy. Moreover, the *River Chart* emerged, and Fuxi drew it to form the *Change*; the cloud-script of the Great Void gave rise to the jade characters, which the Heavenly Perfected inscribed to compose the text. The marvel of the divine way’s teachings inherently shares an unspoken resonance.

This humble one observes: The Heavenly Perfected said, "The inner sounds of the heavens and the natural jade characters are all congealed from the *qi* of flying mystery, harmonizing the sounds of the five directions. Their script is profound and abstruse, difficult to fathom." Thus, the jade characters of the *Divine Book* emerge from the *qi* of the Great Brahma, congealing in emptiness to form script. The Perfected wielded the brush to unfold them into chapters—this is the root of heaven and earth, the origin of the myriad existences. Its silent concordance with the *Great Change*’s mechanism of yin-yang movement and stillness lies in the principle that the myriad existences are all endowed with the *River Chart*’s numbers of generation and completion. Therefore, one cultivates it internally to refine the self and applies it externally to deliver others—ultimately, the Dao is one with the singular root.

The Dao states: These are the great Brahma’s esoteric utterances within the heavens, the boundless sounds. The ancient script was all a *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected of old inscribed the script to establish the correct sounds. Those who know these sounds and purify themselves to recite them will have the flying transcendent divine kings of all heavens descend to observe their bodies, record their merits, and report them above to the heavens. The myriad spirits pay homage, the earth spirits stand guard at the gates, and even the mighty demon kings will safeguard and recommend them for ascension to immortal ranks. When their Dao is complete and their merits fulfilled, they may roam the Three Realms, ascend through the *Golden Gate*, and serve the Three Realms, daily attending the Emperor’s side.

*Mo An* says: The ancient script refers to the original form of the jade characters when they first emerged—what is now transmitted as celestial seal-script. This is the concluding discourse of the *Dao Lord* on the marvels of the *Divine Book*. *Great Brahma* refers to the natural wondrous *qi* of the heavens congealing to form script. *Esoteric utterances* are the hidden names and taboos of the Heavenly Emperor. *Boundless sounds* are the cavernous natural sounds that resonate through all heavens, endowing boundless merit. *Ancient script* refers to when the Primordial Beginning first expounded the scriptures and the Perfected first wielded the brush—all were celestial Brahma *qi* congealing to form script. Thus, the characters were all a *zhang* in length, inscribed in jade and gold, with eight corners radiating light—later transmitted as celestial seal-script, hence called *ancient script*. The Perfected of old inscribed the script to establish the correct sounds; what is now transmitted are the later translations compiled into chapters—these are the ancient correct sounds. Those who know the sounds and purify themselves to recite them will evoke the heavens to dispatch divine kings to descend, observe, and record their merits, reporting them above. Then, the myriad spirits will pay reverent homage, the earth spirits will stand guard, and even the mighty demon kings will safeguard and recommend them for ascension to immortal ranks. *Dao complete* means that when their merits are perfected and their conduct fulfilled, they may roam above the Three Realms, ascend through the *Golden Gate*, and serve the Three Realms, daily attending the Emperor’s side.

*Guan Fu* says: Within it, the empty and the solid interpenetrate, and the images and numbers are visible. Applying the nine days to guide *Qian*’s reckoning, no principle is left unaddressed. *Qian* begins in the north, just as yang arises at *zi*. *Jia* corresponds to *Qian*, and *zi* is the *Yellow Bell*—thus, *jia-zi* begins at the winter solstice. The *Returning Elixir* is but the cultivation of the great Brahma’s cyclic refinement. The Four Symbols, Five Phases, Three Origins, Eight Trigrams, sun and moon, dragon and tiger, cinnabar and mercury, lead and silver—all are contained within the esoteric utterances. As for the *yin* tally and *yang* fire, the warming and nurturing, the withdrawal and addition—without relying on the hexagrams’ rise and fall, the cyclic progression of *jia-zi*, how could one take them as a model?

Thus, the four hexagrams *Qian*, *Kun*, *Kan*, and *Li* symbolize heaven, earth, sun, and moon, embracing the myriad things as the crucible, vessel, medicine, and pivot of the root and origin. The remaining sixty hexagrams correspond to the sixty *jia-zi* cycles. Following the shifts of spring and autumn, cold and heat divide into twenty-four *qi*, likened to seventy-two seasonal markers, aligning with the twelve months of the year. Distilled into a single month, its seasonal signs are compressed within the twelve hours of day and night—fixing the water clock, rectifying the sundial, clarifying *zi* and *wu*, regulating *yin* and *yang*, harmonizing darkness and dawn, balancing weights and measures—all in accord with heaven and earth’s grand reckoning and the transformative mechanism of *yin* and *yang*. Thus, the hexagrams comprise three hundred eighty-four lines, and fire is measured by three hundred eighty-four *zhu*; through this, the myriad things arise from emptiness, and the principle of the great Brahma is in truth identical to that of the *Great Change*. Herein, the teachings of all masters silently converge, and the elixir and the *Change* have never diverged in their path. If the scholar can fathom the subtle mysteries of the *Numinous Writ*, then the foundation of the elixir and the Dao of the *Change* are attained.

This sound repels all, dispels all, delivers all, and accomplishes all. It is the sound of heaven’s spontaneity. Reciting it summons flight to behold the realms below, the Celestial Thearch’s distant chant, the myriad spirits’ courtly obeisance, and the Three Realms’ attendance at the imperial chariot. Hosts of demons bow their heads, ghostly essences vanish of themselves. Jade chimes resound, the ten directions grow hushed, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists. The ten thousand spirits tremble and submit, summoning the immortals of the grasses. Heaven is free of defilement, earth is free of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the void—vast and profoundly profound.

*Mo’an* says: The Dao Lord here expounds the efficacy of the scholar’s recitation. This sound is the sound of boundlessness. Reciting it can expel all demonic influences, dissolve all calamities, deliver all from birth and death, and perfect all celestial and human beings. Its merit extends everywhere without exception, hence the reiteration: the sound of heaven’s spontaneity. These are the words of the perfected of the highest heavens, uttered by the spontaneous *qi* of the Brahma realm—not the fabricated sounds of the human world. Thus, its merit is unparalleled. Reciting it thus enables flight to survey the world below, and its merit is recorded. The Celestial Thearch chants from afar in praise, the myriad spirits offer courtly homage, and the body’s spirits attend the imperial chariot across the Three Realms. At this stage, the Three Worms hide in submission, the Six Thieves retreat in concealment, demonic hordes bow their heads, external demons instantly cease, ghostly essences perish of themselves, and inner delusions instantly vanish. Once karmic consciousness is purified and defilements are emptied, only the original nature and the True Unity remain.

The jade chimes’ resonance signifies the union of form and spirit in transcendence, where celestial music arises spontaneously. The ten directions’ hush signifies utter stillness without remnant sound. Rivers and seas’ silence signifies the love-river and sea of suffering both stilled. Mountains and peaks swallowing mists signify their inner solidity, where spirit congeals and breath settles. The ten thousand spirits trembling in submission signify the perfection of merit and completion of the Dao, where none fail to submit. The summoning of the host of immortals signifies the myriad spirits’ audience at the origin, gathering unbidden. Heaven free of defilement and earth free of demonic dust signify the quiescence of nature and the obscurity of emotion, merging with the Great Void. Profound wisdom illumining the void: *profound* denotes the secluded and boundless; *wisdom* denotes clarity without limit; *illumining* denotes unimpeded luminosity; *void* denotes limpid purity without end. This is what *Guanfu* calls the power of obscure penetration and luminous insight. At this stage of inner cultivation, the eight directions are thoroughly illuminated, the singular nature merges in fusion, vast enough to embrace the cosmos, subtle enough to enter the tip of a hair—all these are the wondrous subtleties of the supremely profound and minute, whose measure cannot be fathomed by any shore or boundary. This is called the vast and profoundly profound.

The vastness of heaven and earth, the multitude of the ten thousand beings, the crawling and fluttering creatures—all contain the wondrous essence of the singular spirit, each arising from non-being, all presaged by the Supreme Ultimate, the Five Phases, and *yin-yang* before attaining wholeness. The Supreme Ultimate’s singular root does not conceal itself amid the myriad differences, but returns to the origin of soundlessness and scentlessness, reverting to the Ultimateless. When the Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture, he began by suspending a single precious pearl to unfold the ten revolutions’ wondrous meaning, wherein the secrets of the great Brahma and the mysteries of the elixir path are fully contained. In its conclusion, he yet feared that disciples might fall into the bias of sinking into emptiness or clinging to existence, and thus declared: *Profound wisdom illumines the void—vast and profoundly profound.* Herein lies the essentials of the entire scripture and the subtleties of the millet-pearl. How could any fabricated dharmas or images attain this? This is what is meant by *accord with emptiness and union with non-being*, reverting to the Ultimateless. It lies in returning to seek within oneself, where the numinous remains undimmed, heaven and earth are complete within me, and the supremely divine and wondrous Dao is attained.

*The Diagram of the Millet-Pearl Suspended in Ten Revolutions*
*The Diagram of the Golden Elixir’s Ten Transformations and Four Spirits*

**The Middle Scroll: Diagram of the Yi’s Fire Phases**
**The Supreme Ultimate Diagram: Explanation of the Primordial Qi’s Complete and Wondrous Function in Its Entirety**

The Chaos of Crimson Script, the Perfect Real of the Non-Non and Primordial Above—this is what is meant by *the Ultimateless and yet the Supreme Ultimate*. In the primordial kalpa of the Origin Ancestor, the myriad heavens were transformed and brought forth; the Three Luminaries were illumined, forming the Root of Heaven. Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is its body. This is what is meant by *the Supreme Ultimate moves and generates yang; when movement reaches its limit, it becomes still. Stillness generates yin; when stillness reaches its limit, it moves again. In one movement and one stillness, each becomes the root of the other. Yin and yang divide, and the Two Modes are established.*

The Five Scripts unfold and expand—this is what is meant by *yang transforms, yin conjoins, and water, fire, wood, metal, and earth are born. The Five Agents arrange themselves in order, and the four seasons proceed.* The Five Agents are one with yin-yang; yin-yang is one with the Supreme Ultimate; the Supreme Ultimate is fundamentally the Ultimateless. Universally planting the numinous, without script there is no illumination, no clarity, no establishment, no completion, no deliverance, no generation. This is what is meant by *the true of the Ultimateless, the essence of the Two and Five, wondrously conjoined and coagulated. The Qian Dao forms the male; the Kun Dao forms the female. The two qi interact and transform, giving birth to the myriad things. The myriad things ceaselessly generate and transform without end.*

**The Diagram of the Primordial Qi’s Complete and Wondrous Function**—scholars must investigate its meaning, for then the precelestial Dao will unconsciously accord, and the subtleties of creation may be glimpsed. Thus, the Confucian, knowing the causes of the hidden and the manifest, encompasses the myriad things, tracing origins and returning to endings, exhausting principle and fulfilling nature, attains the wondrousness of life and death without delusion. The Old Master says: *Deeply root, firmly stem—long life and enduring vision.* Each has its own tradition.

How, then, is this achieved? The scripture says: *Know the masculine, guard the feminine—return to the state of an infant. Know the white, guard the black—return to the Ultimateless.* This is the Dao of the Golden Liquid Returned Elixir. Thus can one *probe the root, firm the stem—long life and enduring vision.* Following this doctrine of *observing and returning*, Master Mo’an adopted it.

**Postscript by the Heavenly Lord Xin of the Azure Emperor, Descended in Writing, on Master Mo’an’s Copy of the *Wu Chang Wei Fang* Text**

The scripture is transmitted by the heart; the scripture is realized by the heart. Heart realizes, heart transmits—heaven and humanity are universally delivered. With this heart, the Emperor will favor you. Sincerely receive and practice it—good deeds are well done.

In the fifth month of the *gengyin* year, the Heavenly Lord Xin descended in writing, saying: *Disciples are single-minded; believers are sincere. Moved by my teachings of the Chaos Primordial Scripture, I have come to the altar. Great is the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Delivering Humanity—it is not composed by mere literary art. All scriptures must perish when kalpas end, yet this text alone remains in the Jade Capital.*

From ancient times to the present, no sage, immortal, or buddha has attained the Dao without revering the scripture of delivering humanity. Among all scriptures, the Primordial Beginning’s *Scripture of Deliverance* is the supreme. The scripture—when yang, it arouses good thoughts in people; when yin, it opens the way to deliver hidden spirits. Its merit is without peer.

I shall speak to you with my ears; you shall listen to my words with your mouth. Ah! Listen with the mouth—here lies the mutual functioning of the six roots, the wondrousness of the Chaos Primordial. Do you, disciples, reciting the *Scripture of Deliverance*, yet know its profound subtleties? The human heart is the precious pearl; the original spirit is the Primordial Beginning. Beyond the spirit, there is no Heavenly Worthy; beyond the heart, there is no Dao or Dharma. Does one who deceives the heart not obscure Heaven?

At the outset of recitation, gather the myriad thoughts into one—this is the Primordial Beginning summoning the ten directions. Reciting the scripture with right mindfulness is the Primordial Beginning expounding the scripture. When thoughts of emotion and the conscious spirit do not wander recklessly, it is the ten directions listening to the scripture. Forgetting emotion and severing thought—this is the state of silence without lingering echoes. When nature is pure and undivided, the true and false both return. With a single, undivided will, over time one naturally becomes pure. The myriad delusions return to the true—this is the deliverance of heaven and humanity. If you grasp this, you will naturally reach the realm of formlessness. The demons of the myriad thoughts will all be transformed by me—then you are a true person. This is the essence of the scripture.

Yet if one recites the scripture without understanding this principle, failing to gather thoughts or return to the true, even reciting ten thousand times a day—what benefit is there to me? As for the section on refinement and deliverance, it is even more difficult to speak of. If one does not know the essence of the scripture, how can one deliver others?

If you grasp the *Pearl Suspended in Emptiness*, able to gather the myriad thoughts and return to the true, with a single, unmoving will, like the Primordial Beginning, in one hour you will naturally reach the state of silence without lingering echoes—joy and celebration beyond words. At this point, the ghosts and gods of the Three Realms all revere and fear you; all hidden spirits are delivered.

The refinement and deliverance of hidden spirits is a great merit and virtue. The ancient immortals and buddhas all cultivated themselves as merit and delivered others as virtue—only then could they achieve both merit and conduct in full.

I am an official of thunder. In the remote past, I had already attained the supreme Dao, then later reincarnated into the Thunder Bureau, driving wind and thunder, bringing rain and dew, and generating the myriad things. Thunder is the Heavenly Emperor’s staff of authority, the power of the Emperor, the pivot of the Dao. The power of life and death is governed by thunder; its transformations are endless, its merit without peer. That I can give life and take it is because I practice benevolence and righteousness. Benevolence is the office of spring, generating the myriad things; righteousness is the office of autumn, bringing solemn execution to the myriad things. Assisting Heaven and Earth, enacting the four seasons, acting on behalf of the Supreme Emperor to govern the world’s fortunes—I also ceaselessly cultivate merit and virtue.

If one attains the Dao but does not aid others, what benefit is there to the Supreme Emperor? Even the Jade Emperor, having attained the Dao after ten thousand kalpas, still presides over the world’s fortunes—how much more so for us!

You disciples, having entered my Dao and Dharma, must embody this intent. You are all the finest among my disciples, which is why I have spoken thus far—not to leak the secrets of thunder and confuse your assembly. You may single-mindedly cultivate and revere it; I will assist your Dao’s influence from the altar. If you encounter calamities hereafter, you may focus your will, revere one deity, recite one scripture—and thus preserve yourself.

Press on, press on. Should someone nearby inquire about assuming office, the rescript shall read: “Having been protected by the ancestral altar, how dare I speak of office? Office need not be lofty—lofty yet without merit, what benefit is there? Simply call yourself a disciple who upholds the Dao, and this too may reach the Emperor. With a single thought of true sincerity, even metal and stone shall be pierced.”

Written on the fifth day of the fifth month by the fierce clerk of the Five Thunders, Xin Zhongyi; transcribed by the disciple Chen Yuanheng.

Thus concludes *The Supreme, Boundless Scripture of Salvation’s Highest Wondrous Canon: A Comprehensive Exegesis*, Scroll Four.

chunks.original_text: 元始无量度人上品妙经通义 经名：元始无量度人上品妙经通义。 明四十三代天师张宇初撰。 四卷。 底本出处：《正统这藏》洞真部玉诀类。 元始无量度人上品妙经通义卷之一 正一嗣教道合无为阐祖光范真人领道教事四十三代天师张宇初注 太极妙化神灵混洞赤文之图 河图象数之图 天一地二、天三地四、天五地六、天七地八、天九地十，天数五地数五，五位相得而各有合。 天数二十有五，地数三十。 凡天地之数，五十有五，此所以成变化而行鬼神也。 五方除生成本三数，则龙从火出，虎向水生，而母隐子胎，子归母腹。 皆金丹七返，朱砂九还、金液之妙也。 故与经中十四之义无殊为。 雷霆一窍之图 《抱朴子》曰：玄牝一家者，非、心、肾、鼻、口、肝、肺、谷道、膀胱、泥丸。 知此一穷，则冬至火候，药物沐浴，脱胎结胎，皆在此矣。 此窍即雷霆之窍，得之则雷露摄机，不必外求也。 至人冲举，所用在此。 道法感通，特余事耳。 雷霆枢机互用之图 雷 雷为天之枢，其性善、其主生、其体阳、其象阴、故甲丙庚壬为阳雷。 霆 霆为地之机，其性恶、其主杀、其体阴、其象阳、故乙己丁辛为阴霆。 雷霆互用 乾坤同体，日月合璧。 动而霹露。 大量玄玄之图 天无氛秽　地无妖尘 冥慧洞清　大量玄玄 无极通书真，无妄中庸诚。 真中元有帝，诚外更无神。 混合天地性，鞭驾风霆身。 性之身之者，至真至诚人。 天圆地方修行之象 此图与先天卦方圆图合，中间每眼是灵书中局一字，并与前彼二图互观之，则可见天地之妙－不尽意也。 太上洞玄灵宝无量度人上品妙经 太者，大也。 上者，尊也。 无上之上，是为极尊。 洞玄者，品秩之称。 经有三洞：洞真，元始主之； 洞玄，灵宝主之； 洞神，道德主之。 此经本元始所宣，而道君纪录，故标《洞玄灵宝》。 而正经止云《元始无量度人上品妙经》，所以别前、后序。 道言乃道君之言也。 合而命曰《太上洞玄灵宝》，以由道君承元始之旨，无量度人，即一卷之目。 三洞之中三十六部，此经为首，故曰上品。 妙者，至精至微，玄奥难极也。 经者，径也，日用修真、共由之道也。 内而修之曰丹，即先天真一之祖炁也。 上无复祖，惟道至尊。 洞者，空洞明彻； 玄者，湛寂幽微。 灵乃真性长存，宝乃元命流行。 能修之於身，则能度人，所度无穷，非可限量也。 夫证上乘之道，不离乎自心。 此心即道即经，是以虚灵无碍，而度人无量矣。 道言：昔於始青天中碧落空歌大浮黎土，受元始度人无量上品。 道言者，太上玉晨道君之言也。 此前序之题，乃道君述昔受经始末，纪载成篇之因。 始青者，东方九炁青天也。 乃神霄九天之一。 此天梵炁所凝，碧霞廓落，故曰碧落。 碧霞之炁，凝为琼林瑶树，灵风鼓荡，自成空洞之歌，是曰空歌。 大浮黎土即东极国名。 道君谓我昔於始青天浮黎土，受元始天尊妙经，广度天人，是为无量上品。 夫土，中宫也； 玄，关也。 其数居五，为天地万物之祖，故百昌生乎土，终乎土。 此吾玄关，即宝珠也。 元神，即元始也。 万有生化无穷，皆由乎是也。 始青，木之象也。 火，龙也。 震数三，乾初索而生长男，犹春居四序之首，万物以之而发生也。 然一初生水，水生木；

**The Comprehensive Meaning of the Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Beginning’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity**

**Scripture Title:** *The Comprehensive Meaning of the Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Beginning’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity*
*Composed by the Forty-Third Celestial Master Zhang Yuchu. Four fascicles.*
*Source text:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Jade Instructions* Category.

---

### *Fascicle One of The Comprehensive Meaning of the Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Beginning’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity*
*Annotated by the Forty-Third Celestial Master Zhang Yuchu, Orthodox Unity Lineage Successor, Dao-Harmonized Non-Action Expounder, Illustrious Ancestral Model, Perfected of Radiant Virtue, and Overseer of Daoist Affairs*

#### **Diagram of the Supreme Ultimate’s Wondrous Transformation, the Divine and Chaotic Crimson Text**
#### **Diagram of the River Chart’s Symbolic Numerology**
Heaven One, Earth Two; Heaven Three, Earth Four; Heaven Five, Earth Six; Heaven Seven, Earth Eight; Heaven Nine, Earth Ten. The heavenly numbers are five, the earthly numbers are five—five positions intermingle, each with its own union.
The heavenly numbers total twenty-five; the earthly numbers, thirty. The sum of heaven and earth’s numbers is fifty-five, by which transformations are accomplished and the spirits of ghosts and deities are set in motion.
When the generative and productive root numbers of the Five Directions are subtracted by three, the dragon emerges from fire, the tiger arises from water, the mother conceals the embryo of the child, and the child returns to the mother’s womb. All these are the wonders of the sevenfold return of the Golden Elixir, the ninefold restoration of cinnabar, and the Golden Liquid. Thus, they are no different from the fourteenfold meaning in the scripture.

#### **Diagram of the Thunder’s Single Aperture**
*Master Baopuzi* states: The Mysterious Female’s single aperture refers to the non-[dual], heart, kidneys, nose, mouth, liver, lungs, grain passage, bladder, and Muddy Pellet.
To know this single aperture is to grasp the fire-times of the Winter Solstice, the medicinal substances, the bathing [of the elixir], the shedding of the embryo, and the congealing of the embryo—all lie herein.
This aperture is the aperture of thunder, and by attaining it, the mechanism of thunder and dew is captured; there is no need for external seeking.
The Perfected who ascend in emptiness employ this. The resonance of Dao and method is but a secondary matter.

#### **Diagram of the Thunder’s Pivotal Mechanism and Mutual Employment**
**Thunder**
Thunder is the pivot of heaven. Its nature is good, its governance is life, its substance is yang, its image is yin—thus, *jia*, *bing*, *geng*, and *ren* are yang thunder.
**Lightning**
Lightning is the mechanism of earth. Its nature is evil, its governance is killing, its substance is yin, its image is yang—thus, *yi*, *ji*, *ding*, and *xin* are yin lightning.
**Mutual Employment of Thunder and Lightning**
Qian and Kun share the same body; sun and moon form a single jade disk. When set in motion, they resound with thunderclaps.

#### **Diagram of the Vast and Profound Mystery**
Heaven is free of defilement,
Earth is free of demonic dust.
Dark wisdom pervades clarity—
Vast and profound, the mystery of mysteries.
The True of the Limitless penetrates the Book,
The Sincere of the Unwavering Center embodies Integrity.
Within the True, the Primordial holds the Emperor;
Beyond Sincerity, there are no further spirits.
Merging the natures of heaven and earth,
Whipping and driving the body of wind and thunder.
The one whose nature is their body—
This is the person of utmost truth and sincerity.

#### **Symbol of Cultivation in the Round Heaven and Square Earth**
This diagram aligns with the Precelestial Trigram’s square and round diagrams. Each point within corresponds to a single character from the *Ling Shu*’s configurations. When examined together with the two preceding diagrams, the wonders of heaven and earth become visible—though not exhaustively so.

---

### *The Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humanity from the Numinous Treasure of the Cavernous Mystery*
*Tai* (Supreme) means great. *Shang* (Upper) means revered. The "upper" beyond all upper is the utmost reverence.
*Dongxuan* (Cavernous Mystery) is a designation of rank. Scriptures comprise the Three Caverns: *Dongzhen* (Cavern of Perfection), presided over by the Primordial Beginning; *Dongxuan* (Cavern of Mystery), presided over by the Numinous Treasure; and *Dongshen* (Cavern of Spirits), presided over by the Dao and its Virtue.
This scripture was originally proclaimed by the Primordial Beginning and recorded by the Dao Lord, hence the title *Dongxuan Lingbao* ("Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure"). Yet the main scripture simply reads *The Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of Primordial Beginning’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity*, distinguishing it from the prefaces and postscripts.
The "words of the Dao" are the words of the Supreme Jade Dawn Dao Lord.
Together, it is titled *The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure*, for the Dao Lord received the Primordial Beginning’s decree to save humanity without limit—this being the title of the single fascicle.
Among the thirty-six sections of the Three Caverns, this scripture stands first, hence "supreme."
*Miao* (Wondrous) denotes the utmost subtlety and profundity, the abstruse and unfathomable.
*Jing* (Scripture) means "path"—the shared Way of daily cultivation and true refinement.
When cultivated internally, it is called the Elixir, the primordial true unity’s ancestral *qi*. Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is supremely revered.
*Dong* (Cavernous) signifies emptiness, clarity, and luminosity; *xuan* (mystery), profound stillness and subtlety.
*Ling* (Numinous) is the enduring true nature; *bao* (treasure) is the flowing primordial destiny.
By cultivating it within the body, one can save others. The saved are boundless, not subject to limitation.
To realize the supreme vehicle of the Dao is not apart from one’s own mind. This mind is the Dao, is the scripture—thus, empty and numinous without obstruction, it saves humanity without limit.

**The Dao Speaks:**
Long ago, in the Azure Heaven of the Beginning, within the vast expanse of the Blue Empyrean, in the land of Great Floating Black, I received from the Primordial Beginning the *Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humanity*.
"The Dao speaks" refers to the words of the Supreme Jade Dawn Dao Lord. This preface’s title recounts how the Dao Lord received the scripture in the past, recording the circumstances of its compilation.
*Shiqing* (Beginning Azure) is the Azure Heaven of the Nine *Qi* of the East—one of the Nine Heavens of Divine Empyrean. This heaven is congealed from the *qi* of Brahma, its azure radiance vast and boundless, hence "Blue Empyrean."
The *qi* of azure radiance congeals into jade groves and jasper trees, stirred by numinous winds that spontaneously form the *kong song* ("empty hymn").
*Dafulitu* is the name of a country in the Eastern Ultimate. The Dao Lord states: "In the past, in the land of Floating Black within the Azure Heaven of the Beginning, I received the wondrous scripture from the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy to broadly save heavenly and human beings—this is the *Supreme and Wondrous Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humanity*."
The "land" is the Central Palace; the "mystery" is the Pass. Its number is five, the ancestor of heaven, earth, and the myriad things. Thus, the hundred creatures are born from earth and return to earth. This is our mysterious pass, the precious pearl.
The primordial spirit is the Primordial Beginning. The endless generation and transformation of the ten thousand existences all arise from it.
*Shiqing* is the image of wood. Fire is the dragon. *Zhen*’s number is three—Qian’s first line seeks and gives birth to the eldest son, just as spring stands first among the four seasons, and the myriad things arise through it.
Yet the first unity gives birth to water, and water gives birth to wood...

chunks.original_text: 二乃生火，火由木生，此五行循环，生生无穷之理，可谓着矣。 元始天尊当说是经，周回十过，以召十方，始当诣座。 元犹乾元、坤元也。 先乎天地而天地由之以生，是为万化之始，万汇之祖，乃虚皇天尊之应号，是为诸天之尊也。 当是时，演说度人经教，周行十过，以召十方上圣高尊，大会黍珠之中，敷扬妙蕴，始乃就座而说经。 夫元始即法身之祖炁也，元神也； 所谓不坏真空，本来自性也。 当说是经，即祖炁为丹之体，元神不昧则天命流行而不息，周流六虚，动静无端，往来不已，是乃周回十过。 十过者，生数五，成数五，十乃天地之成数也。 修丹以十月而后成功。 十方者，乃一三五七九，阳也； 二四六八十，阴也。 此为还丹之妙用。 而玄关之中，真阴、真阳之炁既济，则一身百脉辐奏川流，犹十方真圣不召而集矣。 天真大神、上圣高真、妙行真人、无鞅数众，乘空而来，飞云丹霄，绿舆琼轮，羽盖垂荫，流精玉光，五色郁勃，洞焕太空。 凡无鞅数众之真仙，乃五亿诸天日月星宿、天真地只、天地水府、三界十方仙真圣众，不可以数度之。 一时皆乘空而来，御空蹑梵，不行而至。 飞云丹霄，驾三素之云，乘绛霞之炁。 轮舆羽盖，皆真圣一时之神化百态万状，灵变莫测。 流精玉光，五色郁勃，流晶三光之辉，交映玉光，仙真之圆象洞明，是以五彩交烜於太空，焕明洞彻，内而修之。 金母既返神室，则以神摄炁，以炁炼神，铅汞擒制，阴阳攒族，是即千真万圣之来会也。 须臾，金火交辉於神室，内外朗彻，流精炫彩，五色焕烂於太空矣。 七日七夜，诸天日月星宿、璇玑玉衡，一时停轮。 神风静默，山海藏云。 天无浮翳，四炁朗清。 一国地土，山川林木，缅平一等，无复高下。 上皆作碧玉，无有异色。 七乃火数，即七返之义也。 《易》曰：七日来复。 凡数遇七叉复。 先儒曰：阳生於子，阴生於午。 自午至子，七而必复； 乾坤消息之理也。 以一日言之，自午时至夜半，复子时。 以一年言之，自五月一阴生，至十一月复子月。 以一月言之，自午日几七日，复遇子日。 此天道运行之定数也。 诸天，即三十二天也。 日月星宿、璇玑玉衡者，周天星辰与中斗七星也。 一时停轮者，天体浑沦，运转周流，无一刻之息。 至是时乃停轮息转，即复归其根，中行独复也。 以其静而来复，息不出入，是以神风静默，情虑顿消，气无上下，犹山川之大云雾俱藏，天之浮翳亦除，则四炁朗彻。 一国地土，即浮黎土也。 山川林木、缅平一等，无复高下，当说经之际，神疑目定，脉住心停，性复情冥，万机俱泯，则皆缅平一等。 自性如玉之莹，了无异色矣。 学者能忘形绝虑，万有皆空，体性湛然，一真独露，则一身之景象，百脉皆停，真铅现彩。 是谓土皆作碧玉矣。 玄师曰：此乃大定，神光湛然，见玉清之境是也。 众真侍座，元始尊玄坐空浮五色狮子上。 元始者，元神也。 玄坐者，神室也。 故空浮去地五丈，不着於物相也。 五色者，妙化之炁也。 狮子者，心知也。 众真侍座左右，元始法身玄坐空浮，五炁朝於绛宫。 五色朗明，即元神居於神室，冥心摄炁，三界混融，心知明妙，洞朗太 无，则五方之色交映中黄之宫矣。
chunks.translated_text:
Fire arises from two, and fire is born from wood—this is the cyclic principle of the Five Phases, the inexhaustible pattern of ceaseless generation, which may be called manifest indeed.

When the Most High Lord of the Dao was to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, and only then ascended his seat. *Yuan* is akin to the primordial *qi* of Qian and Kun. Prior to heaven and earth, heaven and earth arose through it—this is the origin of the myriad transformations, the ancestor of the ten thousand forms, the responsive title of the Most Venerable Sovereign of the Void, and thus the supreme honor of all heavens.

At that time, he expounded the salvific teachings of the *Scripture of Salvation for Humanity*, circumambulating ten times to summon the exalted sages and lofty venerables of the ten directions. They assembled within the Millet Pearl, unfolding the wondrous mysteries, and only then did he ascend his seat to expound the scripture.

The Primordial Beginning is the ancestral *qi* of the Dharma-body, the primordial spirit. It is the indestructible true emptiness, the original self-nature. When this scripture was expounded, the ancestral *qi* became the essence of the elixir, and as long as the primordial spirit remained undimmed, the mandate of heaven flowed ceaselessly, circulating through the six voids, without beginning in movement or stillness, endlessly coming and going—this is the tenfold circumambulation.

The ten circumambulations consist of five generative numbers and five consummate numbers, for ten is the consummate number of heaven and earth. The elixir is perfected after ten months of refinement. The ten directions comprise the odd numbers—one, three, five, seven, nine—as yang, and the even numbers—two, four, six, eight, ten—as yin. This is the wondrous function of the returning elixir. Within the mysterious pass, when the true yin and true yang *qi* achieve harmony, the hundred meridians of the body resonate like converging rivers, just as the true sages of the ten directions assemble without summons.

The celestial perfected deities, exalted sages, wondrously accomplished immortals, and innumerable hosts arrived riding the void, soaring on vermilion clouds through the cinnabar skies, their jade wheels and feathered canopies casting shade, their flowing essence and jade radiance suffusing the five colors in vibrant splendor, illuminating the great emptiness.

The countless perfected immortals—comprising the five hundred million deities of the heavens, the sun, moon, and stars, the celestial and terrestrial spirits, the watery palaces of heaven and earth, and the immortals and sages of the three realms and ten directions—could not be numbered. All at once, they arrived riding the void, traversing the firmament without movement, borne on tri-colored clouds and crimson mists. Their wheel-chariots and feathered canopies manifested a hundred forms and myriad transformations of the true sages, their numinous changes beyond comprehension. Their flowing essence and jade radiance, suffused with the five colors, intermingled with the luminous brilliance of the Three Lights, their perfected forms resplendent—thus the five hues blazed across the great emptiness, luminous and all-pervading, inwardly cultivated.

Once the Queen Mother of the West returned to the spirit chamber, she gathered *qi* with her spirit and refined her spirit with *qi*, capturing and restraining lead and mercury, assembling yin and yang. This was the assembly of the thousand perfected and ten thousand sages. In an instant, golden and fiery radiance intermingled within the spirit chamber, illuminating inner and outer, their flowing essence and dazzling colors suffusing the five hues in resplendent brilliance across the great emptiness.

For seven days and seven nights, the sun, moon, and stars of the heavens, the jade celestial pivots, all halted their revolutions. The divine winds stilled, mountains and seas concealed their clouds. The heavens were free of floating veils, the four *qi* clear and bright. The lands of the realm—mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—were leveled as one, without distinction of high or low. All became azure jade, without variation in hue.

Seven is the number of fire, signifying the sevenfold return. As the *Book of Changes* states: "After seven days, it returns." All numbers, upon reaching seven, revert. The earlier Confucians said: "Yang is born at *zi*, yin at *wu*. From *wu* to *zi*, after seven, it must return—this is the principle of the waxing and waning of Qian and Kun." Speaking of a single day, from noon to midnight, it returns to the *zi* hour. Speaking of a year, from the fifth month when yin is born, to the eleventh month, it returns to the *zi* month. Speaking of a month, from the *wu* day, after nearly seven days, it returns to the *zi* day. This is the fixed pattern of the heavens' movement.

The "heavens" refer to the thirty-two heavens. The "sun, moon, and stars, jade celestial pivots" denote the constellations of the celestial sphere and the seven stars of the Northern Dipper. "Halted their revolutions" means that the celestial bodies, though ceaselessly revolving, at this moment ceased their motion, returning to their root, the central path alone reverting. Through stillness, they returned, their breath ceasing to enter or exit. Thus, the divine winds stilled, thoughts vanished, and *qi* flowed without distinction of above or below—like mountains and rivers concealing their great clouds and mists, the heavens' floating veils removed, the four *qi* became clear and bright. The lands of the realm—Fuli’s earth—mountains, rivers, forests, and trees were leveled as one, without distinction of high or low. During the scripture’s recitation, with spirit suspended and gaze fixed, pulses stilled and heart ceased, nature reverted and emotions dissolved, all concerns vanished—thus all was leveled as one. The self-nature, like polished jade, was without variation in hue.

Those who cultivate the Dao, forgetting form and severing thoughts, emptying all phenomena, embody a serene nature, the solitary truth revealed—then the scenery of their body, the hundred meridians all stilled, true lead manifests its radiance. This is called "the earth all becoming azure jade." The Mysterious Master said: "This is the great samadhi, the spirit’s light serene, beholding the Jade Clarity’s realm."

The assembled perfected ones attended the seat as the Most High Lord of the Dao sat in mystery upon the void, floating five *zhang* above the five-colored lions. The Primordial Beginning is the primordial spirit. The "mysterious seat" is the spirit chamber. Thus, it floated five *zhang* above the earth, unattached to any form. The five colors are the wondrously transformed *qi*. The lions are the knowing of the heart. The assembled perfected ones attended to the left and right as the Dharma-body of the Primordial Beginning sat in mystery, floating in the void, the five *qi* paying homage to the Crimson Palace. The five colors shone brightly—this is the primordial spirit dwelling in the spirit chamber, darkening the heart to gather *qi*, the three realms merging, the knowing of the heart wondrously bright, illuminating the great emptiness. Thus, the colors of the five directions intermingled in the Central Yellow Palace.

chunks.original_text: 说经一徧，诸天大圣，同时称善，是时一国男女聋病，耳皆开聪。 说经二徧，盲者目明。 说经三徧，喑者能言。 说经四徧，跛痾积逮，皆能起行。 说经五徧，久病痼疾，一时复形。 说经六徧，发白返黑，齿落更生。 说经七徧，老者返壮，少者皆强。 说经八徧，妇人怀妊，鸟兽含胎，已生未生，皆得生成。 说经九徧，地藏发泄，金玉露形。 说经十徧，枯骨更生，皆起成人。 是时一国是男是女，莫不倾心，皆受护度，咸得长生。 金丹九转之功，以十月为胎圆神化。 河图生成之数，自一至十而生生无穷。 洛书变用，除十纵横，一五一十，此盖天地五行不易之定数也。 万物万事，岂能违哉。 故说经一徧者，天一生水也。 水孕於乾金，故子居母腹，是曰空炁金胎也。 天地万物皆由是而生，盖水为数之始。 诸天大圣同时称善者，诸天皆欣赞也。 能使一炁周流，百神俱畅矣。 一国男女者，犹一身阴阳之炁也。 其炁既舒，聩者自聪。 且坎为耳，一数既周，聋者自疏通矣。 说经二徧者，地二生火也。 火孕於巽木，故母隐子胎，是曰木火同位。 且离为目，二数既周，离明洞焕，目无不明矣。 说经三徧者，天三生木也。 震木孕於艮水，且音属金，金本克木而反寄胎金乡，是木绝於申，而胎於酉，此盖木中藏金之象也。 金木受制则必鸣，是以喑亦能言也。 说经四徧者，地四生金也，兑金孕於坤土，故土能生金。 足本属木，而四徧乃跛痾起行。 金绝於寅而胎於卯，是金尝寄胎於木，此明金中有木之象也。 说经五徧者，天五生土也。 戊土孕炁於离火，得天地之正，流戊就已，则二土成圭，是以坎戊月精离已日光，日月皆合璧矣。 人能知修炼，惩忿窒欲，存心养性，致炼己之功而不息，则太一含真，玄珠成象，与乾坤同体，长生久视，为不难矣。 尚何久病痼疾之为患哉。 人之困於疾厄者，由不知返还之妙也。 说经六徧者，地六成之也。 天一生水，坎位於北，阳中而有真阴，是以乾金生坎水而成真铅。 铅乃金之母，铅黑而金白，故谓发白反黑，齿落更生； 皆返本之应也。 说经七徧者，天七成之也。 地二生火，离位於南，阴中而有真阳，是以巽木生离火而成真汞，即七返也。 离汞为金铅所制，则金火暖炼。 乾金，老阳也。 离火，少阴也。 是乃老者返壮，少者皆强矣。 说经八徧者，地八成之也。 天三生木，震位於东，艮震合而成水，汞感铅炁而结为砂，砂含汞质以象怀胎，皆先天真一之炁，凝合於规中，发生万汇，昼夜循环，长养圣胎，非后天阴滓之炁所能育，故曰妇人怀妊，鸟兽含胎，已生未生，皆得生成也。 说经九徧者，天九成之也。 地四生金，兑位於西，兑金合於坤土，坎水隐於母胎，即九还也。 故汞归土釜而成宝，乃一炁还源矣。 始由空炁金胎而生，未见金质，至此则金居性初，还中宫而为丹体。 中即土也。 土为地，是以地藏发泄，金玉露形。 金母内居中宫也。 说经十徧者，地十成之也。 天五生土，土位于中，土乃万物生成之本。 天五之土，阳土也； 地十之土，阴土也。 两土重而为圭，故还丹谓之刀圭也。 金居其中，是乾金反制离火於坤土之中，所谓五行颠倒衍也。 人能修之，则返老还童，超凡入圣，故能起死回生，若太上之治徐甲是也。
chunks.translated_text:
Upon the first recitation of the scripture, all the heavenly sages and great saints simultaneously voiced their approval. At that moment, the deaf among men and women of the entire kingdom regained their hearing. Upon the second recitation, the blind saw clearly. Upon the third recitation, the mute could speak. Upon the fourth recitation, the lame and those afflicted with chronic ailments all rose and walked. Upon the fifth recitation, those suffering from long-standing illnesses and stubborn diseases instantly regained their original form. Upon the sixth recitation, white hair turned black again, and fallen teeth regrew. Upon the seventh recitation, the old reverted to youth, and the young grew stronger. Upon the eighth recitation, pregnant women and creatures bearing young—whether already born or yet unborn—all attained perfect formation. Upon the ninth recitation, the earth’s treasuries opened, and gold and jade revealed their forms. Upon the tenth recitation, withered bones revived, all rising as complete human beings.

At that time, every man and woman in the kingdom, without exception, turned their hearts in devotion, all receiving protection and deliverance, attaining longevity and eternal life. The nine transformations of the golden elixir achieve their perfection in the ten-month gestation, wherein spirit is wondrously transformed. The generative numbers of the *River Chart* proceed from one to ten, engendering endless life. The permutations of the *Luo Scripture* eliminate the ten in favor of the vertical and horizontal, the one and five and ten—these are the unchanging, fixed numbers of heaven, earth, and the five phases. How could the myriad things and affairs of the world defy them?

Thus, the first recitation corresponds to "Heaven One generates Water." Water is conceived within Qian Metal, so the child dwells in the mother’s womb—this is called the *qi* of emptiness within the golden embryo. All things in heaven and earth arise from this, for water is the beginning of all numbers. The simultaneous praise of the heavenly sages and great saints signifies universal joy and approval, enabling the *qi* to circulate fully and the hundred spirits to flourish. The men and women of the kingdom are like the *qi* of yin and yang within a single body. When this *qi* is released, the deaf naturally regain their hearing. Moreover, Kan governs the ears; once the first number is complete, the deaf are naturally unblocked.

The second recitation corresponds to "Earth Two generates Fire." Fire is conceived within Xun Wood, so the mother conceals the child in her womb—this is called the union of wood and fire in the same position. Moreover, Li governs the eyes; once the second number is complete, the brilliance of Li shines resplendently, and no eye remains unilluminated.

The third recitation corresponds to "Heaven Three generates Wood." Zhen Wood is conceived within Gen Water. Furthermore, sound pertains to metal, which fundamentally restrains wood yet paradoxically lodges in the womb of metal. This is wood severed in Shen but gestating in You—a symbol of metal hidden within wood. When metal and wood are restrained, they must resonate, so even the mute can speak.

The fourth recitation corresponds to "Earth Four generates Metal." Dui Metal is conceived within Kun Earth, for earth can generate metal. The feet fundamentally pertain to wood, yet upon the fourth recitation, the lame and chronically ill rise and walk. Metal is severed in Yin but gestates in Mao—this illustrates the symbol of wood within metal.

The fifth recitation corresponds to "Heaven Five generates Earth." Wu Earth is conceived within Li Fire, attaining the correctness of heaven and earth. Flowing from Wu to Si, the two earths form a *gui*. Thus, Kan’s Wu is the essence of the moon, and Li’s Si is the radiance of the sun—sun and moon unite as one. If one knows how to cultivate and refine, restraining anger and suppressing desires, preserving the heart and nurturing nature, ceaselessly pursuing the work of inner refinement, then the Great One contains the true, the Mysterious Pearl takes form, and one becomes one body with heaven and earth. Attaining longevity and enduring vision would then be effortless. How could long-standing illnesses and stubborn diseases remain a concern? Those afflicted by illness and misfortune do so because they do not comprehend the wonder of returning and restoration.

The sixth recitation corresponds to "Earth Six completes it." Heaven One generates Water, and Kan resides in the north, yang containing true yin. Thus, Qian Metal generates Kan Water to form true lead. Lead is the mother of metal; lead is black, and metal is white, so white hair turns black again, and fallen teeth regrow—all responses of returning to the root.

The seventh recitation corresponds to "Heaven Seven completes it." Earth Two generates Fire, and Li resides in the south, yin containing true yang. Thus, Xun Wood generates Li Fire to form true mercury—this is the seventh return. When Li mercury is restrained by metal lead, metal and fire warmly refine. Qian Metal is old yang, and Li Fire is young yin. Thus, the old revert to youth, and the young grow stronger.

The eighth recitation corresponds to "Earth Eight completes it." Heaven Three generates Wood, and Zhen resides in the east. Gen and Zhen combine to form water, mercury responds to the *qi* of lead and congeals into cinnabar. Cinnabar contains the essence of mercury, symbolizing pregnancy—all is the *qi* of the primordial true one, coalescing within the compass, giving rise to the myriad things. Day and night it circulates, nurturing the sacred embryo, for it is not the *qi* of postnatal yin dregs that can foster it. Thus, pregnant women and creatures bearing young—whether already born or yet unborn—all attain perfect formation.

The ninth recitation corresponds to "Heaven Nine completes it." Earth Four generates Metal, and Dui resides in the west. Dui Metal unites with Kun Earth, and Kan Water is concealed within the mother’s womb—this is the ninth return. Thus, mercury returns to the earthen crucible and becomes treasure, the *qi* returning to its source. Initially born from the *qi* of emptiness within the golden embryo, the metal’s essence was unseen. Now, at this stage, metal resides in the initial stirring of nature, returning to the Central Palace to become the elixir’s body. The center is earth, and earth is the ground. Thus, the earth’s treasuries open, and gold and jade reveal their forms—gold’s mother resides within the Central Palace.

The tenth recitation corresponds to "Earth Ten completes it." Heaven Five generates Earth, and earth resides in the center, for earth is the root of the myriad things’ generation and completion. The earth of Heaven Five is yang earth; the earth of Earth Ten is yin earth. When the two earths are layered, they form a *gui*, so the returned elixir is called a *blade gui*. Metal resides within it—this is Qian Metal restraining Li Fire within Kun Earth, the so-called inversion and extension of the five phases. If one cultivates this, one can reverse aging and return to youth, transcend the ordinary and enter sagehood, thus reviving the dead, as the Most High did with Xu Jia.

chunks.original_text: 故曰枯骨更生，皆起成人。 是时一国是男是女，莫不倾心。 一国之中男，女等众，一闻经教，咸受护度而证长生之道矣。 国，犹身也。 男女即阴阳二炁也。 倾心者，阴阳以类相投也。 阴阳之炁，冲和则太乙归真，生身受度，死魂受炼，是谓长生矣。 道言：是时元始天尊说经一徧，东方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经二徧，南方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经三徧，西方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经四徧，北方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经五徧，东北无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经六徧，东南无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经七徧，西南无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经八徧，西北无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经九徧。 上方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 说经十徧，下方无极无量品至真大神、无鞅之众浮空而至。 此道君序授经之始末也。 十回度人，十转回灵，此经与序之本旨也。 天尊说经，感召十方无极众真、无鞅之众，皆浮空而至。 东方梵监须延天等震宫卯位，为无鞅之众。 南方郁单无量天等离宫午位，为无鞅之众。 西方灵化梵辅天等兑宫酉位，为无鞅之众。 北方洞元化应声天等坎宫子位，为无鞅之众。 东北高虚清明天等艮宫寅位，为无鞅之众。 东南波罗尼密不骄乐天等巽宫巳位，为无鞅之众。 西南寂然兜术天等坤宫申位，为无鞅之众。 西北上上禅善无量寿天等乾宫亥位，为无鞅之众。 上方九霄上清玉真三十六天等为无鞅之众。 下方无色界、色界、欲界三十二天等，以至三元九地无鞅之众，俱会始青天中浮黎土内，闻经听法。 内而修之，真铅为药，祖玄关为丹基，即元始说经也。 土居中宫，自成十数，中即玄关也。 十徧者，乃天地生成之数。 十方者，五行配合，一、三、五、七、九天数，二十有五，阳精也。 二四六八十，地数，阴华也。 阳之生数五，五行之本也。 阴之成数十，万化之根也。 一九，四六，合而为十，乃金水同宗，二八，三七，合而为十，乃木火同体。 总之为五十有五，分隶五方。 五行颠倒，则龙从火出，虎向水生，火生於木，则砂中抽汞，乃七返，朱砂返本。 水自金生，则银内制铅，乃九还，金液还真。 《易》曰：天地絪缊，万物媾醇，是乃无量无极至真大神皆至也。 故丹基法象，分三百八十四爻，循环火侯，内运五星，二十八宿环列，鼎内促三千六百之正炁，回七十二侯之要津，驱六十四卦之阴符，鼓二十四炁之阳火，则三魂卫形，七魄归体。 身中万二千神，一时听命，此所谓十转回灵，万炁齐仙也。 十徧周竟，十方无极天真大神一时同至。 一国男女倾心皈仰，来者有如细雨密雾，无鞅之众，迮国一半，土皆徧陷，非可禁止。 说经至十徧周竟，十方天真大神一时皆会。 至男女无不皈仰，是若细雨密雾之众也。 迮国一半，充满国内之半，而天尊威德崇重，地不能载，至乃偏陷，而终莫能禁止之。 人身十转之功既备，乃念息神凝，性还命复，则真铅归室矣。 一身阴阳之炁混融，熏蒸四体，有如雨雾之润泽，周流六虚，上下无常，往来不息，即无鞅之众充满盈塞，虽至国迮土陷，不可止也。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus it is said: withered bones revive, all arise as complete beings. At this time, in that land, whether man or woman, none fails to turn their heart whole. Among all the men and women of that land, upon hearing the scriptural teachings, all receive protection and deliverance, attaining the Dao of longevity.

The land is like the body; men and women are the yin and yang qi. "Turning the heart whole" means yin and yang unite by kind. When the qi of yin and yang harmonize and intermingle, the Great One returns to the true, the living body receives deliverance, and the dead soul undergoes refinement—this is called longevity.

The Dao states: when the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning recites the scripture once, the boundless, immeasurable hosts of perfected great spirits from the Eastern Direction of the Limitless arrive floating through the void. When he recites it twice, those from the Southern Direction arrive floating through the void. When he recites it thrice, those from the Western Direction arrive floating through the void. When he recites it four times, those from the Northern Direction arrive floating through the void. When he recites it five times, those from the Northeast arrive floating through the void. When he recites it six times, those from the Southeast arrive floating through the void. When he recites it seven times, those from the Southwest arrive floating through the void. When he recites it eight times, those from the Northwest arrive floating through the void. When he recites it nine times, those from the Upper Direction arrive floating through the void. When he recites it ten times, those from the Lower Direction arrive floating through the void. This is the sequence in which the Dao Lord transmitted the scripture from beginning to end.

Ten recitations deliver beings; ten revolutions return the numinous—this is the fundamental purport of the scripture and its preface. As the Heavenly Worthy recites the scripture, he summons the boundless hosts of perfected spirits from the ten directions of the Limitless, all arriving floating through the void: from the Eastern Direction, the Brahma-Monitor Xu Yan Heaven and others of the Zhen Palace, Mao position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Southern Direction, the Yüdan Immeasurable Heaven and others of the Li Palace, Wu position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Western Direction, the Spirit-Transformed Brahma-Assistant Heaven and others of the Dui Palace, You position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Northern Direction, the Cavernous Primordial Resonant-Heaven and others of the Kan Palace, Zi position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Northeast, the Lofty Void Pure Bright Heaven and others of the Gen Palace, Yin position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Southeast, the Pāramitā Unconceited Joy Heaven and others of the Xun Palace, Si position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Southwest, the Stillness-Enveloped Tuśita Heaven and others of the Kun Palace, Shen position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Northwest, the Supreme Meditation Goodness Immeasurable Longevity Heaven and others of the Qian Palace, Hai position, forming the boundless hosts; from the Upper Direction, the Nine Empyreans, Upper Clarity, Jade Perfected, and the thirty-six heavens, forming the boundless hosts; from the Lower Direction, the Formless Realm, Form Realm, Desire Realm, and the thirty-two heavens, extending to the boundless hosts of the Three Origins and Nine Earths—all assemble within the Azure Beginning Heaven, in the Floating Black Soil, to hear the scripture and listen to the Dharma.

Cultivating this internally, true lead becomes the medicine, and the Primordial Mysterious Pass becomes the foundation of the elixir—this is the recitation of the scripture by the Primordial Beginning. Earth dwells in the Central Palace, naturally forming the number ten; the center is the Mysterious Pass. The ten recitations correspond to the generative and completive numbers of heaven and earth. The ten directions arise from the five phases’ combinations: one, three, five, seven, nine are the celestial numbers, totaling twenty-five, the essence of yang. Two, four, six, eight, ten are the terrestrial numbers, the blossoms of yin. The generative number of yang is five, the root of the five phases; the completive number of yin is ten, the root of the myriad transformations. One and nine, four and six, combined make ten—this is metal and water sharing the same origin. Two and eight, three and seven, combined make ten—this is wood and fire sharing the same body. In total, they make fifty-five, distributed among the five directions.

When the five phases are inverted, the dragon emerges from fire, and the tiger arises from water. Fire is born of wood, thus cinnabar draws forth mercury—this is the sevenfold return, cinnabar returning to its origin. Water is born of metal, thus silver refines lead within—this is the ninefold restoration, golden liquid returning to the true. The *Book of Changes* states: "Heaven and earth intermingle, and the myriad things mate in purity"—thus the boundless, limitless hosts of perfected great spirits all arrive.

Therefore, the foundation of the elixir mirrors the three hundred eighty-four lines, circulating the fire times. Internally, the five stars revolve, the twenty-eight constellations array in orbit, the crucible hastens the three thousand six hundred upright qi, returns through the seventy-two seasonal nodes, drives the sixty-four hexagrams’ yin tally, and drums the twenty-four qi’s yang fire. Then the three hun guard the form, the seven po return to the body, and the twelve thousand spirits within the body all heed the command—this is called the ten revolutions returning the numinous, the myriad qi ascending together as immortals.

When the ten recitations are complete, the perfected great spirits of the ten directions of the Limitless arrive simultaneously. The men and women of the land turn their hearts in devotion, coming like fine rain and dense mist. The boundless hosts press upon half the land, causing the earth to sink everywhere—none can prevent it. When the recitation of the scripture is complete after ten cycles, the great spirits of the ten directions all assemble at once. None among men and women fail to turn in devotion, like the crowds of fine rain and dense mist. Pressing upon half the land, filling half the country, the Heavenly Worthy’s majestic virtue is so weighty that the earth cannot bear it, sinking entirely—yet none can prevent it.

When the ten revolutions’ work within the body is complete, one’s thoughts cease and spirit congeals, nature returns and life is restored—then true lead returns to the chamber. The qi of yin and yang within the body blend and fuse, steaming the four limbs like the moistening of rain and mist. Circulating through the six voids, moving above and below without constancy, coming and going without cease, the boundless hosts fill and saturate the space—though the land is pressed and the earth sinks, it cannot be stopped.

chunks.original_text: 於是，元始悬一宝珠，大如黍米，在空玄之中，去地五丈。 辛君曰：元始，己之元神也。 宝珠，即心也。 儒曰太极，释曰圆觉，盖一理也。 道亦曰玄珠、心珠、黍珠，即是物也。 宝者，至精至真之义，即灵宝之谓也。 大如黍米，以其大包宇宙，细入毫芒，所谓其大无外，其小无内，变化莫测，是以在空玄之中，不可以迹求也。 、去地五丈者，五乃土数，得五行之中也。 犹五行生成之数，虚中以象太极，心虚则元神居之，是为空玄之中矣。 岂非空炁金胎之谓乎？ 故玄师曰：此乃玉清宝珠，神化仙胎之道。 按萧观复曰：元始悬珠、者，神与道俱也。 向来说经狮子之上者，乃神凝室中，从无求有也。 今此悬珠空玄之中者，乃超神物外，出有入无也是矣。 此皆天尊显示妙化之机，以明其至精至微之中，而有至妙之道存焉。 元始登引天真大神、上圣高尊、妙行真人十方无极至真大神，无鞅数众，俱入宝珠之中。 天人仰看，惟见勃勃从珠口中入，既入珠口，不知所在。 国人廓散，地还平正，无复欹陷。 天尊悬宝珠在空玄之中，登引三元九圣、五老九真、天真大神、无鞅之众，俱入珠中。 其天人仰看，皆在空玄之中，五明之内，百亿光中。 惟见勃勃从珠口中入，即不见其为空玄之境也。 故不知所在。 国人亦皆廓散，寂然不动，则地亦平正，不复欹陷矣。 其非天真上圣，不能同入空玄之妙，祗仰看而已。 其曰十方无极至真大神、无鞅数众者，俱入矣。 岂非天人乎！ 盖己之心珠朗彻，炁合神冥， 敛万归一，即无鞅之众，皆入吾珠口矣。 则六根静寂，一真独露，又何欹陷之不平正也哉。 元始即於宝珠之内，说经都竟，众真监度，以授於我。 当此之时，喜庆难言。 法事粗悉，诸天复位，倏欻之间，寂无遗响。 元始於宝珠之内，说经既毕，众真监侍，乃授度於道君。 是时，道君喜庆难言，非可名喻。 无鞅之众法事亦悉，则诸天真皆还所治，一国之内，倏然恬静，寂然无遗响矣。 内而元神，中居一炁，混融九窍，洞明金母，摄制砂汞，归於鼎内。 行功至是，欣悦难以言喻。 一刻之工已竟，万神还元。 惚恍冥寂，宝珠之象，亦无复归於无极矣。 是时天人遇值经法，普得济度，全其本年，无有中伤。 倾土归仰，咸行善心，不杀不害，不嫉不妬，不淫不盗，不贪不欲，不憎不□。 言无华绮，口无恶声，齐同慈爱，异骨成亲。 国安民丰，欣乐太平。 天尊说经既竟，诸天复位之后，一闻经法，普得济度，皆全其天年，而终无复中道夭伤矣。 且皆倾土归仰经教，顿行善心，凡杀害、嫉妬、淫盗、贪欲、憎、华绮、恶声，俱已净尽； 是乃慈爱一体，异骨成亲，则国亦安，民亦丰，惟欣乐太平之象而已。 盖人性无不善，其不善也，皆蔽於物欲，溺於习气而然。 故放僻邪侈，流而忘返，必至伤其天年矣。 惟务纵其杀害、嫉妬、淫盗、贪欲之心，岂知民吾同胞，物吾同气，而以慈爱接之，焉能致国安民丰，而乐太平也哉。 此固修养之士，犹所当戒。 既闻经法，即敛心凝神，以炼己度人为本。 久之，归根复命，情冥性寂，则可冀长生久视矣。 加以惩忿窒欲，政虚守静，损之又损，动静语默，无往不善，则必能不杀不害，不淫不盗矣。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus, the Primordial Beginning suspended a single precious pearl, vast as a millet grain, within the Void Mystery—five measures above the earth.

Master Xin said: The Primordial Beginning is one’s primordial spirit; the precious pearl is the heart. The Confucians call it the Supreme Ultimate, the Buddhists call it Perfect Enlightenment—yet it is the same principle. The Dao also names it the Mystery Pearl, the Heart Pearl, the Millet Pearl: all refer to this same thing. "Precious" signifies the most refined and true, meaning the numinous treasure. "Vast as a millet grain" describes how it encompasses the cosmos yet enters the finest hair-tip—what is called "so great there is nothing beyond, so small there is nothing within," its transformations unfathomable. Thus it dwells within the Void Mystery, beyond all trace or pursuit.

The measure of five above the earth: five is the number of earth, the center of the Five Phases. Like the generative numbers of the Five Phases, the void center embodies the Supreme Ultimate. When the heart is empty, the primordial spirit resides there—this is the Void Mystery. Is this not the golden embryo of empty qi? Therefore, the Mystery Master said: This is the Jade Clarity Precious Pearl, the Dao of divine transformation and immortal embryo.

According to Xiao Guanfu: The Primordial Beginning suspending the pearl means spirit and Dao are united. Earlier, the preaching upon the lion’s throne occurred when spirit congealed within the chamber, moving from non-being to being. Now, the pearl suspended in the Void Mystery transcends spirit beyond things, passing from being into non-being. All these are the Heavenly Worthy’s manifestations of wondrous transformation, revealing that within the most refined and subtle, the most wondrous Dao abides.

The Primordial Beginning then summoned the Heavenly Perfected, the Great Spirits, the Lofty Worthies, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Boundless Perfected Great Spirits of the Ten Directions, and the innumerable hosts—all entered into the precious pearl. Heavenly beings gazed upward and saw them bustling in through the pearl’s mouth; once inside, their whereabouts were unknown. The people of the land dispersed, and the earth returned to levelness, no longer sunken or slanted.

The Heavenly Worthy suspended the precious pearl within the Void Mystery, summoning the Three Origins and Nine Sages, the Five Elders and Nine Perfected, the Heavenly Perfected Great Spirits, and the innumerable hosts—all entered the pearl. The heavenly beings gazed upward and saw them within the Void Mystery, within the Five Luminances, amid a hundred million rays of light. They saw them bustling in through the pearl’s mouth, yet once inside, the realm of the Void Mystery vanished from sight. Thus their whereabouts were unknown. The people of the land also dispersed in silence, and the earth became level, no longer sunken or slanted.

Those who were not Heavenly Perfected or Lofty Worthies could not enter the wondrousness of the Void Mystery, only gaze upward in reverence. As for the Boundless Perfected Great Spirits of the Ten Directions and the innumerable hosts—all entered. Were these not heavenly beings?

When one’s heart-pearl is luminous and clear, qi merges with spirit in darkness, gathering the myriad into one, then the innumerable hosts all enter through the mouth of one’s pearl. The six roots become still and silent, the solitary true emerges—how could any slant or sinking fail to return to levelness?

Within the precious pearl, the Primordial Beginning then expounded the scripture in full. The Perfected oversaw the transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration defied words. The ritual matters were roughly complete, the myriad heavens returned to their positions, and in an instant, all was silent without lingering resonance.

Within the precious pearl, the Primordial Beginning finished expounding the scripture. The Perfected attended in vigil, and the transmission was conferred upon the Dao Lord. At that time, the Dao Lord’s joy and celebration defied words, beyond all naming or description. The ritual matters of the innumerable hosts were also complete, and the Perfected of the heavens all returned to their domains. Within the land, all was suddenly tranquil and still, silent without lingering resonance.

Within, the primordial spirit; at the center, a single qi; blending and fusing the nine apertures; illuminating the Golden Mother; gathering and refining cinnabar and mercury, returning them to the crucible. At this stage of practice, joy defies words. A moment’s work is complete, the myriad spirits return to their origin. In the dim and mysterious stillness, the image of the precious pearl also returns to the Ultimate Non-Being.

At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered the scripture’s teachings were universally delivered and saved, preserving their natural lifespans without premature harm. The entire land turned in devotion, all cultivating good hearts: no killing, no harm, no envy, no jealousy, no licentiousness, no theft, no greed, no desire, no hatred, no [lacuna]. Words were free of ornate embellishment, speech free of evil sounds. Equal in compassion and love, even those of different bones became kin. The land was at peace, the people prosperous, rejoicing in great harmony.

After the Heavenly Worthy finished expounding the scripture and the heavens returned to their positions, all who heard the teachings were universally delivered and saved, preserving their natural lifespans without premature harm along the way. They all turned in devotion to the scripture’s teachings, swiftly cultivating good hearts. All killing and harm, envy and jealousy, licentiousness and theft, greed and desire, hatred and [lacuna], ornate words and evil speech were entirely purified. Thus, with compassion and love as one body, even those of different bones became kin. The land was at peace, the people prosperous, and all rejoiced in the image of great harmony.

Human nature is without exception good; its lack of goodness arises from being obscured by material desires and drowned in habitual qi. Thus, indulgence in depravity and excess flows unchecked, leading inevitably to harm of one’s natural lifespan. If one only pursues the hearts of killing and harm, envy and jealousy, licentiousness and theft, greed and desire, how can one know that the people are my siblings and all things share my qi? Approaching them with compassion and love, how could the land be at peace, the people prosperous, and all enjoy great harmony?

This is certainly what cultivators must guard against. Having heard the scripture’s teachings, one gathers the heart and congeals the spirit, taking self-cultivation and delivering others as the foundation. Over time, returning to the root and restoring life, emotions darken and nature becomes still—then one may hope for longevity and enduring vision. By restraining anger and blocking desires, governing emptiness and guarding stillness, diminishing again and again, in movement and stillness, speech and silence, there is nothing that is not good—then one will surely be able to refrain from killing and harm, licentiousness and theft.
chunks.overlap_context: ions’ work within the body is complete, one’s thoughts cease and spirit congeals, nature returns and life is restored—then true lead returns to the chamber. The qi of yin and yang within the body blend and fuse, steaming the four limbs like the moistening of rain and mist. Circulating through the six voids, moving above and below without constancy, coming and going without cease, the boundless hosts fill and saturate the space—though the land is pressed and the earth sinks, it cannot be stopped.

chunks.original_text: 又何华绮恶声之戾哉！ 至此，则凡蠢动飞潜，皆所慈爱，初无亲疏之间。 国犹身也，能冲炁为和，万物皆育，虽参赞化育，阴翊皇祚，皆由乎中也。 是所以政太平於国，安民丰之域矣。 经始出教一国，以道预有至心，宗奉礼敬，皆得度世。 此言天尊之始说经也。 一国之人，皆遵道而行，教之由是立也。 心乃旷劫以来之灵明也，虽经教未出之先，此心已具，是日预有也。 特沉着幻妄，迷惑蔽固，则舍而亡矣。 今由经法济度之后，顿悟顿释，性归命复，一旦遵道而行，万妄归真矣。 宗奉者，宗犹本源也。 若水之宗海，皆归其源也。 礼敬者，敬信之笃也。 故皆获度世矣。 苟忘本而逐末，舍源而求流，其能度世乎？ 经为道之径，心为道之宗，能依经 敛心，则得经之妙矣。 道言：元始天尊说经中所言，并是诸天上帝内名隐韵之音，亦是魔王内讳，百灵之隐名也，非世之常辞。 诸天上帝内名，即三十二天名。 帝讳，天帝玉字内音也。 隐韵即经中所谓诸天隐韵，天中之音自然灵章也。 魔王内讳，即五天魔王讳巴元丑伯也。 百灵隐名，即 无英、白元、桃康、合延也。 并是天尊所宣说，道君承教而述，非世之凡俗所能知也。 内而求之，如丹经所谓日魂月魄、庚虎甲龙、水银朱砂、红铅黑锡、黄芽白雪、姹女婴儿、黄婆金公、阳火阴符、玄关土釜、炉鼎卦象之类。 虽异 名别号之众，不过先天真一之炁，为之丹祖也。 非因师指，岂凡愚所能知也。 上圣已成真人，通玄究微，能悉其章。 诵之十过，诸天遥唱，万帝设礼。 河海静默，山岳藏云。 日月停景，璇玑不行。 群魔束形，鬼精灭爽。 回尸起死，白骨成人。 此言真人修诵之功效也。 上圣已成，如天帝高真宿修妙行，圣功已成，不假修习也。 真人由精心苦行，炼神养炁而后体合自然，不滞有无，永脱生灭，是皆洞究玄微，悟彻幽密，故能悉尽其奥章，即混洞赤文敷落五篇之类是也。 悉能详尽，则诵之十过，诸天降临，万帝鉴观，皆遥唱玉音，设礼内讳，靡不尊经之旨，赞经之功也。 於是河海停波，山岳敛雾，日月停轮，星斗止曜，群魔局迹，鬼妖伏藏，皆修诵之效，致此大应。 犹能回尸起死，白骨成人，虽亡魂沉魄，皆乘经功而更生矣。 十过之效，在丹道则十月胎圆而神化矣。 诸天者，即真铅内融，万神和畅； 河海山岳，即爱河欲海也。 苟能一真独露，万幻皆空，则爱河浪止，苦海波澄矣。 日月璇玑，即大定神光，洞照八识，则外魔伏、内魔灭矣。 至此则生身受度，死魂受炼，岂无回骸起死之功哉！ 至学之士诵之十过，则五帝侍卫，三界稽首，魔精丧眼，鬼妖灭爽，济度垂死，绝而得生。 此言至学之士修诵之功效也。 至学，乃笃至修学之士也。 仙师曰：至学之士，心坚如铁石，操烈於水火，天地不能逾，鬼神不能惑，行人所不能行，莫非力行之确也。 故诵经至十过，则五炁之神侍卫，听命三界，魔王亦稽首保举矣。 此皆至学之士，行积功立，制魔则魔精慑伏，不敢正视，故丧眼也。 魔王既已保举，鬼妖皆束形灭爽矣。 以之济度垂死已绝者，度之复生。 内而求之，五帝，五脏之神也。 三界三尸，六贼也，魔精鬼妖，七情六欲也。 人能遣欲澄心，少思寡欲，然后心静神清，精全气固，则五脏安宁，三尸削灭，六根清净，万念俱空。
chunks.translated_text:
Why then should there be extravagant adornments or harsh sounds? At this stage, all creatures—whether creeping, flying, or hidden—are embraced with compassion, without distinction of near or far. The state is like the body: when one harmonizes with the primordial qi, all things are nurtured. Even in assisting transformation and fostering life, or subtly supporting the imperial destiny, all arises from within.

Thus, governing the state in great peace and securing the realm of prosperous tranquility is achieved. When the scripture first emerged to teach a single nation, those who held the Dao with utmost sincerity, revered and honored its rites, all attained deliverance across the world. This speaks of the Heavenly Worthy’s initial proclamation of the scripture. When the people of a nation all follow the Dao in conduct, the teachings are thereby established.

The heart is the luminous clarity from kalpas past; though the teachings had not yet appeared, this heart was already complete—this is called "preexisting." Yet, mired in illusion and delusion, it became obscured and lost. Now, through the deliverance of the scripture’s method, sudden awakening and liberation occur, nature returns to life, and destiny is restored. Once one follows the Dao in conduct, all delusions revert to truth.

"Revering and honoring" means taking the source as fundamental. Like water flowing to the sea, all returns to its origin. "Honoring with rites" signifies profound reverence and faith. Thus, all attain deliverance across the world. If one forgets the root and chases the branches, abandons the source to seek the stream, how can one achieve deliverance?

The scripture is the path of the Dao; the heart is the Dao’s source. By aligning with the scripture and gathering the heart, one grasps the scripture’s subtleties.

The Dao states: The words spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy in the scripture are the hidden rhymes of the inner names of the Heavenly Emperors, as well as the secret taboos of demon kings and the concealed names of the hundred spirits—these are not ordinary worldly terms.

The inner names of the Heavenly Emperors refer to the names of the Thirty-Two Heavens. The imperial taboos are the inner sounds of the Jade Characters of the Heavenly Emperors. The hidden rhymes are the natural numinous verses of the heavens, as mentioned in the scripture. The inner taboos of the demon kings refer to the Five Heavenly Demon Kings: Ba, Yuan, Chou, and Bo. The hidden names of the hundred spirits include Wu Ying, Bai Yuan, Tao Kang, and He Yan. All these were proclaimed by the Heavenly Worthy and transmitted by the Dao Lord—beyond the knowledge of worldly mortals.

Turning inward to seek, as in the alchemical classics: solar essence and lunar spirit, Metal Tiger and Wood Dragon, mercury and cinnabar, red lead and black tin, yellow sprout and white snow, the maiden and the infant, the yellow matron and the golden lord, yang fire and yin tally, the mysterious pass and the earthen cauldron, the furnace and the trigrams—though their names and designations vary, they are but the primordial true unity of qi, the ancestral elixir. Without a master’s guidance, how could the foolish comprehend?

The perfected sages, having attained realization, penetrate the profound and exhaust the subtle, mastering all its verses. Reciting it ten times, the heavens echo from afar, and the myriad emperors pay homage. Rivers and seas grow still, mountains and peaks conceal their clouds. The sun and moon pause their radiance, the celestial pivot ceases its turning. Demon hosts bind their forms, ghostly spirits lose their clarity. The dead revive, white bones become flesh—this describes the efficacy of the perfected one’s recitation.

The "perfected sages" refer to the lofty immortals of the heavens, whose wondrous practices and sacred merits are already complete, requiring no further cultivation. The "perfected ones" achieve this through diligent practice, refining spirit and nurturing qi, ultimately merging with the natural—transcending being and non-being, forever escaping birth and death. Having thoroughly investigated the profound and awakened to the obscure, they fully grasp the scripture’s mysteries, such as the *Hun Dun Chi Wen* and the *Five Falling Scripts*.

Having mastered these, reciting it ten times summons the descent of the heavens, the observation of the myriad emperors, all echoing the jade sounds and honoring the inner taboos. None fail to revere the scripture’s intent and praise its merit. Thus, rivers and seas halt their waves, mountains and peaks withdraw their mists, the sun and moon pause their wheels, and the stars cease their radiance. Demon hosts retreat, ghostly spirits and demons hide—all effects of recitation, eliciting such great responses. Even the dead revive, white bones become flesh; though souls and spirits may have perished, they are reborn through the scripture’s power.

The efficacy of ten recitations in the alchemical path corresponds to the ten months of gestation, when the spirit is transformed.

The "heavens" here signify the inner fusion of true lead, with all spirits in harmony. The "rivers, seas, mountains, and peaks" represent the river of love and the sea of desire. If one’s singular truth is revealed, all illusions dissolve—then the waves of the river of love subside, and the billows of the sea of suffering grow calm. The "sun, moon, and celestial pivot" signify the great samadhi’s divine light, illuminating the eight consciousnesses—thus, external demons submit, and inner demons vanish. At this stage, the living body is delivered, and the dead soul is refined—how could there be no power to revive the dead?

For the devoted scholar who recites it ten times, the Five Emperors stand guard, the Three Realms bow in reverence, demonic spirits lose their sight, ghostly beings vanish, and those on the brink of death are delivered to new life—this describes the efficacy of the devoted scholar’s recitation.

"Devoted scholars" are those of utmost dedication in their studies. The immortal master said: The devoted scholar’s heart is firm as iron and stone, their resolve unyielding in water or fire—beyond the reach of heaven and earth, unshaken by ghosts or spirits. They practice what others cannot, unwavering in their efforts. Thus, reciting the scripture ten times, the spirits of the five qi stand guard, the Three Realms heed their command, and even demon kings bow in submission and vouch for them.

This is the result of the devoted scholar’s accumulated merit and established deeds. In subduing demons, demonic spirits cower and dare not meet their gaze—thus, they lose their sight. With demon kings vouching for them, ghostly beings and demons bind their forms and vanish. Through this, those on the verge of death are delivered and revived.

Turning inward: the Five Emperors are the spirits of the five viscera; the Three Realms are the three corpses, the six thieves; demonic spirits and ghostly beings are the seven emotions and six desires. If one can dispel desires and calm the heart, reducing thoughts and curbing cravings, then the heart grows still, the spirit clear, essence complete, and qi firm. The five viscera find peace, the three corpses are eradicated, the six roots purified, and all thoughts dissolve into emptiness.

By restraining anger and blocking desires, governing emptiness and guarding stillness, diminishing again and again, in movement and stillness, speech and silence, there is nothing that is not good—then one will surely be able to refrain from killing and harm, licentiousness and theft.
