At *Xūyán*, the Bright-Headed One grasps the *Pútán*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Jade Perfection Heaven.

*Xūyán*: The name of the northwest gate of the Jade Perfection Heaven. When the great kalpas intersect, *Xūyán* opens here, and the Jade Perfected and Upper Sages return here.
*Míngshǒu*: The Capital Marquis of the Primordial Beginning. When the Primordial Beginning inaugurates the kalpa, the Capital Marquis initiates the Dao, and the qi of Brahman conduct instantly brightens.
*Fǎ*: The field of the Dharma Wheel’s karmic retribution.
*Lǎn*: Awakening. This is the Heavenly Emperor Lord’s taboo name, presiding over the deliverance of souls and their rebirth.
*Pú*: *Bodhi*. Holding the nine-colored staff.
*Tán*: *Tányí*. Grasping the ten-absolute banner.

Together, these are the Upper Primordial Perfected, who, by constantly reciting the Cavern Chapters, cause the Dharma Wheel to guide the ledgers, Awakening to deliver souls, *Bodhi* to turn the wheel, and *Tányí* to unfurl the banner. Heaven and Earth thereby avoid collapse, and the myriad beings attain eternal existence.

The Azure Primordial says: *Fǎlǎn Pútán* are the Perfected of the Four Courts of the Jade Purity.

*Jiànà Āyì*, *Hūhē Liúyín*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Hoary Youth Heaven.

*Jiànà*: The title of the Heavenly Master of Charts, overseeing the ledgers of human life and death, governing immortals, and presiding over the Golden Flower Palace.
*Āyì*: The name of a tree in the Seven Treasures Grove, covering the four directions. Its fruits are the playground of the Upper Sages and the garden of the Perfected.
*Hū*: Awakening. The name of a flying heavenly spirit, presiding over the convergence of great and small kalpas.
*Hē*: *Hēmó*. In Heaven, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy is called *Hēmó*.
*Liúyín*: The dissemination of chanted hymns. When the kalpa’s destiny ends, *Hēmó* reveals the teachings to universally deliver heavenly and human beings. As the kalpa nears destruction, the true scriptures are concealed, and the Heavenly Worthy, foreknowing this, preemptively sings the hymns.

Those who constantly recite the Cavern Chapters will have the Master of Charts erase their sin records in the eternal night and inscribe their names in the Southern Palace.

*Huādū Qūlì*, *Xiānpú Yùzhēn*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Level Nurturance Heaven.

*Huādū*: An alternate name for the Azure Flower Gate of the Great Ultimate Palace in Heaven.
*Qū*: The heavenly Brahman spirits flying above the Great Ultimate, riding the qi of the luminous wind, singing the melodies of the Cavern Chapters.
*Lì*: The name of a Jade Maiden of Supreme Harmony.
*Xiān*: *Xiānyún* (Auspicious Cloud).
*Pú*: The name of a tower in Heaven.
*Yù*: The hidden name of the Heavenly Emperor Lord.
*Zhēn*: Arrival. The *Yù* Emperor constantly rides the wheel of the eight luminaries, roaming beyond the eight poles, and returns with the ten-absolute numinous banner to summon heavenly demons and deliver heavenly beings. Those who constantly recite this Cavern Chapter will have flying heavens chant from afar, the Three Realms’ administrators welcome them, and their seven ancestors emerge from the eternal night to ascend to the Southern Palace.

*Dāluò Dàfàn*, *Sànyān Qìngyún*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Literary Elevation Heaven.

*Dā*: The name of a jade tower in Heaven.
*Luò*: The tower’s brilliance, resplendent and radiant.
*Dà*: At the inception of the kalpa’s transformation by the Heavenly Worthy of Great Pardon, a great amnesty is declared, called *Dàyòu*, emptying the Three Evil Paths and halting the trials of the Nine Dark Realms.
*Fàn*: The qi of Brahman conduct, inaugurating the Dragon Han kalpa and governing the era of Crimson Brightness.
*Sànyān*: Perfected Ones dispersing incense smoke at the Jade Pass.
*Qìngyún*: The five-colored auspicious clouds.

The auspicious clouds reach the Purple Palace, and flying heavens dance in the wheel of space.

The Azure Primordial says: When the Primordial Beginning first declared the great amnesty, the *Dāluò* palace courts released imprisoned souls.

*Fēisǎ Yùdū*, *Míngmó Shàngmén*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Māyā Heaven.

*Fēi*: The title of the Flying Heavenly Spirit King. When Heaven and Earth’s destiny changes and sinks into *Yánkāng*, darkness prevails without end. The Flying Heavenly Spirit illuminates and scatters radiance, and all heavens receive the sprinkled qi. In the Dragon Han kalpa, this occurs in an instant.
*Yù*: *Yùzhēn*, the sacred title of the one who opens the eternal night.
*Dū*: The *Fēngdū* of the Nine Dark Realms. If one has meritorious deeds, *Yùzhēn* opens the gates of the eternal night, and *Fēngdū* delivers them from the eight difficulties. The seven ancestors are reborn, and the dark souls regain their light.
*Míng*: Understanding the meaning of the eight characters.
*Mó*: The Demon King.
*Shàng*: The Supreme Emperor.
*Mén*: Those beneath the Straight Gate who can clearly comprehend the meaning of the eight characters will have the Demon King respectfully submit and the Supreme Emperor nurture them at the Gate of Initial Birth. Beneath the gate, the Lord Han oversees destiny and records in the Southern Palace, bestowing blessings upon the nine clans and granting grace in life and death.

*Wúxíng Shàngshǒu*, *Huízhí Liúxuán*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Transcendent Balance Heaven.

*Wú*: The Upper Dao. It speaks of the qi of the Primordial Beginning illuminating the unsurpassed Dao.
*Xíng*: The heavenly net of the primordial kalpa, encompassing the eight poles. Brahman qi pervades and flows ceaselessly.
*Shàngshǒu*: The Sin-Recording Palace of the Northern Dipper. When the celestial mechanism turns and the kalpa’s calculations converge, the numbers culminate, and the great kalpas intersect.
*Huí*: Turning.
*Zhí*: Treading. At the kalpa’s inception, the Primordial Beginning treads the void and turns the wheel, disseminating transformation across the ten directions.
*Liú*: Flowing with the light of the Three Dawns, illuminating the palace of the eternal night.
*Xuán*: Emptiness. The Transcendent Balance Heaven’s *Xuándū* has the Empty Peak Mountain, where the myriad sages roam and the living and dead return. If one’s Dao is insufficient and the body is destined for extinction, the soul ascends to the Empty Peak to undergo refinement and ascend to the Southern Palace.

*Ātuó Lóngluó*, *Sìxiàng Xūyuán*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the Veiled Heaven.

*Ā*: In Heaven, there is a nine-fold mountain range, connected in continuous ridges.
*Tuó*: The tower atop the mountain, reaching the radiance of the Jade Purity and overlooking the realms of the Three Worlds. The Emperor Lord often roams the ridges of *Āqiū*, monitoring the sins of the myriad beings.
*Lóng*: Dragon Mountain, nine hundred million miles from *Ātuó*.
*Luó*: The names of the sun and moon.

chunks.original_text: 罗言山势相交，日月明於峰上。 四者，四极之宫。 谓东华、南极、西灵、北真也。 四极真人，主生死命籍。 象者，象轮之车。 真人常乘象辇，游行三界，校人生死罪录，开度学人。 吁者，曲育也。 天帝之讳为南宫度命君，主炼度朽魂。 员者，帝也。 是日中生童，主灌精於天人。 人能诵咏洞章，则玉名入於帝箓，生死度於南宫，四极给自然之羽车，七祖欢升於福堂也。 南方八天 南阎　音焰　洞浮，玉眸诜诜。 八字，和阳天内音。 南阎者，南方有流火之庭，飞焰焕乎八方。 洞浮者，洞阳之宫，流火之炁，炎而浮上也。 玉眸者，流火之膏，炼身体、生玉光、明如眸子，故曰玉眸。 南极真人主於宫内，诸学人始得道者，皆诣流火之庭，真人以火膏洗炼，荡除尘垢。 诜诜者，众多也。 梵形落空，九灵推前。 八字，恭华天内音。 梵形者，元始天尊在龙汉时号也。 赤明世号元名君，上皇开运，号元始丈人，梵炁化形，随劫化生，以一神而见，不受胎生。 落空者，元始自空中而生。 九灵者，九华真人也。 治南昌上宫，主九幽宿对死魂。 推前者，真人主命录算，推死魂前生功德。 观复曰：一阴始生，乃砂中抽汞，真阴下降，如月之象。 复还中宫，阴归阳室，汞来投铅矣。 凙菩台，绿罗大千。 八字，宗飘天内音。 凙者，天中山名。 山上有众龙之窟，黄房之室。 者，真晨道君之内音，理於黄房，混大劫而不终，经龙汉而更明。 菩者，飞天真人隐号，有无数之众。 台者，玉台也。 居泽山之阳。 绿罗者，月中夫人字罗英，理治太阴度数，乘梵行之炁，运度之关，以应天元，无差忒。 至大劫交，则日月俱会於玉堂之上，俟劫再开，复运化也。 大千者，世界之数。 以千数至千为小千，小千数至千为中千，中千数至千为大千。 人能诵咏洞章，则升黄房之室，游玉台之中，览大千之境也。 眇莽九丑，韶谣缘邅。 八字，皇笳天内音。 眇者，延康之中，天书玉字，翳而不彰，眇眇然也。 莽者，龙汉开运，其文复明，莽莽然也。 遇真道，男女其运之极，又经一劫，九炁各生一兽，以害恶民。 其劫既开，九兽号为九丑之鬼。 北帝上真主生死图录，故立九丑以辅三官，数极九九八十一万，度天炁之交，九丑号为九都使者。 韶者，皇笳天神霄王内名。 神霄王是魔王之神，主常试学道之人，正与不正。 作谣歌以乱人心。 心固者，王即保举升皇笳天。 缘，南斗之别名。 邅，北斗之异号。 人有善功则列言於南斗，南斗即度三界之难，拔九幽之苦，告下魔王，不敢害败之。 人有恶行，则三官列言於北斗，北斗即告下魔王灭魂，付九幽之下，充长夜之役，永无出期。 云上九都，飞生自骞。 八字，堂耀天内音。 云上者，飞天神王内讳。 开龙汉劫，启赤明运，敷自然之书，立· 天地之根也。 九都者，三象既分，而有九层之台，处乎玉京之上，焕乎空玄之中，飞天神人常散百和之香，流五云之华，以观飞天真人。 台上有太真玉郎，一日三回，执十绝之旛，一周则诸天上帝三朝玄台，绕台三匝。 学士常诵洞章，则飞生为开不死之路，流长生之炁，下炼五魂，则八景存焉。 骞者，骞林也。 学士得上升玄台，游於骞林，身佩天书，口咏洞章，久则上朝玄都之宫也。
chunks.translated_text:
The peaks of *Luó* intertwine, where the sun and moon shine brightly above. The Four refers to the palaces of the Four Poles: East Florescence, South Ultimate, West Numinous, and North Perfected. The Perfected of the Four Poles govern the registers of life and death. *Xiàng* is the chariot of the Wheel of Symbols. The Perfected constantly ride these chariots, traversing the Three Realms to audit the records of beings’ lives and deaths, and to initiate and deliver learners.

*Xū* is the curved nurturing. The Heavenly Emperor’s taboo-name is the Southern Palace’s Lord of Life-Measurement, who oversees the refinement and deliverance of decayed souls. *Yuán* is the Emperor. He is the Youth Born at Midday, who pours essence upon the Heavenly People. Those who recite and chant the cavernous chapters will have their jade names inscribed in the Emperor’s register, their lives and deaths delivered at the Southern Palace, and the Four Poles will grant them natural feathered chariots, while their seven ancestors rejoice in ascending to the Hall of Blessings.

**Southern Eight Heavens**
*South Flaming* – *Yīnyàn* – *Cavern Floating* – *Jade Eyes Shimmering*
These eight characters are the inner sound of the Harmonious Yang Heaven.

*South Flaming*: In the south lies the Courtyard of Flowing Fire, its flying flames illuminating the eight directions. *Cavern Floating*: The Palace of Cavernous Yang, where the *qi* of flowing fire blazes and floats upward. *Jade Eyes*: The fat of flowing fire, which refines the body, generates jade radiance, and shines like pupils—hence called Jade Eyes. The Perfected of the South Ultimate preside within this palace. All learners who first attain the Dao proceed to the Courtyard of Flowing Fire, where the Perfected wash and refine them with the fire’s fat, scouring away the dust and filth.

*Shimmering*: Multitudinous. *Dharma-forms fall into emptiness, the Nine Numinous advance forward.*
These eight characters are the inner sound of the Reverent Florescence Heaven.

*Dharma-forms*: The title of the Primordial Heavenly Honored One during the Dragon Han kalpa. In the Red Clarity kalpa, he was called the Lord of Primordial Name; at the dawn of the Highest Sovereign’s reign, he was named the Primordial Venerable. His Dharma-body, transformed by the *qi* of Brahma, arises with the kalpas, manifesting as a single spirit without undergoing womb-birth. *Fall into emptiness*: The Primordial One arises from the void. *Nine Numinous*: The Nine Florescence Perfected, who govern the Upper Palace of South Prosperity and oversee the karmic confrontations of souls in the Nine Glooms. *Advance forward*: The Perfected, who manage the records of destiny, assess the merits of souls from past lives.

*Guān Fù* says: When the first *yin* arises, it is like cinnabar yielding mercury; true *yin* descends, resembling the moon’s image. Returning to the Central Palace, *yin* retreats to the Yang Chamber, and mercury hastens to merge with lead.

*Dù* and *Wū* are the Terrace of the Universal, *Green Net of the Great Thousand.*
These eight characters are the inner sound of the Ancestral Whirlwind Heaven.

*Dù*: A mountain name in Heaven, atop which lie the dens of myriad dragons and the Yellow Chambers. *Wū*: The inner sound of the Perfected of the True Dawn, who governs the Yellow Chambers, enduring the great kalpas without end and growing ever brighter through the Dragon Han. *Pú*: The hidden title of the Flying Heavenly Perfected, who number beyond count. *Terrace*: The Jade Terrace, situated on the southern side of Marsh Mountain. *Green Net*: Lady Luóyīng of the Moon, who administers the measures of the Great Yin, rides the *qi* of Brahma-conduct, and operates the Pass of Transformation in accord with the Heavenly Origin, without error. When the great kalpas converge, the sun and moon both assemble above the Jade Hall, awaiting the kalpa’s reopening to resume their transformations. *Great Thousand*: The reckoning of worlds. A thousand counted to a thousand is the Lesser Thousand; a thousand Lesser Thousands make a Middle Thousand; a thousand Middle Thousands make a Great Thousand. Those who recite and chant the cavernous chapters will ascend to the Yellow Chambers, wander within the Jade Terrace, and behold the realms of the Great Thousand.

*Vast and Nine Ugly, Sháo’s Songs and Yuán’s Circuit.*
These eight characters are the inner sound of the August Reed Heaven.

*Vast*: In the era of Extended Purity, the jade characters of Heavenly script were veiled and indistinct, faint and remote. *Vast*: When the Dragon Han kalpa began, its texts became bright again, vast and boundless. Upon encountering the true Dao, when the destiny of men and women reaches its limit and another kalpa passes, the nine *qi* each generate a beast to harm the wicked. Once the kalpa reopens, these nine beasts are called the Nine Ugly Ghosts. The Northern Emperor and the Upper Perfected govern the registers of life and death, thus establishing the Nine Ugly to assist the Three Officials. Their number culminates in eighty-one myriad, measuring the convergence of Heavenly *qi*. The Nine Ugly are titled the Nine Capital Envoys.

*Sháo*: The inner name of the Divine Sovereign of the August Reed Heaven. The Divine Sovereign of the Divine Empyrean is the spirit of the Demon King, who constantly tests learners of the Dao, discerning correctness from error. He composes songs to disturb the heart. Those whose hearts remain steadfast are then protected and promoted to ascend the August Reed Heaven. *Yuán* is another name for the Southern Dipper. *Zhān* is an alternate title for the Northern Dipper. Those with meritorious deeds are recorded by the Southern Dipper, which then delivers them from the trials of the Three Realms, rescues them from the sufferings of the Nine Glooms, and reports to the Demon King, who dares not harm or obstruct them. Those with evil deeds are recorded by the Three Officials and reported to the Northern Dipper, which then instructs the Demon King to annihilate their souls, consigning them to the depths of the Nine Glooms to toil through endless nights, never to emerge.

*Above the Clouds, Nine Capitals—Flying Life Soars Freely.*
These eight characters are the inner sound of the Hall Radiance Heaven.

*Above the Clouds*: The inner taboo-name of the Flying Heavenly Divine King. At the opening of the Dragon Han kalpa and the commencement of the Red Clarity kalpa, he unfolded the books of spontaneity and established the roots of Heaven and Earth. *Nine Capitals*: After the Three Symbols divided, there arose a nine-tiered terrace situated above the Jade Capital, resplendent amidst the Empty Mystery. The Flying Heavenly Divine People constantly scatter the incense of a hundred harmonies and the flowers of the five clouds to observe the Flying Heavenly Perfected. Upon the terrace stands the Grand Perfected Jade Youth, who thrice daily holds the banner of ten absolutes, circling once to summon the Heavenly Emperors of all heavens to thrice encircle the Mystic Terrace. Learners who constantly recite the cavernous chapters will have their flying lives open the path of deathlessness, where the *qi* of eternal life flows downward to refine the five souls, and the Eight Sceneries are preserved. *Soars Freely*: The Forest of Soaring. Learners who ascend the Mystic Terrace and wander the Forest of Soaring, their bodies adorned with Heavenly script and their mouths chanting the cavernous chapters, will eventually ascend to the Palace of the Empty Capital.

chunks.original_text: 那育郁馥，摩罗法轮。 八字，端靖天内音。 那者，天中侍郎之名。 主天四时之炁，梵行虚无之纲，以正端靖天中分度。 育者，天关空轮之名。 郁馥者，斗中灵童名。 常运育轮以召天真，天关十转，则十方大圣上朝玉京，万神齐到，而郁馥唱礼。 摩罗者，天中大魔内讳。 郁馥一唱，魔王束形。 学士知四时之炁，十转之关，则八法轮之门，驾舆升乎玉清，上朝紫微之台也。 霐持无镜，揽姿运容。 八字，恭庆天内音。 霐者，天上都监神内名。 持者，龙渊之名。 众龙蟠其中，运东井之华，以灌天真，即月中黄华之精，沃注东井之流也。 无镜者，飞天神王也。 出无色之光，总生死之籍，开度学人。 观复曰：申时至於庚时，名曰水半斤，阴归阳室，末来投铅，其质已消而成，白银是也。 揽姿者，三界门名也。 人知此号，则魔王为开长夜之府，技九幽之魂，以度三界门也。 运容者，玄和玉女名。 人得度三界之门，运容则以朱陵之炁导之於形，太和之津灌之於神，上升福堂。 馥朗廓奕，神缨自宫。 八字，极瑶天内音。 馥朗者，天中玉京玄台别号。 西灵真人常诵洞章，以游其上。 廓奕者，天中神公内名。 与元始同生，为玄炁之范，教学仙之人。 能明八字之音，则神公为开长夜之户，入更生之门，而登玉京之台也。 神缨者，紫微灵童也。 主灭度之尸，若得神缨歌无量之章，则返形於三炼之房，受自然之炁，乐无穷之遐龄也。 西方八天 刀利禅猷，婆泥咎　音皋　通。 八字，孔升天内音。 刀利者，南方无极世界之号鱼禅是刀利国，亦曰禅黎。 其国有洞阳之宫，流火之庭。 灵文始於流火，受炼，既明之后，刀利国改为福德之堂。 猷者，南上好生君内名。 婆泥者，火炼池灵童名。 若人得度洞阳宫，皆诣火池受炼，更生福德之堂。 咎通者，刀利世界魔王之神，常遏人生路。 人知好生君名，及诣灵童受炼，即更生福德之乡，则魔王之神奉焉。 人能诵八字之音，则刀利世界元极灵官侍卫其身，径造南宫，仙人伺迎，三年必能策丹霞之轮，升三炁之天。 宛薮涤色，大渺之堂。 八字，皇崖天内音。

Amidst lush fragrance, the Dharma-wheel of Mara turns. The eight characters: *Duanjing*, the celestial sound within Heaven. *Na* is the name of the Attendant Gentleman of Heaven’s Center, who governs the *qi* of Heaven’s four seasons and the guiding principle of emptiness in Brahmanic conduct, thereby rectifying and stabilizing the divisions within Heaven. *Yu* is the name of the Heavenly Pass’s Hollow Wheel. *Yufu* is the name of the numinous youth within the Dipper, who constantly revolves the *Yu*-wheel to summon the Heavenly Perfected. When the Heavenly Pass turns ten times, the great sages of the ten directions ascend to pay court at the Jade Capital, and the myriad spirits assemble in unison as *Yufu* intones the rites. *Moluo* is the inner taboo-name of the Great Demon of Heaven’s Center. At *Yufu*’s first chant, the demon kings bind their forms. Learners who comprehend the *qi* of the four seasons and the ten revolutions of the Pass will, through the gate of the Eight Dharma-wheels, mount their chariots to ascend to Jade Purity and pay court at the Terrace of the Purple Tenuity.

*Haochi* holds the Mirrorless, gathering grace and moving countenance. The eight characters: *Gongqing*, the celestial sound within Heaven. *Hao* is the inner name of the Celestial Inspector-General. *Chi* is the name of the Dragon Abyss, wherein the host of dragons coils, circulating the blossoms of the Eastern Well to bathe the Heavenly Perfected—this is the essence of the Yellow Blossom of the Moon, pouring its flow into the Eastern Well. *Wujing* is the Flying Heavenly Divine King, who emits light of no-color, oversees the registers of life and death, and initiates learners. *Guān Fù* says: From the hour of *shen* to the hour of *geng* is called "half a catty of water," when yin returns to the yang chamber, and the future casts its lead; its substance dissolves and becomes silver. *Lanzi* is the name of the Three Realms’ Gate. Those who know this name will have the demon kings open the palace of the Long Night, releasing the souls of the Nine Darks to pass through the Three Realms’ Gate. *Yunrong* is the name of the Jade Maiden of Mystic Harmony. Those who pass through the Three Realms’ Gate will have *Yunrong* guide their forms with the *qi* of Vermilion Mound and bathe their spirits with the fluid of Great Harmony, ascending to the Hall of Blessings.

Fragrance luminous and vast, the divine tassel self-purifies. The eight characters: *Jiyao*, the celestial sound within Heaven. *Fulang* is another name for the Terrace of the Jade Capital within Heaven’s Center, where the Western Numinous Perfected constantly recites the cavernous chapters to wander above it. *Kuoyi* is the inner name of the Heavenly Divine Duke, born together with the Primordial Beginning as the model of Mystic *Qi*, teaching those who study immortality. Those who master the sound of the eight characters will have the Divine Duke open the door of the Long Night and enter the gate of rebirth, thereby ascending the Terrace of the Jade Capital. *Shenying* is the Numinous Youth of the Purple Tenuity, who governs the corpses of the deceased. If one sings the boundless chapters of the Divine Tassel, one will return one’s form to the chamber of the Three Refinements, receive the *qi* of spontaneity, and enjoy limitless distant years.

The Eight Heavens of the West: *Daoli Chanyou, Poni Gao Tong*. The eight characters: *Kongsheng*, the celestial sound within Heaven. *Daoli* is the name of the Boundless World of the South, where the kingdom of Chan is *Daoli*, also called Chanli. Within that land stands the Palace of Cavernous Yang and the Courtyard of Flowing Fire. The numinous scripture begins in the Flowing Fire; after refinement and enlightenment, the kingdom of *Daoli* is transformed into the Hall of Blessings and Virtue. *You* is the inner name of the Lord of Compassion in the Upper South. *Poni* is the name of the numinous youth of the Fire-Refinement Pool. Those who pass through the Palace of Cavernous Yang all proceed to the Fire Pool for refinement, reborn in the Hall of Blessings and Virtue. *Gaotong* is the spirit of the demon kings of the *Daoli* world, who constantly obstruct the path of life. Those who know the name of the Lord of Compassion and proceed to the Numinous Youth for refinement will be reborn in the land of Blessings and Virtue, where the demon kings’ spirits submit. Those who recite the sound of the eight characters will have the primordial and ultimate numinous officials of the *Daoli* world guard their bodies, swiftly arriving at the Southern Palace, where immortals await to welcome them. Within three years, they will surely ride the cinnabar clouds’ wheel to ascend to the Heaven of the Three *Qi*.

*Wansou Dise*, the Hall of the Great Vast. The eight characters: *Huangya*, the celestial sound within Heaven.

chunks.original_text: 宛薮者，皇崖天帝内名。 主开太漠之经，以明八字之文。 涤色者，色界飞天真人名也。 常乘车驾龙，出入玉清之中，开度善根之人。 大渺之堂者，即化生之堂，空洞之化，结自然之章，坦然广大，开度万生之历也。 学人通八字之音，则飞天真人降云车，载兆身，上升化生之堂也。 流罗梵萌，景蔚萧嵎。 八字，极风天内音。 流者，天王内名。 罗者，月女之讳。 主游宴之仪，流辉极风之天，洞照九玄之真也。 梵者，飞天真人名，主回九天之关。 萌者，元始天神名，正梵炁，开度天人、保固极风之根。 观复曰：艮者，土也； 生成之本，造化之根是也。 景者，景皇也。 是四极上真人也。 蔚者，蔚秀景霄仙人也。 并理玉京台，历校长夜之中，开度善根之魂。 萧者，仞也。 白素元君之宫。 嵎者，萧仞之嵎，对宾之所也。 人能常诵洞章，乃得驾九色之云，上升景黄之台也。 易邈无寂，宛首少都。 八字，孝芒天内音。 易邈者，孝芒天王之号。 无寂者，虚无寂寂之庭也。 言此天王从龙汉而来，至赤明而出，居乎虚无之内寂寂之庭也。 宛首者，太上道君内号。 道君常以元始玄奥，演大法以度人。 少都者，日中灵童君之名，常散日精以灌身流，飞华以拂尘。 学人知八字之音，天王飞景云之舆，降三素之軿，度身三界之上，而进入寂寂之庭也。 阿褴郁竺，华漠延由。 八字，翁重天内音。 阿褴者，天王隐名。 常乘景霄之轮，游九层之台，处玉楼之上，唱洞章以伏众魔。 郁者，郁默天中魔王隐名。 竺者，欲界也。 魔王郁伯常在欲界之上，诵咏空谣之章。 华者，色界光华。 漠者，欲界渺漠，不可寻也。 延是束鬼之庭，由是禁鬼之房。 天王登云楼之上，咏无量之章，则天魔应响而束身，群鬼遇由而伏形，奉之者九祖开泰，修之者灰骸更生。 九开自辩，阿那品首。 八字，江由天内音。 九开者，大演之初，天地未判，轮转三炁，开为九分。 九度既明，九位乃列。 阴阳万品於是而生，自然明辩也。 阿者，阿丘天王内名，常乘龙軿登龙山之岭，游观九玄之中。 那者，那邪飞天神人隐名，飞行三界，历校长夜，拔度善人之魂。 有知八字之音，则天王品度兆身，入飞天之众首，化朽骨成童子之颜矣。 无量扶盖，浮罗合神。 八字，阮乐天内音。 无量者，天中无量大神之始神也。 总统飞天之神，人皆受其品量而得升迁也。 扶者，更生真人内名，常校幽夜之录，简善恶之根。 盖，玄中福堂之号。 浮者，幽夜之魂，受真人开度，谓之浮。 罗者，大罗也。 开大千世界，召更生之宾，上诣大罗天，定籍削死。 合者，合庆也。 神者，神公也，乃大罗之相。 人能知八字之音，与神公合庆，受度为更生之宾。 玉诞长桑，栢空度仙。 八字，昙誓天内音。 玉诞者，昙誓天中玉都之名。 长桑者，天中骞林，亦名桑林。 骞林覆荫东华之宫，叶上有大洞之章，紫书玉字，焕乎上清，神风一鼓，洞章成音。 故曰柏空。 度仙者，飞天神人也。 简学仙之人生死录籍，开度九幽之魂，升入法轮之门也。 北方八天 玃无自育，九日导乾。

The *Wansou* is the inner name of the Emperor of the *Huangya* Heaven. He presides over the *Scripture of the Great Wilderness*, illuminating the text of the eight characters. *Dise* is the name of a *Feitian* Perfected of the Form Realm, who constantly rides a chariot drawn by dragons, moving in and out of the Jade Purity, delivering those of good root. The *Hall of the Great Vast* is the Hall of Transformation and Birth, where the transformation of the empty and cavernous coalesces into natural chapters, vast and boundless, opening the passage for the deliverance of all beings. When practitioners master the sound of the eight characters, the *Feitian* Perfected descends in a cloud chariot to bear their bodies upward into the Hall of Transformation and Birth.

*Liuluo Fanmeng*, *Jingwei Xiaoyu*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Ji Feng* Heaven. *Liu* is the inner name of a Heavenly King. *Luo* is the taboo name of the Moon Maiden, who presides over the rites of feasting and revelry, streaming radiance through the *Ji Feng* Heaven and illuminating the true essence of the Nine Mysteries. *Fan* is the name of a *Feitian* Perfected, who governs the turning of the Nine Heavens’ gates. *Meng* is the name of the Primordial Heavenly Deity, who rectifies the *fan qi*, delivers celestial and human beings, and secures the root of the *Ji Feng*. *Guanfu* says: *Gen* is earth, the foundation of generation and completion, the root of creation and transformation. *Jing* is the *Jing Huang*, a Perfected of the Four Poles. *Wei* is *Wei Xiu*, a transcendent of the *Jingxiao* Heaven, who together govern the *Jade Capital Terrace*, reviewing and delivering the souls of good root in the long night. *Xiao* is *Ren*, the palace of the *White Primordial Sovereign*. *Yu* is the *Xiao Ren*’s *Yu*, the place of receiving guests. Those who constantly recite the cavernous chapters will ride the nine-colored clouds to ascend the *Jing Huang*’s terrace.

*Yi Miao Wu Ji*, *Wanshou Shaodu*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Xiao Mang* Heaven. *Yi Miao* is the title of the Heavenly King of *Xiao Mang*. *Wu Ji* is the courtyard of emptiness and stillness, for this Heavenly King has come from the *Dragon Han* and emerged in the *Red Brightness*, dwelling in the still courtyard within emptiness. *Wanshou* is the inner title of the *Supreme Dao Lord*, who constantly expounds the profound mysteries of the Primordial Beginning to deliver beings. *Shaodu* is the name of the *Numinous Youth of the Sun’s Center*, who scatters solar essence to irrigate the body’s streams and scatters flying blossoms to brush away dust. When practitioners know the sound of the eight characters, the Heavenly King descends in a chariot of radiant clouds, bearing them above the Three Realms into the still courtyard.

*A Lan Yu Zhu*, *Hua Mo Yan You*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Weng Chong* Heaven. *A Lan* is the hidden name of a Heavenly King, who constantly rides the wheel of radiant clouds, roaming the nine-tiered terrace, dwelling in the jade tower, chanting cavernous chapters to subdue the demon hosts. *Yu* is the hidden name of a demon king in the *Yu Mo* Heaven. *Zhu* is the Desire Realm, where the demon king *Yu Bo* constantly dwells above, chanting and intoning the empty ballads. *Hua* is the radiant splendor of the Form Realm. *Mo* is the vast and boundless Desire Realm, unsearchable. *Yan* is the courtyard that binds ghosts, and *You* is the chamber that restrains them. When the Heavenly King ascends the cloud tower and intones the boundless chapters, the heavenly demons respond and bind themselves, while the myriad ghosts encounter *You* and submit their forms. Those who submit to him will see their nine ancestors flourish, and those who cultivate this will see their ashen bones reborn.

*Jiu Kai Zi Bian*, *A Na Pin Shou*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Jiang You* Heaven. *Jiu Kai* refers to the great unfolding at the beginning, when heaven and earth were not yet divided, and the revolving Three *Qi* opened into nine parts. Once the nine degrees were clarified, the nine positions were arrayed, and the ten thousand kinds of yin and yang were born, naturally discerning and distinguishing. *A* is the inner name of the *A Qiu* Heavenly King, who constantly rides a dragon chariot to ascend the ridge of Dragon Mountain, roaming and observing within the Nine Mysteries. *Na* is the hidden name of the *Na Xie* *Feitian* divine person, who flies through the Three Realms, reviewing the long night and delivering the souls of the good. Those who know the sound of the eight characters will have the Heavenly King assess and deliver their bodies, entering the foremost ranks of the flying transcendent hosts, transforming their decayed bones into the countenance of youths.

*Wu Liang Fu Gai*, *Fu Luo He Shen*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Ruan Le* Heaven. *Wu Liang* is the first divine being among the boundless great deities of heaven, who governs all the flying transcendent deities, for all receive their assessment from him and thereby ascend and advance. *Fu* is the inner name of the *Gengsheng* Perfected, who constantly reviews the records of the dark night and examines the roots of good and evil. *Gai* is the title of the *Xuan Zhong* Hall of Blessings. *Fu* refers to the souls of the dark night, who receive deliverance from the Perfected and are thus called *floating*. *Luo* is the *Great Luo*, who opens the great thousand worlds, summoning the guests of rebirth to ascend to the *Great Luo* Heaven and determine their registers, erasing death. *He* is *He Qing* (Joined Celebration). *Shen* is the *Divine Duke*, the minister of the *Great Luo*. Those who know the sound of the eight characters will join in celebration with the Divine Duke and receive deliverance as guests of rebirth.

*Yu Dan Chang Sang*, *Bai Kong Du Xian*. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Tan Shi* Heaven. *Yu Dan* is the name of the *Jade Capital* in the *Tan Shi* Heaven. *Chang Sang* is the *Qian Lin* (Soaring Grove) in heaven, also called the *Sang Lin* (Mulberry Grove). The *Qian Lin* shades the *Eastern Florescence* Palace, and upon its leaves are the great cavernous chapters, written in purple jade script, resplendent in the *Upper Clarity*. When the divine wind stirs, the cavernous chapters resound—hence *Bai Kong* (Cypress Void). *Du Xian* refers to the flying transcendent divine persons who review the registers of life and death for those who study immortality, delivering the souls of the Nine Darks and ascending them into the gate of the *Dharma Wheel*.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
*Jue Wu Zi Yu*, *Jiu Ri Dao Qian*.

chunks.original_text: 八字，霄度天内音。 玃无者，龙汉之时，飞天之神。 元始始开之炁，溟涬无色之中，玃无乘运而出，凝炁而立。 九霄既立，自抗不终之劫。 育者，霄度天王内名。 九者，育王乘象轮之车，游九玄之门，转九机之度，应劫会之期。 日者，天中日童导引和炁，天运之终，日童停光，拔度学者，灌以水母之精，导以太和之炁，洗炼五神，进入朱宫。 观复曰：乾者，万物之始，虚无自然，纯精真一之炁，名曰空炁金胎。 喻为银矿，藏於肾中，谓之元神。 因一炁化归中宫，而为丹母，金公推运。 金者，先天自然之炁，金胎也。 火者，日用发生之阳炁也。 返本还元，是为银也。 坤母东覆，形摄上玄。 八字，元洞天内音。 坤母者，太阴之都候，九灵仙母也。 理东海扶桑，旸谷之渊，常总地机，轮转元炁，上应天关。 天关转，地机动，周天一度，水则涌溢三千三百度。 则天地炁交，九海溟蒙，一水则弥天。 东者，东海受会，制其河源也。 覆者，水神也。 理於昆仑山，填固巨海，遏断东井，则地机不沦，保劫长存。 观复曰：坤者，万物之成，受胎之后，神藏肾中，是曰坤宫。 即性即铅，运归中宫。 化机乃日用发生之阳炁，以为丹基。 药祖收摄砂汞而为丹质。 夫造化者，从无生有，故坤因乾而立，乾因坤而成，乾坤互相生成，初无先后。 譬如铅因银而生，银因铅而成也。 形摄者，是定交之时，坤母形出东海之上，摄召鸟母，以凤车迎学仙之人，上昆仑之墟。 鸟母，乃水候之神。 上者，坤母上诣帝君，申劫会之期，度学仙之人，言名於玄都也。 观复曰：一阳来复，妙化之炁，自坤宫而发生。 真阳上升，如日之象，至於中宫，金母收摄，是为砂也。 砂者，木也； 木者，龙也。 此青龙受符也。 陀罗育邈，眇炁合云。 八字，妙成天内音。 陀者，天帝内名。 与妙成天俱在云阿之岭。 罗者，月始生之名，阿在云岭之上，抱月而明。 育者，妙成天神王名。 又：育者，生也。 总召十方飞天之神。 邈者，天中羽林监神名，神王常使匡御三界，简人间生死之籍，令魔王保举得道之人。 眇者，眇眇，高远也。 人得保度，诣羽林监，受符升天，眇眇行於云宫。 炁者，云炁也。 合者，合景也。 既入羽林，结云炁以成衣，上升朱宫，遂与诸天合景而上飞也。 飞天大丑，总监上天。 八字，禁上天内音。 飞天者，十方飞天神王也。 天中飞玄之炁，结成空洞之经，飞天神王常诵之，以接学人。 大丑者，三界之都录，主生死图籍。 丑者，伯也。 三界大魔，受事於大丑。 学士能知此音，则魔王保真而身腾三清矣。 总者，飞天都统之官，主摄八会之炁，以促天地之运； 主领长夜之官，开度九幽之魂。 人知天中之音，则魔王列言，大丑，勒录仙都，而上升禁上天也。 沙陀劫量，龙汉瑛鲜。 八字，常融天内音。 沙者，天中沙兰之宫。 乃紫微之别馆。 陀者，陀丘山也。 陀丘之众，有巨亿万人，并是新得道受度之人。 功德未备，停散其中。 劫量者，至劫运一交，此陀丘之众，计功量德，升朱陆受福而仙也。 龙汉者，初劫之名。 瑛者，初劫飞天神王名也。 常开度幽魂，升沙兰宫中。 鲜者，南宫之童。 学人得度，仙童引炼於朱陵之上矣。 碧落浮黎，空歌保珍。

The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Xiao Du* Heaven. *Jue Wu* refers to the divine beings of the *Dragon Han* era, the flying transcendent gods. From the primordial qi of the *Original Beginning*’s initial unfolding, within the boundless, formless *Ming Xing*, *Jue Wu* emerged borne by the currents, coalescing qi to take form. Once the Nine Heavens of *Xiao* were established, they withstood the unending kalpas. *Yu* is the inner name of the Heavenly King of *Xiao Du*. The *Nine* signifies that the *Yu* King rides a chariot drawn by elephant wheels, traversing the Nine Mysteries’ gates, revolving the Nine Mechanisms’ measures, aligning with the kalpa’s appointed time. The *Sun* refers to the solar youths within heaven who guide and harmonize qi; when the celestial revolution ends, the solar youths halt their radiance, delivering and refining the scholars, anointing them with the essence of the *Water Mother*, guiding them with the qi of *Great Harmony*, purifying the Five Spirits, and ushering them into the *Vermilion Palace*.

*Guan Fu* says: *Qian* is the beginning of the myriad things, the spontaneous void, the pure and true unified qi, called the *Empty Qi Golden Womb*. It is likened to silver ore, concealed within the kidneys, termed the *Original Spirit*. As this qi transforms and returns to the *Central Palace*, it becomes the *Elixir Mother*, propelled by the *Metal Duke*. *Metal* is the qi of the primordial, spontaneous *Way*, the *Golden Womb*. *Fire* is the yang qi of daily arising and flourishing. Returning to the root and restoring the origin is called *silver*. The *Kun Mother* covers the east, her form gathering the *Upper Mystery*.

The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Yuan Dong* Heaven. The *Kun Mother* is the governor of the *Grand Yin*’s capital, the *Nine Numinous Immortal Mother*. She oversees the *Eastern Sea*’s *Fu Sang* and the *Yang Valley*’s abyss, perpetually managing the earth’s mechanisms, revolving the primordial qi, ascending to respond to the *Celestial Pass*. When the *Celestial Pass* turns, the earth’s mechanisms move, and once the heavens complete a revolution, the waters surge and overflow three thousand three hundred times. Thus, the qi of heaven and earth intermingle, the nine seas become misty and vast, and a single water pervades the heavens. The *East* is where the *Eastern Sea* receives convergence, controlling the river’s source. The *Covering* refers to the water spirit who governs *Kunlun Mountain*, reinforcing the great seas, damming the *Eastern Well*, ensuring the earth’s mechanisms do not sink, and preserving the kalpa’s enduring existence.

*Guan Fu* says: *Kun* is the completion of the myriad things. After conception, the spirit is concealed within the kidneys, called the *Kun Palace*. It is both nature and lead, returning to the *Central Palace* in motion. The transforming mechanism is the daily arising yang qi, serving as the foundation of the elixir. The *Medicinal Ancestor* gathers cinnabar and mercury to form the elixir’s substance. As for creation, it arises from nothing into being; thus, *Kun* is established through *Qian*, and *Qian* is completed through *Kun*. *Qian* and *Kun* mutually engender and perfect one another, with no precedence of before or after. It is like lead arising from silver, and silver being perfected through lead. The *Form Gathering* occurs at the time of fixed union, when the *Kun Mother*’s form emerges above the *Eastern Sea*, summoning the *Bird Mother* and welcoming the immortality-seeking scholars with phoenix chariots to the wilds of *Kunlun*. The *Bird Mother* is the spirit overseeing the water’s conditions. The *Upper* refers to the *Kun Mother* ascending to the *Celestial Lord*, reporting the kalpa’s appointed time, delivering the immortality-seeking scholars, and inscribing their names in the *Mysterious Capital*.

*Guan Fu* says: When the first yang returns, the wondrous transforming qi arises from the *Kun Palace*. The true yang ascends like the sun’s image, reaching the *Central Palace*, where the *Metal Mother* gathers it—this is called *cinnabar*. *Cinnabar* is wood; wood is the dragon. This is the *Azure Dragon* receiving the talisman.

*Tuo Luo Yu Miao*, the ethereal qi merges with the clouds. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Miao Cheng* Heaven. *Tuo* is the inner name of the *Celestial Emperor*, who resides with the *Miao Cheng* Heaven on the *Cloud Al* Ridge. *Luo* is the name of the moon at its first crescent, embracing the moon to shine upon the *Cloud Ridge*. *Yu* is the name of the divine king of the *Miao Cheng* Heaven. Also, *Yu* means *birth*, summoning the flying transcendent gods of the ten directions. *Miao* is the name of the *Feathered Forest* overseer in heaven, a divine king who perpetually assists in governing the Three Realms, reviewing the registers of human life and death, commanding demon kings to protect and recommend those who attain the Dao. *Shao* means *distant and lofty*. Those who are delivered and protected ascend to the *Feathered Forest* overseer, receive talismans, and ascend to heaven, traversing the cloud palaces in lofty flight. *Qi* is the cloud qi. *He* means *merging with the radiance*. Having entered the *Feathered Forest*, they weave cloud qi into garments, ascend to the *Vermilion Palace*, and then merge with the radiance of all heavens to soar upward.

The *Flying Transcendents’ Great Ugly One* oversees the heavens above. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Jin Shang* Heaven. The *Flying Transcendents* are the divine kings of the flying transcendents in the ten directions. The flying and mysterious qi within heaven coalesce into the *Empty Cavern Scriptures*, which the flying transcendent divine kings perpetually recite to receive the scholars. The *Great Ugly One* is the registrar of the Three Realms, overseeing the charts of life and death. *Ugly* means *elder*. The great demons of the Three Realms serve the *Great Ugly One*. If scholars know this sound, demon kings will protect their authenticity, and their bodies will ascend to the *Three Clarities*. The *General* is the official who oversees the flying transcendents, governing the qi of the eight assemblies to hasten the heavens’ and earth’s revolutions, and presiding over the officials of the long night to deliver the souls of the *Nine Darks*. Those who know the sounds within heaven will have demon kings submit their names, and the *Great Ugly One* will inscribe them in the *Immortal Capital*, ascending to the *Jin Shang* Heaven.

*Sha Tuo Jie Liang*, the *Dragon Han*’s radiant freshness. The eight characters are the inner sound of the *Chang Rong* Heaven. *Sha* is the *Sha Lan Palace* within heaven, a detached palace of the *Purple Tenuity*. *Tuo* is *Tuo Qiu Mountain*. The multitudes of *Tuo Qiu*, numbering in the hundreds of millions, are all newly delivered and refined individuals whose merits are not yet complete, lingering and dispersing therein. *Jie Liang* refers to when the kalpa’s revolution converges; the multitudes of *Tuo Qiu* calculate their merits and measure their virtues, ascending to *Zhu Lu* to receive blessings and immortality. *Dragon Han* is the name of the initial kalpa. *Ying* is the name of the flying transcendent divine king of the initial kalpa, who perpetually delivers the souls of the dark realms, ascending them to the *Sha Lan Palace*. *Xian* is the youth of the *Southern Palace*. When scholars attain deliverance, the immortal youths guide and refine them upon the *Vermilion Mound*.

*Bi Luo Fu Li*, the empty songs preserve the treasures.

chunks.original_text: 八字，玉隆天内音。 碧者，玉隆天中常生碧霞之炁。 落者，飞天神名。 一日三时，引天中众圣，上朝七宝官。 浮黎者，天王内名，众圣上朝则天王称庆。 空者，天中侍宸名。 歌者，洞章之曲，侍宸一啸，灵风协奏，音成洞章，故曰空歌也。 保珍者，学人知此八字之音，则升南宫，为飞天之宾，保此不终之劫，珍其自然之文，故曰保珍也。 恶奕无品，洞妙自真。 八字，梵度天内音。 恶奕者，天王内名也。 当龙汉之中，诸缘并尽，过度三界，升太虚之馆，受九仙之箓，登大圣之号。 至赤明开运，元始锡为梵度天王。 无者，太无真人也。 受天王之符，度长夜之魂。 品者，品量幽魂之罪福。 洞者； 洞明宿对。 妙者，妙化之堂，恶缘并尽，宿对既解，升入妙化之堂。 自者，与也。 真者，天真也。 至是与诸天合真也。 元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 八字，贾奕天内音。 元梵者，元始大梵之炁，高而洞浮，悬而不落。 恢漠者，浩而无穷，远而无碍，有而若无。 幽者，幽寥也。 寂者，空寂也。 杳冥恍惚，不可闻见。 其中有真，真中有精，是以普度天人也。 默庵曰：《灵书》义极玄奥，本难寻详。 然每方各六十四字，总六十四句，其自然之数，正与大易八八六十四卦之义合。 乾坤为易之祖，故独出乾坤二字，见天地万物万事之变，举不能逃乎《易》，则天地鬼神造化之迹，亦不外乎《灵书》。 盖可以类推矣。 况河出图，义皇画而成易，云篆太虚，而出玉字，天真皇人书而成文，其神道设教之妙，本有不约而同者。 愚按天真皇人曰：诸天内音、自然玉字者，皆结飞玄之炁，合五方之音，其文宛奥，难可寻详。 则灵书玉字出自大梵之炁，结空而成文，皇人按笔，演而成章，是为天地之根，万汇之本。 其与太易阴阳动静之机默合，盖万有之理，莫不具夫河图生成之数也。 故内修之，以炼己； 外施之，以度人； 道同乎一本而已矣。 道言：此诸天中大梵隐语，无量之音，旧文字皆广长一丈。 天真皇人昔书其文，以为正音。 有知其音。 能斋而诵之者，诸天皆遣飞天神王，下观其身，书其功勤，上奏诸天。 万神朝礼，地只侍门，大勋魔王，保举上仙，道备克得游行三界，升入金门。 默庵曰：旧文，玉字初出时文。 今所传天篆是也。 此乃道君末序灵书之妙也。 大梵者，诸天自然妙炁结而成文也。 隐语者，天帝之隐讳隐名也。 无量之音者，空洞自然之音、响彻诸天，功资无量也。 旧文者，当元始说经之初，皇人按笔之始，皆诸天梵炁结而成文。 故字皆广长一丈，玉字金书，八角垂芒，即后所传之天篆也。 是曰：旧文。 昔书其文以为正音，今之所传，皆后世译出而成篇章，即昔之正音也。 有知音而斋诵者，其感诸天遣神王下观书，其功勤上奏，然后万神敬礼，地只侍卫，虽魔王之重，亦保举上证仙品矣。 道备者，侍其功圆行满，克得游行三界之上，升入金门，臣事三境，日侍帝侧矣。 观复曰：其中虚实相通，象数可见。 以九日导乾推之，理无遗矣。 夫乾始於北者，即阳生於子也。 甲配乾，子为黄锺，故甲子始於冬至。 还丹者，循环大梵而修耳。 四象五行、三元八卦、日月龙虎、砂汞铅银，隐语之中俱备。 至於阴符阳火、温养抽添，非依卦爻升降，甲子循环，何以取则？

The Eight Characters are the inner sounds of *Yu Long Heaven*. *Bi* refers to the ever-arising azure *qi* within *Yu Long Heaven*. *Luo* is the name of a flying transcendent deity who, thrice daily, leads the host of celestial sages to ascend and pay homage at the *Seven Treasures Palace*. *Fu Li* is the inner name of the Heavenly King; when the host of sages ascends to pay homage, the Heavenly King proclaims jubilation. *Kong* is the name of the celestial chamberlain. *Ge* refers to the cavernous hymns; when the chamberlain utters a single cry, numinous winds harmonize, and the sound forms the cavernous hymns—hence called *Kong Ge*. *Bao Zhen* means that if scholars comprehend the sound of these Eight Characters, they ascend to the *Southern Palace* as guests of the flying transcendents, preserving themselves through the unending kalpas and treasuring the natural script—thus called *Bao Zhen*.

*E Yi* is without rank; cavernous subtlety is self-authentic. The Eight Characters are the inner sounds of *Fan Du Heaven*. *E Yi* is the inner name of the Heavenly King. During the *Dragon Han* kalpa, when all karmic conditions are exhausted, one transcends the Three Realms, ascends to the *Palace of Great Emptiness*, receives the register of the Nine Immortals, and attains the title of Great Sage. By the *Red Clarity* kalpa’s inception, the Primordial Beginning bestows the title of *Fan Du Heavenly King*. *Wu* is the *Great Void Perfected*; receiving the Heavenly King’s talisman, they deliver the souls of the long night. *Pin* refers to assessing the sins and blessings of the dark souls. *Dong* is the *Cavernous Clarity of Past Connections*. *Miao* is the *Hall of Wondrous Transformation*; when evil karma is exhausted and past connections are resolved, one ascends into the *Hall of Wondrous Transformation*. *Zi* means "with." *Zhen* is *Heavenly Perfection*; thus, one unites with all heavens in perfection.

*Yuan Fan* is vast and boundless, silently delivering beings in the dark and still. The Eight Characters are the inner sounds of *Jia Yi Heaven*. *Yuan Fan* is the *qi* of the Primordial Beginning’s Great Brahma—lofty and cavernously floating, suspended yet unfallen. *Hui Mo* is vast and limitless, distant yet unobstructed, existent yet as if nonexistent. *You* is the dark and desolate. *Ji* is the empty and silent—profound, indistinct, and imperceptible. Within it lies the Real; within the Real lies the Essence—thus universally delivering celestial and human beings.

*Mo An* says: The meaning of the *Divine Book* is profoundly abstruse and difficult to fathom. Yet each direction comprises sixty-four characters, totaling sixty-four phrases, whose natural numerology precisely aligns with the sixty-four hexagrams of the *Great Change*. *Qian* and *Kun* are the progenitors of the *Change*; thus, only *Qian* and *Kun* are singled out, revealing that the myriad transformations of heaven, earth, the myriad things, and the myriad affairs cannot escape the *Change*. The traces of heaven, earth, ghosts, spirits, and creation likewise do not transcend the *Divine Book*—hence, one may infer by analogy. Moreover, the *River Chart* emerged, and Fuxi drew it to form the *Change*; the cloud-script of the Great Void gave rise to the jade characters, which the Heavenly Perfected inscribed to compose the text. The marvel of the divine way’s teachings inherently shares an unspoken resonance.

This humble one observes: The Heavenly Perfected said, "The inner sounds of the heavens and the natural jade characters are all congealed from the *qi* of flying mystery, harmonizing the sounds of the five directions. Their script is profound and abstruse, difficult to fathom." Thus, the jade characters of the *Divine Book* emerge from the *qi* of the Great Brahma, congealing in emptiness to form script. The Perfected wielded the brush to unfold them into chapters—this is the root of heaven and earth, the origin of the myriad existences. Its silent concordance with the *Great Change*’s mechanism of yin-yang movement and stillness lies in the principle that the myriad existences are all endowed with the *River Chart*’s numbers of generation and completion. Therefore, one cultivates it internally to refine the self and applies it externally to deliver others—ultimately, the Dao is one with the singular root.

The Dao states: These are the great Brahma’s esoteric utterances within the heavens, the boundless sounds. The ancient script was all a *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected of old inscribed the script to establish the correct sounds. Those who know these sounds and purify themselves to recite them will have the flying transcendent divine kings of all heavens descend to observe their bodies, record their merits, and report them above to the heavens. The myriad spirits pay homage, the earth spirits stand guard at the gates, and even the mighty demon kings will safeguard and recommend them for ascension to immortal ranks. When their Dao is complete and their merits fulfilled, they may roam the Three Realms, ascend through the *Golden Gate*, and serve the Three Realms, daily attending the Emperor’s side.

*Mo An* says: The ancient script refers to the original form of the jade characters when they first emerged—what is now transmitted as celestial seal-script. This is the concluding discourse of the *Dao Lord* on the marvels of the *Divine Book*. *Great Brahma* refers to the natural wondrous *qi* of the heavens congealing to form script. *Esoteric utterances* are the hidden names and taboos of the Heavenly Emperor. *Boundless sounds* are the cavernous natural sounds that resonate through all heavens, endowing boundless merit. *Ancient script* refers to when the Primordial Beginning first expounded the scriptures and the Perfected first wielded the brush—all were celestial Brahma *qi* congealing to form script. Thus, the characters were all a *zhang* in length, inscribed in jade and gold, with eight corners radiating light—later transmitted as celestial seal-script, hence called *ancient script*. The Perfected of old inscribed the script to establish the correct sounds; what is now transmitted are the later translations compiled into chapters—these are the ancient correct sounds. Those who know the sounds and purify themselves to recite them will evoke the heavens to dispatch divine kings to descend, observe, and record their merits, reporting them above. Then, the myriad spirits will pay reverent homage, the earth spirits will stand guard, and even the mighty demon kings will safeguard and recommend them for ascension to immortal ranks. *Dao complete* means that when their merits are perfected and their conduct fulfilled, they may roam above the Three Realms, ascend through the *Golden Gate*, and serve the Three Realms, daily attending the Emperor’s side.

*Guan Fu* says: Within it, the empty and the solid interpenetrate, and the images and numbers are visible. Applying the nine days to guide *Qian*’s reckoning, no principle is left unaddressed. *Qian* begins in the north, just as yang arises at *zi*. *Jia* corresponds to *Qian*, and *zi* is the *Yellow Bell*—thus, *jia-zi* begins at the winter solstice. The *Returning Elixir* is but the cultivation of the great Brahma’s cyclic refinement. The Four Symbols, Five Phases, Three Origins, Eight Trigrams, sun and moon, dragon and tiger, cinnabar and mercury, lead and silver—all are contained within the esoteric utterances. As for the *yin* tally and *yang* fire, the warming and nurturing, the withdrawal and addition—without relying on the hexagrams’ rise and fall, the cyclic progression of *jia-zi*, how could one take them as a model?

chunks.original_text: 故乾坤坎离四卦，象天地日月，包囊万物，为鼎器药物枢纽根宗。 余六十卦以应六十甲子之数。 准则春秋推移，寒暑分二十四炁，譬七十二候，以应一年十二月之节。 归於一月之内，以一月之候，促於一昼夜十二时中，定刻漏、正时晷、明子午、按阴阳、通晦朔、合斤两，依天地之大数，叶阴阳之化机。 故卦有三百八十四爻，火有三百八十四铢，以是万物由虚而生，大梵之理，其实与大易同也。 此其诸师之论默合，而丹易未尝殊途也。 学士能究灵书之微奥，则丹基易道得矣。 此音无所不辟，无所不禳，无所不度，无所不成。 天真自然之音也。 故诵之致飞天下观，上帝遥唱，万神朝礼，三界侍轩。 群妖束首，鬼精自亡。 琳琅振响，十方肃清，河海静默，山岳吞烟。 万灵振伏，招集草仙。 天无氛秽，地无妖尘。 冥慧洞清，大量玄玄也。 默庵曰：此道君申言学士修诵之功用。 此音者，即无量之音也。 诵之能辟逐一切精邪，能消禳一切灾害，能度脱一切生死，能成就一切天人，以其功无所往而不致，故重述曰天真自然之音也。 皆诸天至真口宣自然梵炁之文，非假人世篆画之音，是以其功莫大也。 故诵之乃致飞天下，观书其功。 上帝遥唱，赞其善，万神朝礼，一身之神，三界侍从於轩毂。 至此，则三尸伏匿，六贼退藏，群妖束首，外魔顿息，鬼精自亡，内识顿消。 业识既净，垢秽皆空，惟本来之性，真一长存矣。 琳琅振响者，形神俱仙，天乐自鸣。 十方肃清者，寂无遗响也。 河海静默者，爱河苦海，皆澄静矣。 山岳吞烟者，山岳内固，神凝息定。 万灵振伏者，功圆道备，万灵靡不振伏。 招集群仙者，万神朝元，不召而集。 天无氛秽，地无妖尘者，性寂情冥，太虚同体。 冥慧洞清者，冥者，幽寥无联； 慧者，朗彻无边：洞者，虚明无碍； 清者，澄莹无穷。 观复所谓冥通慧照之力是也。 内功至此，八方洞彻，一性混融，大包宇宙，细入毫芒，此皆至玄至微之妙，其量岂可得以津涯测哉！ 是曰大量玄玄也。 虽天地之大，万有之众，蠢动蛸翘，皆含一灵之妙本，俱自有生於无，莫不兆乎太极、五行、阴阳而后具能知全乎。 太极之一本，而不匿於万殊之异，则返乎无声无臭之初，而复归于无极矣。 天尊说经，自悬一宝珠而始演十回之妙义，其於大梵之秘，丹道之玄，无不备矣。 其末也，犹恐学人堕沉空着有之偏，而卒曰：冥慧洞清，大量玄玄。 则一经之要，黍珠之奥，尽在是矣。 又岂有为法象之可得而至哉。 所谓契虚合无，复归於无极也。 在乎返求诸己，则虚灵不昧，天地皆备於我，而至神至妙之道得矣。 黍珠空悬十回之图 金丹十转四灵之图

Thus, the four hexagrams *Qian*, *Kun*, *Kan*, and *Li* symbolize heaven, earth, sun, and moon, embracing the myriad things as the crucible, vessel, medicine, and pivot of the root and origin. The remaining sixty hexagrams correspond to the sixty *jia-zi* cycles. Following the shifts of spring and autumn, cold and heat divide into twenty-four *qi*, likened to seventy-two seasonal markers, aligning with the twelve months of the year. Distilled into a single month, its seasonal signs are compressed within the twelve hours of day and night—fixing the water clock, rectifying the sundial, clarifying *zi* and *wu*, regulating *yin* and *yang*, harmonizing darkness and dawn, balancing weights and measures—all in accord with heaven and earth’s grand reckoning and the transformative mechanism of *yin* and *yang*. Thus, the hexagrams comprise three hundred eighty-four lines, and fire is measured by three hundred eighty-four *zhu*; through this, the myriad things arise from emptiness, and the principle of the great Brahma is in truth identical to that of the *Great Change*. Herein, the teachings of all masters silently converge, and the elixir and the *Change* have never diverged in their path. If the scholar can fathom the subtle mysteries of the *Numinous Writ*, then the foundation of the elixir and the Dao of the *Change* are attained.

This sound repels all, dispels all, delivers all, and accomplishes all. It is the sound of heaven’s spontaneity. Reciting it summons flight to behold the realms below, the Celestial Thearch’s distant chant, the myriad spirits’ courtly obeisance, and the Three Realms’ attendance at the imperial chariot. Hosts of demons bow their heads, ghostly essences vanish of themselves. Jade chimes resound, the ten directions grow hushed, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists. The ten thousand spirits tremble and submit, summoning the immortals of the grasses. Heaven is free of defilement, earth is free of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the void—vast and profoundly profound.

*Mo’an* says: The Dao Lord here expounds the efficacy of the scholar’s recitation. This sound is the sound of boundlessness. Reciting it can expel all demonic influences, dissolve all calamities, deliver all from birth and death, and perfect all celestial and human beings. Its merit extends everywhere without exception, hence the reiteration: the sound of heaven’s spontaneity. These are the words of the perfected of the highest heavens, uttered by the spontaneous *qi* of the Brahma realm—not the fabricated sounds of the human world. Thus, its merit is unparalleled. Reciting it thus enables flight to survey the world below, and its merit is recorded. The Celestial Thearch chants from afar in praise, the myriad spirits offer courtly homage, and the body’s spirits attend the imperial chariot across the Three Realms. At this stage, the Three Worms hide in submission, the Six Thieves retreat in concealment, demonic hordes bow their heads, external demons instantly cease, ghostly essences perish of themselves, and inner delusions instantly vanish. Once karmic consciousness is purified and defilements are emptied, only the original nature and the True Unity remain.

The jade chimes’ resonance signifies the union of form and spirit in transcendence, where celestial music arises spontaneously. The ten directions’ hush signifies utter stillness without remnant sound. Rivers and seas’ silence signifies the love-river and sea of suffering both stilled. Mountains and peaks swallowing mists signify their inner solidity, where spirit congeals and breath settles. The ten thousand spirits trembling in submission signify the perfection of merit and completion of the Dao, where none fail to submit. The summoning of the host of immortals signifies the myriad spirits’ audience at the origin, gathering unbidden. Heaven free of defilement and earth free of demonic dust signify the quiescence of nature and the obscurity of emotion, merging with the Great Void. Profound wisdom illumining the void: *profound* denotes the secluded and boundless; *wisdom* denotes clarity without limit; *illumining* denotes unimpeded luminosity; *void* denotes limpid purity without end. This is what *Guanfu* calls the power of obscure penetration and luminous insight. At this stage of inner cultivation, the eight directions are thoroughly illuminated, the singular nature merges in fusion, vast enough to embrace the cosmos, subtle enough to enter the tip of a hair—all these are the wondrous subtleties of the supremely profound and minute, whose measure cannot be fathomed by any shore or boundary. This is called the vast and profoundly profound.

The vastness of heaven and earth, the multitude of the ten thousand beings, the crawling and fluttering creatures—all contain the wondrous essence of the singular spirit, each arising from non-being, all presaged by the Supreme Ultimate, the Five Phases, and *yin-yang* before attaining wholeness. The Supreme Ultimate’s singular root does not conceal itself amid the myriad differences, but returns to the origin of soundlessness and scentlessness, reverting to the Ultimateless. When the Heavenly Worthy expounded the scripture, he began by suspending a single precious pearl to unfold the ten revolutions’ wondrous meaning, wherein the secrets of the great Brahma and the mysteries of the elixir path are fully contained. In its conclusion, he yet feared that disciples might fall into the bias of sinking into emptiness or clinging to existence, and thus declared: *Profound wisdom illumines the void—vast and profoundly profound.* Herein lies the essentials of the entire scripture and the subtleties of the millet-pearl. How could any fabricated dharmas or images attain this? This is what is meant by *accord with emptiness and union with non-being*, reverting to the Ultimateless. It lies in returning to seek within oneself, where the numinous remains undimmed, heaven and earth are complete within me, and the supremely divine and wondrous Dao is attained.

chunks.original_text: 中篇合易火候之图 太极图合元始一炁全体妙用图说 混洞赤文，无无元上真，此所谓无极而太极也。 元始祖劫，化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根，上无复祖，惟道为身。 此所谓太极动而生阳，动极而静； 静而生阴，静极复动； 一动一静，互为其根，分阴分阳，两仪立焉。 五文开廓，此所谓阳变阴合，而生水火木金土，五諿顺布，四时行焉。 五行一阴阳也，阴阳一太极也，太极本无极也。 普植神灵，无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 此所谓无极之真，二五之精，妙合而凝，乾道成男，坤道成女，二炁交感，化生万物，万物生生而变化无穷焉。 元始一炁全体妙用之图，学士所当究索其意，则先天之道不谋而契，造化之妙可得而窥。 故儒者知幽明之故，周乎万物，原始返终，穷理尽性，得不昧死生之妙。 老氏则曰深根固蒂，长生久视，盖各有所宗也。 夫如是，何以致之？ 经曰：知其雄，守其雌，复归於婴儿； 知其白，守其黑，复归於无极。 此金液还丹之道也。 故能探根固蒂，长生久视矣。 按此观复之说，默庵先生取之。 青帝辛天君降笔跋默庵先生所书武昌卫钫本 经以心传，经以心悟，心悟心传，天人普度，以此存心，帝其汝顾，信受奉行，好事好做。 庚寅年五月辛天君降笔云：法子志专，信士诚信，感吾混元经教，吾故到坛。 大哉灵宝度人经，不是文章撰得成。 诸经劫坏应须坏，惟有斯文在玉京。 夫自古及今，上圣仙佛成道，未有不奉度人经法者。 诸经中，元始度人为上品经也。 经者，阳则起人善念，阴则开度幽灵，功莫大焉。 吾当以耳与子说，子当以口听吾言。 呵呵口听，是以六根互用处，混元之妙在此。 诸子等念《度人经》，还知玄妙否？ 人心即宝珠，元神即元始，神外无天尊，心外无道法。 欺心者昧天乎？ 念经之初，当摄万念归一，即元始召十方也。 正念诵经，即元始说经也。 情念识神，神不妄走，即十方听经也。 忘情绝念，便是寂无遗响处。 性清混一，真伪皆归，一志不分，久之自然纯熟，万妄归真，即天人受度也。 如此会得，自然到无色之界，万念之魔，悉归吾化，即真人也。 此是经中之旨也。 但念经不知此理，不摄念、不返真，虽日念万徧，於吾何益？ 至於炼度一节，犹难言也。 自不知经旨，何能度人乎？ 会得宝珠空悬，能敛万念归真，一志不动，如元始一时辰自到寂无遗响处，喜庆难言。 到此三界鬼神皆敬畏矣，一切幽灵皆受度矣。 夫祭炼幽灵，大功大德。 上古仙佛，皆是以修自己为功，度他人为德，方能功行两全。 吾乃雷霆吏。 吾昔於太古时，已成上道，后复身入雷司，驱风雷、致雨露、发生万物。 雷霆乃天之仗植，帝之威权，道之枢机。 生杀之权，雷霆主之，造化无穷，功莫大焉。 吾能生能杀者，由能行仁义故也。 仁为春官，发生万物； 义为秋官，肃杀万物。 助天地、行四时，代上帝掌世运，吾亦修功德不已也。 成道不济人，又何益於上帝？ 且如玉帝，万劫上道，犹主世运，况吾侪乎！ 诸子既入吾道法中，行当体此意。 诸子皆吾法中之白眉者，吾故谈论至此，非泄雷机，以惑汝之众。 诸子可专心修奉，吾在坛助汝道风。 此去汝若有灾，可专一志、奉一神、念一经，以保而已。

**The Middle Scroll: Diagram of the Yi’s Fire Phases**
**The Supreme Ultimate Diagram: Explanation of the Primordial Qi’s Complete and Wondrous Function in Its Entirety**

The Chaos of Crimson Script, the Perfect Real of the Non-Non and Primordial Above—this is what is meant by *the Ultimateless and yet the Supreme Ultimate*. In the primordial kalpa of the Origin Ancestor, the myriad heavens were transformed and brought forth; the Three Luminaries were illumined, forming the Root of Heaven. Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is its body. This is what is meant by *the Supreme Ultimate moves and generates yang; when movement reaches its limit, it becomes still. Stillness generates yin; when stillness reaches its limit, it moves again. In one movement and one stillness, each becomes the root of the other. Yin and yang divide, and the Two Modes are established.*

The Five Scripts unfold and expand—this is what is meant by *yang transforms, yin conjoins, and water, fire, wood, metal, and earth are born. The Five Agents arrange themselves in order, and the four seasons proceed.* The Five Agents are one with yin-yang; yin-yang is one with the Supreme Ultimate; the Supreme Ultimate is fundamentally the Ultimateless. Universally planting the numinous, without script there is no illumination, no clarity, no establishment, no completion, no deliverance, no generation. This is what is meant by *the true of the Ultimateless, the essence of the Two and Five, wondrously conjoined and coagulated. The Qian Dao forms the male; the Kun Dao forms the female. The two qi interact and transform, giving birth to the myriad things. The myriad things ceaselessly generate and transform without end.*

**The Diagram of the Primordial Qi’s Complete and Wondrous Function**—scholars must investigate its meaning, for then the precelestial Dao will unconsciously accord, and the subtleties of creation may be glimpsed. Thus, the Confucian, knowing the causes of the hidden and the manifest, encompasses the myriad things, tracing origins and returning to endings, exhausting principle and fulfilling nature, attains the wondrousness of life and death without delusion. The Old Master says: *Deeply root, firmly stem—long life and enduring vision.* Each has its own tradition.

How, then, is this achieved? The scripture says: *Know the masculine, guard the feminine—return to the state of an infant. Know the white, guard the black—return to the Ultimateless.* This is the Dao of the Golden Liquid Returned Elixir. Thus can one *probe the root, firm the stem—long life and enduring vision.* Following this doctrine of *observing and returning*, Master Mo’an adopted it.

**Postscript by the Heavenly Lord Xin of the Azure Emperor, Descended in Writing, on Master Mo’an’s Copy of the *Wu Chang Wei Fang* Text**

The scripture is transmitted by the heart; the scripture is realized by the heart. Heart realizes, heart transmits—heaven and humanity are universally delivered. With this heart, the Emperor will favor you. Sincerely receive and practice it—good deeds are well done.

In the fifth month of the *gengyin* year, the Heavenly Lord Xin descended in writing, saying: *Disciples are single-minded; believers are sincere. Moved by my teachings of the Chaos Primordial Scripture, I have come to the altar. Great is the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Delivering Humanity—it is not composed by mere literary art. All scriptures must perish when kalpas end, yet this text alone remains in the Jade Capital.*

From ancient times to the present, no sage, immortal, or buddha has attained the Dao without revering the scripture of delivering humanity. Among all scriptures, the Primordial Beginning’s *Scripture of Deliverance* is the supreme. The scripture—when yang, it arouses good thoughts in people; when yin, it opens the way to deliver hidden spirits. Its merit is without peer.

I shall speak to you with my ears; you shall listen to my words with your mouth. Ah! Listen with the mouth—here lies the mutual functioning of the six roots, the wondrousness of the Chaos Primordial. Do you, disciples, reciting the *Scripture of Deliverance*, yet know its profound subtleties? The human heart is the precious pearl; the original spirit is the Primordial Beginning. Beyond the spirit, there is no Heavenly Worthy; beyond the heart, there is no Dao or Dharma. Does one who deceives the heart not obscure Heaven?

At the outset of recitation, gather the myriad thoughts into one—this is the Primordial Beginning summoning the ten directions. Reciting the scripture with right mindfulness is the Primordial Beginning expounding the scripture. When thoughts of emotion and the conscious spirit do not wander recklessly, it is the ten directions listening to the scripture. Forgetting emotion and severing thought—this is the state of silence without lingering echoes. When nature is pure and undivided, the true and false both return. With a single, undivided will, over time one naturally becomes pure. The myriad delusions return to the true—this is the deliverance of heaven and humanity. If you grasp this, you will naturally reach the realm of formlessness. The demons of the myriad thoughts will all be transformed by me—then you are a true person. This is the essence of the scripture.

Yet if one recites the scripture without understanding this principle, failing to gather thoughts or return to the true, even reciting ten thousand times a day—what benefit is there to me? As for the section on refinement and deliverance, it is even more difficult to speak of. If one does not know the essence of the scripture, how can one deliver others?

If you grasp the *Pearl Suspended in Emptiness*, able to gather the myriad thoughts and return to the true, with a single, unmoving will, like the Primordial Beginning, in one hour you will naturally reach the state of silence without lingering echoes—joy and celebration beyond words. At this point, the ghosts and gods of the Three Realms all revere and fear you; all hidden spirits are delivered.

The refinement and deliverance of hidden spirits is a great merit and virtue. The ancient immortals and buddhas all cultivated themselves as merit and delivered others as virtue—only then could they achieve both merit and conduct in full.

I am an official of thunder. In the remote past, I had already attained the supreme Dao, then later reincarnated into the Thunder Bureau, driving wind and thunder, bringing rain and dew, and generating the myriad things. Thunder is the Heavenly Emperor’s staff of authority, the power of the Emperor, the pivot of the Dao. The power of life and death is governed by thunder; its transformations are endless, its merit without peer. That I can give life and take it is because I practice benevolence and righteousness. Benevolence is the office of spring, generating the myriad things; righteousness is the office of autumn, bringing solemn execution to the myriad things. Assisting Heaven and Earth, enacting the four seasons, acting on behalf of the Supreme Emperor to govern the world’s fortunes—I also ceaselessly cultivate merit and virtue.

If one attains the Dao but does not aid others, what benefit is there to the Supreme Emperor? Even the Jade Emperor, having attained the Dao after ten thousand kalpas, still presides over the world’s fortunes—how much more so for us!

You disciples, having entered my Dao and Dharma, must embody this intent. You are all the finest among my disciples, which is why I have spoken thus far—not to leak the secrets of thunder and confuse your assembly. You may single-mindedly cultivate and revere it; I will assist your Dao’s influence from the altar. If you encounter calamities hereafter, you may focus your will, revere one deity, recite one scripture—and thus preserve yourself.
